Reviews.Title: “El Taj Condo review”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time staying at the El Taj. It was more than we expected. The staff went above and beyond our expectations. The El Taj is in a perfect location, we could walk to anywhere we needed to go. The condo and the grounds were beautiful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Visit to El Taj between 23rd Feb to 4th March2012 - DTnST”
Reviews.Author: Daya T
Reviews.Content: We had a super time . Condo Hotels which operates EL Taj was excellent . This was our second visit , The condo was top class , spacious , with all facilities of a 5 star and more . Having WIFI , maids service , consierge and other facilities were excellent .Room service is so good. Conveniently located to all amenities . We have booked our vacation for Dec with a 3 Bed Penthouse , we love it .

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: paulyc54
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in room 341,everything you needed was furnished. The views from the patio were absoloutly breathtaking. All of the staff go out of there way to please you. We had breakfast most mornings and the food was cooked just as you ordered. It was so easy to get to the pool and beach from the unit. We walked to 5th ave everyday and enjoyed all it had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “fun change”
Reviews.Author: Simonandfamily
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at places like Banyan Tree Mayakoba for visits to the Riviera Maya, but decided to try El Taj for a change in scene. Glad we did. Staying at a place like the Taj is totally different. It's a city trip instead of being out in the middle of nowhere. Nice condos, and a fun atmosphere. Maybe a bit too tight, with a small pool and chairs close together, but having all of Playa Del Carmen at your fingertips is fun. PDC has morphed into a full blown wild scene. Much more to do than staying at some AI or isolated resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MSCouple2
Reviews.Content: We visited Playa Del Carmen for the first time for my birthday with my brother and his wife. We stayed at the El Taj Oceanfront. It was beyond fabulous! The breakfast was awesome and the complimentary beach chairs were so comfortable. We loved our condo and it was so close to everything on 5th avenue. We quickly caught the ferry to Cozumel for a day trip. I can't say enough about this condo hotel - room service was great and inexpensive as well. Seriously - best vacation ever!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: nexcool
Reviews.Content: This was the third trip for us to Playa Del Carmen in the past year. We met friends for 4 days - enjoyed the comforts of the beach club- service was courteous. There are more new restaurants on 5th avenue this year.We stayed in 329- 2 bedroom condo with wonderful ocean views. The rooms were spacious and the unit has all upgrades and furnishes stylishly. Having use of two wonderful pools was helpful as the beachside pool was often serene and had less guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Condo”
Reviews.Author: Irish4052
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the El Taj. We stayed in room 344 and loved our condo which was ocean front. We thought the condo was very spacious and comfortable. The kitchen had what we needed and it was nice to have a washer and dryer. We did not have any problems with any noise from the nightclubs. The beds were a little hard so we put one of extra comforters on our bed to help make it a little softer. We were not crazy about the foam pillows either. The location of the El Taj is great so close to all the bars and restaurant's. When checked in they gave us a discount card for restaurant's in the area. We would recommend Yaxche which was awesome and we received a discount. The breakfast buffet was good but not great. We had a very pretty view from our balcony. We enjoyed the hot tub and it was clean and worked great The beach was area is a little small because of the location and shape of the property at the El Taj. They have alot of beach chairs placed really close to each other. We walked down the beach and layed out by the Wah Wah Beach Club to have a little more room.They will provide you chairs for free and we bought a couple of drinks. Oh we had really good pizza there that they brought a table and served on the beach.Even though the beach is a bit small, we really enjoyed our trip to Playa del Carmen and the El Taj..

Reviews.Title: “Great plays to stay in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: CrystalSeattle
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at El Taj. When booking this trip, I knew it would be more of a boutique hotel (not the big all-inclusive style you see in most of Mexico). I was happy with the location of the hotel and the ammenities (Gym, Beach, Free Breakfast, Excursion Coordinator.) If we go back to Playa I would stay here again. It was nice to have security that asked us if we were staying there - it made us feel safe (contrary to all the police with huge machine guns walking around the town.) My one complaint would be the door locks in our condo. We stayed in 303 and the "lock" was seriously a hole in the door that you open with a screw driver looking key! We didn't bring any serious valuable that we couldn't fit in the safe, but still -even with the door "locked" with a good shove I could totally open the door that should be locked. Lucikly we didn't have any problems but when we asked the front desk if we could change rooms they said no. Our room was not in the beach side condos but the ones across the little street. We actually liked this because there was a nice quite pool and hot tub outside out room that we could use at night. The service at the beach was great - we were always able to get a chair (except when we showed up at 3pm after an all day excursion) and the service was nice. Drinks and food were reasonable so it made it easy to sit at the beach all day! I organized transportation to and from the airport through BestTransfers. It was $105 USD round trip for 2 people which was a good deal. They were timely and we were happy with their service. If I could recommend an excursion - try the Rio Secreto! It was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: chnkylvr
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to have found the El taj. It is steps away from the beach, but far enough away so that you dont hear the house music from all the clubs. The room was amazing, we had a separate living area, and kitchen, well maintained and very spacious. Every morning my SO and i walked to the private hotel beach area, sat under the canopies and ordered cold beers from the friendly staff. The hotel staff recommended some amazing locals restaurants. One of which was El Fogon, you must go there..

Reviews.Title: “beautifully crafted condo”
Reviews.Author: conniebc
Reviews.Content: A beautifully crafted condo. This was the most comfortable place we stayed on our trip. Good beach club experience too - laid back restaurant with great food, music but not too loud, and easy to get a beach bed and umbrella with great food and drink service. As advertised, a fairly quiet oasis from 5th Ave. Our unit (#327) was right beside a nice spa tub with amazing jets and an ocean view. A downside of this unit was that it was not very private - people, mostly workmen, were walking by all day. But it wasn't a big deal. The beach itself has moored boats right in front but you can stroll down the beach a couple of minutes for swimmable areas. Sandy, no shoes needed. Playa on the Saturday of a long weekend was Party Central, but it calmed down a bit by Monday. Good restaurants - we especially liked Casa del Agua.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: Kristen D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Playa Del Carman last week to celebrate his 30th birthday. We stayed at the El Taj Oceanfront & Beachside Condo Hotel and we weren't disappointed. The staff was very courteous, informative and friendly. Miguel and Manual were very helpful with any questions we had throughout our trip. The location of the condo was perfect, because it was right on the beach and in the middle of the town, so it was easy to walk everywhere. The landscape surrounding the condos and pools was beautiful. The condo was very nice and updated with a great patio to enjoy the view. We would definitely return to El Taj.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Luxurious Amenities on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: eventjubilee
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend at El Taj recently and had an amazing experience! Our condo was state of the art, beautifully decorated, comfortable and had gorgeous ocean views. We loved the beach front with it's comfortable beach chairs, lounge chairs, and tables in the sand where you can eat lunch, breakfast and dinner. We found the service to be prompt and friendly and the food and drinks to be delicious! We visited a lot of areas in Playa and El Taj is BY FAR the most BEAUTIFUL hotel on the beach. People would walk by and stare up at it it's so gorgeous!! I highly recommend staying here if you are looking for a private, luxurious experience right in the heart of Playa Del Carmen and 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, wonderful.....”
Reviews.Author: pnadel
Reviews.Content: This is not my first trip to Playa but staying at El Taj was one of the best experiences I've had. The help was courteous, informative and fun. The restaurant and breakfast was great. The setting is beautiful. The location is smack in the middle of a town with plenty of night life, shopping and areas for relaxation. If you cannot get a reservation at El Taj, use one of the other Condos managed by the same group. I've stayed at Porta Playa, Maya Villas and Villas Sacbe. All of these establishment are clean and comfortably furnished. Maid service is excellent. Can't say enough good things about the vacations Playa has given to me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie W
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner chose the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and weren't deceived! We loved it. Beautiful spacious and renovated rooms and beautiful surroundings. The breakfast was not top though. I would say it was the best looking hotel on the beach. The reception was very professional and nice. We felt very welcomed there.

Reviews.Title: “El taj is a very special place”
Reviews.Author: jac987
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect....the condos are beautifully furnished...the service is wonderful, and the staff are kind, thoughtful and smiley! I have been to Playa before, and as a fan of small boutique hotels, I will add this to one of my favorite places to stay. Can't say enough good things about the guys at the beach club, who somehow know everyone, and do an amazing job of making you feel taken care of, but not intruded upon. The only hesitation I have is the beachfront - it is, as mentioned in other reviews, not ideal. The fishing boats are directly in front of the hotel leaving just a sliver of beach to walk in - and in general, the beach on this particular part of playa is fairly narrow, and not easily swimmable. Nevertheless, a 5 minute walk gets you to a lovely swim, and for us, the beauty of el taj in general, and the location made it an ideal place, and one which we will happily return to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull condos and the best location”
Reviews.Author: ricasares
Reviews.Content: I will start with the bad things first: Beach. The beach is full of fishing boats, for me this is not an inconvenience but the water in front of the hotel was dirty/brown not blue/clear. You can walk to left or right of the beach and the is better. Breakfast. The breakfast was complimentary during our stay it was very good, but it open at 8:00 am. I missed breakfast two days because I needed to go before 8:00 am. Clubs noise. I was in condo 311 at beach side property. The noise is not loud, you can sleep easily in this condo. The noises sound far and if you turn on the fan of the AC the sounds are muted. The units are awesome, very clean and spacious. The property is really beautiful and well maintained. You will impress when enter to this place. Every room has a private balcon nad is very spacious. I liked more the beachside property because its more jungle themed and private than the oceanfront. The pool in the Beachside was very private and bigger compared to the pictures. What stand up is the location, you can walk to almost every place in playa. The 5th avenue is only two blocks, and the best clubs are 1 block from El taj. We go out every night for dinner and drinks, everyone can get drunk and walk way back to the hotel. Walk for one great chocolate at Ah Cacao and much places around.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE, FISHING BOATS & INCONVENIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: rwalker2018
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of great qualities about this property -- the condos are spacious, modern and very clean. The grounds are beautiful, the pool is well kept and it's conveniently located near the many great restaurants, bars and shops of Playa Del Carmen. So what's not to like? I'm glad that you asked. Let's start at the beginning -- that photo you see at the top of the page is not even accurate. It should have 30 fishing boats tied up along the beach. That's right, to enter the water from the beach ANYWHERE in front of the property, one must walk out in between dirty, smelly fishing boats. Those fishermen really seemed to be hauling in some impressive catches too. In fact, in spending a few days sitting in the beach chair one will see tons of huge fish being dragged up from the shore. Of course, one will also see their decapitated heads and rotting guts being dragged back down. One day, we even saw a bunch of heads and guts being thrown right back into the ocean from the shore. Needless to say, no one in our group got into the water. Many others have commented about the night club noise. Be advised -- this is 100% true. It is so loud that the A/C and fan going do not even come close to drowning it out. This doesn't just go on until midnight, 1 or even 3 AM. On our last morning there, our friends got up early to go see the sunrise and the club was still bumping at 6 AM. The level of service and convenience provided is also not up to par - takes forever, incorrect orders (or just meals missing altogether). Strict 8 AM towel and chair rule - so don't think you're going to be sitting on the beach any earlier than that. And you must always carry your wallet on you -- nothing can be charged to your room (not even room service), so you must always have some cash or a credit card on you at all times. So to recap -- this could be a fantastic property if they would move all the fishing boats away from the beach, make a deal with the night club owners or install sound proof windows, and add some convenient services like allowing guests to charge things to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Unrestricted luxury”
Reviews.Author: Livelykirk
Reviews.Content: I have been to the El Taj twice and cannot say enough about the property and staff. El Taj is stunning to behold, the staff is professional. The rooms are beautiful with great views nothing was left out, it feels exotic! We have rented the penthouse both times well worth the price. The location to 5th ave cannot be beat. You are in the heart of Playa without the noise and crowds. Excellent beach setup with beds and recliners its living at its best! I will be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: NegrilSalute
Reviews.Content: We chose this unit after looking at most of the condo developments on or close to the beach in Playa Del Carmen. My wife and I were wanting to rent a condo or house. We had another couple joining us so this 2 bedroom, 2 bath met our needs. We decided on this unit due to the good reviews, the location as well as getting a very good rate through Greg (the owner)on VRBO.com. This development is nicely designed, furnished well and located within walking distance of all of 5th Ave. The management team was very responsive though I will say we are fairly low maintenance travelers. The management team and security personnel almost all spoke english well. Prior to leaving we had heard of some issues with loud music at night from the surrounding open air bars. This may very well be a huge issue for those seeking peace and quiet but I can honestly say it was not a big deal for us. We turned the A/C fan switch on at night and this muffled the noise enough that it was not so bothersome. I also understand management is attempting to resolve this issue through various means. Beyond this issue everything was as good or better than anticipated. This unit (Beachside) is not right on the beach (we knew that) but has a very nice heated pool and jacuzzi that we mostly had to ourselves. In some ways the location of this particular condo is better than those in the Oceanside portion of the development, particularly if you desire a little privacy. The beach is only steps away. The patio area was a real treat and having the ability to have other friends who were in the area come visit us at the condo was a big bonus. The house keeper also did an excellent job. We used the associated beach club several times and were pleased with the offerings and service. For those wishing to experience Playa Del Carmen on there own without the encumberance of an all inclusive I highly recommend El Taj and in particular condo 305. Greg was easy to work with, gave us a great rate and even followed up with me after the trip was over to see how things went. I highly recommend this unit and will stay there again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bbaers
Reviews.Content: Very nice room,excellent service,good location. Some music could be heard early mornings, but wasn't really a problem.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj is great!”
Reviews.Author: jkinsley
Reviews.Content: My family had a fantastic time at El Taj Ocean. We stayed for 9 days in room 348. It had two bedrooms, which let us put the kids (ages 2 and 4) to bed early without having to tiptoe around. El Taj Ocean is 2 blocks from 5th avenue but very quiet at night. It's a perfect location. The hotel is near perfect -- gorgeous property, very well furnished, perfect location on the beach and close to all the best stuff in Playa. The staff was very friendly. We'll certainly go back someday. A few notes: Crib rental is $15/day. We brought out own portable crib to avoid this charge. Wi-fi service is $50/week ($70 for our 9 day stay). Wi-fi service was spotty and frustrating, and I couldn't use it reliably. I had their IT guy up to the room 3 times to work on it, but no luck. There are some fishing and scuba boats moored right off the beach in front of the hotel but not really a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “EXQUISITE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nora H
Reviews.Content: Took a two week trip with my family to El Taj. We stayed in room 339 that overlooked the ocean, and it was just exquisite. The condo was luxurious - modern, pristine - with beautiful artwork and luxurious detailing/furnishings. We had a hot-tub on the balcony as well as lounge chairs where we could sunbathe. There were three bedrooms and bathrooms, and all of them had granite and marble showers and lux bedding. The developer that built El Taj traveled all over Bali to bring back these beautiful carvings and unique pieces. The beachfront is THE place to be in Playa del Carmen. Beautiful people, a wonderful oceanside restaurant, massages on the beach. The pools are top of the line - the pool by the ocean has a waterfall and massage jets - all in white opalescent tiles - with balinese statuary. The other pool is like a secluded oasis - jet black tiling, infinity pool, koi pond - admist lush, exotic vegetation. The El Taj is the most gorgeous hotel I've ever stayed at, and we are definitely planning on going again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: WGlenn
Reviews.Content: No problems here. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The music from down the road was a little annoying when trying to go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Jessica Q
Reviews.Content: Absolutely recommend this place. Bali theme is gorgeous. Great location. A little noisy at night if you like to go to bed before 9pm. Pools are both great and beach area is right in the heart of Playa.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj is El Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: albertabound55
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days in El Taj with friends and had a wonderful, wonderful time. By way of background, my wife and I typically stay at all-inclusives and have done so in Playacar, Cancun, Cabo and PV. So, we approached this vacation with a few concerns as it was outside of our comfort zone. Well, no more! I don't believe we have ever stayed at a more perfect resort than El Taj. We had incredible accomodations. Unit 345 is on the north side of the resort (more on that later) and is a three bedroom penthouse suite. The interior of the suite is first class, with lovely furnishings, artwork and appliances (all Bosch in the kitchen). There are 4 TVs in the unit plus a washer/dryer. Tile floorings, individual AC controls in each room and high end towels and sheets just add icing to the experience. Note: I believe that all of the units at El Taj are maintained to the same high standard. And, the views of the ocean from inside our unit or on the private balcony!! I thought this was enough but then we see that this unit has a large private deck upstairs with your own palapa, jacuzzi, barbecue, fridge and outdoor shower. This left us speechless - the views and ambiance are over the top. And, that was just the unit - El Taj has two beautiful pool areas ( you can use either the Oceanfront pool or the Beachside pool) and a jacuzzi pool. The exterior lobby/common areas are designed with an elegant Thai theme which is prevalent throughout. And, a restaurant on the beach! - something that I really value. You also have free access to a first class gym, for those of you that enjoy working out. We should also mention that El Taj Oceanfront has elevators. As we were travelling with friends that knew Playa del Carmen well, we really enjoyed the short walk to 5th Avenue and beyond, enjoying many of the fine local restaurants. Frankly, we did not miss the all-resort dining experience in the least. We would like to clarify some comments about the resort. One reviewer indicated that the water in the resort is not drinkable (complained about this and had to use the water dispenser supplied by the resort). The regular tap water in the unit is completely safe and I suspect that the dispenser being supplied by the resort to every unit is just another example of how far they go to make sure you enjoy your stay. Secondly, there have been some legitimate complaints about noise from the nearby nightclubs. No doubt they crank it up to ridiculous levels in the evening but we did not have any problems with this. As we were on the north side of the Oceanfront condos, on our balconies we only heard a very faint bass thump, and while inside the condo we heard nothing. I am a very light sleeper and had many a peaceful sleep during our stay. And, a hearfelt thank-you to all the staff - very friendly and professional. They work very hard to make sure your every request is satisfied. I could go on and on, but, in summary, this resort has earned the high praise it receives. We can't wait to return. And, to our travelling companions, thanks for sharing your local knowledge with us; but beware - you may not have seen the last of "Gerard"!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful week away at the El Taj”
Reviews.Author: coolango
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself just spent a week at the El Taj oceanfront condo hotel .We had seen this place last year and thought it looked nice.Well it was amazing!From the staff in the condo to the wonderful waiters on the beach at the indigo beach club.We received comp. breakfast on the beach everyday.pretty nice way to start the day!Our condo was great.#327.The hot tub was right outside our door overlooking the beautiful pool and the view of the beach was great.We loved the location 5 th ave is very close.Great reastaurants,bars,shopping and night clubs are so close.There are always warning about tourists to be careful We never felt unsafe at all.If you decide to go to El Taj try this little bar that is literally right outside the El Taj front doors.It is called Ummagumma Bar.We saw it our 3rd night and went for a drink each day after and finally spoke to the owner Angelo.Very nice guy.Was only open 3 months so far so hopefully when we return he will still be there!Margaritas are very good!The indigo beach club has amazing food so we ate most lunches on the beach. loved it can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in December”
Reviews.Author: DrewFLHR
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at El Taj in December 2011. The resort is BEAUTIFUL! Our condo was large, on the ground floor, by the pool and the beach. The room was kept immaculate by the housekeeping staff. We loved having more room than a standard resort room at one of the all- inclusives. Daily Breakfast on the beach was a great way to start our day. Sitting in our clean and private poolside jacuzzi at sunset was awesome. I will never stay at a Playa all-inclusive again - this place has bigger rooms, better location to 5th Avenue and why get trapped eating mass- produced food at the all-inclusives when you can get a great meal for cheap on 5th Ave (for examble: Carboncitos!!!). We have been coming to Playa for 20 years, staying at a different place each time, but have settled on El Taj as the perfect combination of luxury, location, and staff. Special call-out to Juan Carlos down by the pool/beach club. He is a great guy who took care of our every need, sometimes before we even knew we needed it. We found the front desk to not be too responsive during our stay but Juan helped us every time we needed anything. Pros: Location on the beach but still close to the best part of 5th Ave. the north end of 5th is getting better and better. Resort is beautiful with plenty of condo elbow room - at night it's gorgeous but be careful on the stairs if you have had too many cervesas on 5th Ave! Resort cleanliness - great. Breakfast on the beach. Juan Carlos as mentioned. Beach walks, especially north. Included Health Club/ Gym is a real club with tons of equipment, free weights and classes - not some sweaty little room in a resort with a couple of lame treadmills. Two bathrooms. Cons Noise as others have mentioned on a couple nights - North side rooms are probably a little better - use your AC for white noise and the new windows that are being installed will surely help. The beach had been recently hit by a storm when we were there but I've heard it has been fixed/ leveled since then. I would recommend El Taj to anybody who wants to step up from the all-inclusive scene while still staying on the beach in a great place. We can hardly wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unique once in a life time experience – Unit #347”
Reviews.Author: Bruno P
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Playa del Carmen, consequently our first stay at El Taj was one to remember. The amenities are impeccable; the staff is warm, welcoming and very professional at what they do. The resort is the most beautiful for miles around; everyone would stop to take pictures of the building. Unit 347, in particular offers a nice balance in terms of price/view/quietness. Everything is close; Private beachfront at 30 feet, dozens of clubs and bars at a 3 minutes walk an the animation and busy jet set life of 5th avenue at a 5 minutes walk! For our full week of stay, we felt like royalty, well worth every penny paid for this condo unit. We are already planning a trip back next season.

Reviews.Title: “don meyer”
Reviews.Author: donmeyer506
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed EL TAJ Beachside condo 314 the owner sandra has a beautiful condo. I enjoyed and will stay again sandra has it decorated beautfully and has great taste. Thanks sandra!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “El Taj Oceanfront-Perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: Alipa2012
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect vacation at El Taj Oceanfront! Everything at this property is a five star experience-from beautiful design of the rooms and a complex itself to a great service and fantastic personnel. The atmosphere is serene, with luxurious surroundings and all of this right on the water, next to the best beaches and 5 minute walk to best restaurants, shops, cafes. We would like to thank all the hard working people at El Taj for making our vacation so perfect. Special thank you to its General Manager, Ken Schmidt who is doing a terrific job and sets very high standards, and to Buigas Travel that made a booking for us and were a pleasure to deal with. We are already looking forward to return to this magical place!

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: MrMarcos
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at El Taj for seven days. It was simply the most elegant hotel or condo we have ever been at. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom unit. They were beautifully appointed with amazingly comfortable beds, terrific closet and storage space, vessel sinks, and marble tile. The living room area was a huge comfortable space that connected to the kitchen/dining section, containing stainless steel Bosch appliances. The terrace area provided turquoise ocean views. A table and chairs for sitting or dining, and the hot, hot, hot tub, made this a favorite hang out. The beach club contained lounges, large comfy beds and umbrellas - all included as guests of El Taj. It was interesting to watch the reaction of the beach walkers, as they past in front of the hotel. Many would stop, stare and comment on the beauty of the complex. There was also a multi-level pool that had seats with whirlpool jets at the top, swimming at the bottom, and full ocean views all around. We had breakfast at the hotel's restaurant each morning, with tables and chairs set right on the beach. Breakfast on the beach, just a few feet from the ocean was a great way to start the day. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge and front desk people were great. One night we had them try to make a reservation at a nearby restaurant. The restaurant's telephone was out of service. The person helping indicated that he was done working for the day, and would stop at the restaurant on the way home and make the reservation for us. Twenty minutes later, he called us to confirm that it was done. Pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Carol E
Reviews.Content: The condo is absolutely beautiful inside and out. It's a retreat from the busy Playa del Carmen streets, but so close by to all the action when you're ready for some shopping or an after dinner walk. The breakfast at the hotel was terrific. The watiers and staff are fabulous. The beds on the beach are fantastic and the workers are there at the ready to set you up with an umbrella or bring food and drinks. The Gym was a terrific facility. Loved doing yoga there, hearing it all in Spanish. A special treat was Saturday yoga on the beach. Amazingly professional instructors. I was impressed. I didn't do too many classes because you have a beautiful long beach to walk and enjoy the warm climate. Get the internet package for $50 for the week which enables you to call the states for no charge. At night it could get noisy in the streets, but I put on my white noise app on my phone and it was no problem. This is a gorgeous facility. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “El Taj - January 2012 Review”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustgal01
Reviews.Content: Overall the experience that we had at the El Taj was very wonderful but there was one down point. We stayed in the Beachside 302 which is the largest unit (8 people) for ten days at the end of January. El Taj has a wonderful location in the city and the condo is great. It met all of our needs except for the need to sleep, and all of the balconies were great! Plus the jacuzzi at the top was wonderful. First the positives: - The staff is wonderful and very helpful and gracious. The concierge staff (Theresa and Eduardo) go above and beyond in helping to make your stay wonderful and filled with many activities. They suggested trips that we were unaware of and had them planned to perfection. We also dealt with the front office staff and management and they were friendly and very helpful and listened to our concerns. - The location is great- we were able to walk to the main streets and around town with no problem and we were right across the street from the beach. - The facilities were great! The pools were all amazing, the pool chairs were comfy and the lounges were so nice! The negative: - Most of us were unable to sleep due to the clubs in the area. The music is loud (very loud- like you are in the club) and starts around ten and doesn't end unitl 5am. We talked extensively with the front desk staff and they were able to provide us with earplugs and they insisted that they were doing as much as they can. I guess it is a governmental issue that they have been fighting for awhile and we weren't the first visitors to experience this. All four bedrooms were really loud and while the earplugs did help, it never cut the noise. While this is not the fault of the hotel, it would have been nice have an idea of this problem beforehand! I would say go and enjoy the hotel but be prepared about the noise at night! This was a great and relaxing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Reeps1984
Reviews.Content: We had our Wedding at El Taj on Jan 14th. Everything was just perfect from the room, the service, and anything else you could want. We stayed in El Taj beachside #315. This will probably be the nicest room I will ever stay in, but it was our wedding so we went all out. The room was unbelievable. full kitchen, 2 bedroom, 2 bath and best of all it had a rooftop terrace with a hot tub. El Taj is located right in the middle of the action in Playa Del Carmen. Only steps away from great restaurants, bars, and clubs. The restaurant at El Taj, "Indigo" is outstanding. One of the best steaks I have ever had. We had a large group of people stay at the hotel in several different units, so we were able to see a bunch of them. All of them were beautiful and all different in their own way. I can't say enough about the staff at this resort. Extremely friendly and really helpful. Special thanks to my friend Crispin at Indigo Restaurant. He really went above and beyond with his service at our wedding and deserves recognition. We will remember our stay here for the rest of our lives. Thank you again for everything,

Reviews.Title: “Recent November 2011 Trip”
Reviews.Author: carboncopy78
Reviews.Content: This review is a little overdue but stayed at the El Taj in November 2011 and I'd recommend it to couples that want to be close to the action. If you're looking for peace and quiet then this might not be your place. The hotel is located on the beach but it's not a swimmable beach that's right in front of it. If you walk 500 yards or so, you'll find a better swimming area. If you're into swimming in at the beach, the pool is overlooks the ocean and is a great alternative. The rooms were the best part of this hotel. They were spacious and tastefully decorated. I would come back just to sleep in the rooms. As for the location, it is near the clubs of Playa Del Carmen so the noise can go until 4-5AM in the morning. It's not too bad if you're a heavy sleeper. Like I mentioned before, if you're looking for peace and quiet, I would recommend another location but this hotel was in the heart of PDC and I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj Oceanfront is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: VRBWestRiverMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Playa Del Carmen celebrating my 50th birthday at El Taj. We went with two other couples, shared our oceanfront two bedroom condo with one couple and the other couple stayed in a unit beachside. We stayed in Unit 320 which is all the way in the back of the Oceanfront property. Although we could not see the ocean from every room the condo was so beautiful and elegantly decorated that it did not matter. Plus, we used the roof top for grilling, hot tubbing and sitting around having cocktails and from here you had a full ocean view! The master bedroom has a good size balcony with a table and 4 chairs. This faces the beachside property and has enough privacy to sit out with a cup of coffee in the morning and not be bothered. The spare bedroom has no usable balcony but a great view of the Sea. We had a full kitchen with everything you need and big living area. The unit also has a washer and dryer and TV's in everyroom. Unit 320 feels very private and we did not even need to close any curtains or blinds during our stay. The staff is wonderful! If we needed anything they were always there, extra towels, salt and pepper for cooking, shampoo etc. The concierge will set up all your excursions, dinner reservations etc easily and without hastle. I did not give this hotel an "excellent" rating only because our beach experience was not what we thought it would be. As I said El Taj is wonderful and I would go back to it in heartbeat but the beach club was a little loud and crowded. As some of the other reviews state you really cannot swim in front of El Taj. It is very shallow and speckled with fishing boats. Although it is not the fault of the hotel property the hurricane years ago really played havok with the shore line so just be prepared that this is the case. The pool at El Taj is beatiful but not alot of pool chairs. Although I cannot speak for the other units at El Taj I would like to mention that unit 320 is private and completely quiet during the day however it is in the back of the hotel and closest to the street so at night from about 11PM until 6AM (yes I said 6 AM), if you are a light sleeper you can hear the boom boom of the nearby clubs from the master suite and master bath. Our friends in the 2nd bedroom said they did not hear anything at all. It is very faint and if you are not a light sleeper I could truly say it may not bother you at all. Albeit I did another review of Playa Del Carmen that gives more detail on Playa itself (as it was our 3rd trip back) I did want to mention that the area has changed drastically since our visit 10 years ago. Strolling 5th avenue which is where all the restaurants, shops and nightlife abound has transitioned from peaceful live music to a techno and club scene. Most restaurants have open air dining and 5th ave is still the place to be however it has definitely become a bit more crowded and louder as I mentioned. The clubs I mentioned earlier in my review are not far from El Taj, they are open air clubs and ridiculousy loud. Yes, I am 50 but I also sing in a band and loud music does not bother me. One other thing I will mention for my Gluten Intolerant folks out there (or anyone who likes organic choices) there is a small deli by the beach club at El Taj that serves all organic freshly made foods including Gluten Free pastas, bread mix etc. They made us up some home made tomato sauce and grated cheese for dinner in the unit one evening. If you are someone who does not have to have the rock free sandy beaches that go on for miles and are OK with the techo nighlife that Cancun offers than El Taj will add that extra flavor to your stay. If you cherish the ocean swimming experience and quiet " bother free" sunning and cannot do without this on your vacation than this property may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Beth A
Reviews.Content: El Taj brings 5 star service to a whole new level. From the car ride from the airport to the service on the beach, the staff was beyond friendly and attentive. The food at the hotel is delicious, we ate breakfast every morning and went back for lunch twice during that week (Drinks not as much. They could do a bit of an upgrade on their bartender. Drinks were watery and not too good.) The rooms were fantastic and it was nice to have a private stairwell and elevator to each unit. There is a full kitchen inside and grill, sink and refrigerator outside (right near your own hot tub.) I was out there every night in the hot tub looking out onto the ocean. Each unit is somewhat private, so you don't feel like you are on top of the people next to you. The pool and beach are amazing, and when you walk down to look at the other properties on the beach, you are somewhat proud to call El Taj home.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable and luxurious value!!”
Reviews.Author: Marshall D
Reviews.Content: The El Taj is a beautiful unique condo/hotel in the friendly Mexican town of Playa Del Carmen. The staff at the El Taj is extremely professional and courteous. One can tell that this is done on a genuine basis. The great "vibe" is apparent form the top, down, meaning everyone from the owners to the bartenders are there to make your experience a positive one. The price is righ as well!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beach, fantastic resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: World class beaches and great nightlife. The Indigo restaurant was great as well as the beach club. Service was first class and the staff is great. The unit we stayed in was a beach front unit on the third floor, with views looking out over the palm trees and a hot tub on the balcony. The pool was great for the kids and there is a great gym down the street to keep your beach body in check. Has a very international feel and great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you want...”
Reviews.Author: Wellesley88
Reviews.Content: This is a very belated review since our family of five (children aged 8, 9, and 10) stayed at El Taj Oceanfront last Feb. This was our first trip to Mexico, and we LOVED it. The weather was picture perfect, the food fabulous (since we ate all up and down 5th Ave), and our 2 BR condo at El Taj was spotless, spacious, and even luxurious. The photos on this site are very accurate when it comes to the condo. The pools were very nice, both the oceanfront one and the beachside one (which is just across a narrow little street, really an alley). Our kids loved both. I know this is a review of the hotel, but what probably stands out the most from our trip, at least in my mind, were our snorkeling excursions to Tulum, Akumal, and Yal Kul lagoon (use Edventure Tours--awesome--and definitely pay for their photo services), and swimming with the dolphins at the Dolphinarium. But it was always wonderful to return "home" to El Taj. Pros: *It was so much fun to just walk to Fifth Avenue, just around the corner -- so many awesome restaurants, cute gift shops, and great mariachi bands wondering about, ready to play for your pleasure. No cars on the Avenue, just pedestrians. *The cute little beachfront restaurant (our stay included breakfast there) was very good. They have beach service, so I had a steady supply of margaritas any time I wanted. We ordered lunch on the beach on some days, and everyone enjoyed the food. *The units, as mentioned above, are clean and comfortable and very nicely appointed. Get one with a jacuzzi if you can. Cons: *The oceanfront condos are built in the shape of a U. Our unit was towards the back of the building, near the beachside units, near Fifth Avenue. And since Fifth Avenue is literally around the corner, the music from the nightclubs blasted all night long, right into our sleep. We had to wear ear plugs every night. With ear plugs, we were fine and got plenty of rest, but being awakened at 12am the first night was not fun. If you want to stay here, I think it's worth paying the extra to get an oceanfront unit, right in front of the beach, far from the music. *The beds are very hard. Apparently this is true of most beds in Mexican hotels. I'm determined to find a hotel in Tulum for our next trip that has more comfortable beds! *This is probably my second biggest gripe -- I like to sleep in on my vacations and did NOT want to have to wake early to stake out beachfront umbrella and chairs. I SPECIFICALLY emailed El Taj to make sure this was NOT allowed here, since it is accepted practice at almost all Caribbean resorts, and I was assured that this was not permissible at El Taj. Unfortunately, money talks louder than such policies. Not only did I see with my own eyes beach employees put "reserved" signs on the best beachfront chairs for guests who had slipped them money, but one guest complained loudly to me that an employee had actually tried to kick her out of a prime chair, which she nabbed early in the morning, claiming that it was 'reserved.' I also saw another guest, right in front of others, call over an employee by name, slip him money, and tell him that he expected him to have better seats saved for him the next morning. This is all fine if it doesn't bother you, and I really don't care about it on a principled basis. I just want a relaxing vacation and good beach chairs up front where I can watch my kids, and I don't want to have to bribe people or get up at 6am to get them. I'd rather they just sell those seats so that they can be officially reserved, instead of underhandedly reserved. *My biggest gripe is actually not about the hotel but the beach itself. I loved Playa del Carmen -- the water is blue, and the sand is soft. But as others have noted, the water right in front of El Taj is crowded with boats. Which also means more algae and debris. If you are just a sunbather, then you will be fine. But my kids and I love to swim in the ocean. I had no desire to go swimming between fishing boats, and it made me nervous to watch my kids do so. Also, there is a big drop off right where the sand meets the water, so that you can't really see your kids if they are playing near the water. Overall, I think this is a great, fun place for hip people who don't want to be stuck at a big resort. It really is hip, and it was fun people-watching (not fellow Americans--boring--but the more flamboyant and stylish South Americans). I think it would be great for families too if the beach were better. The accommodations (minus the hard beds) were so ideal for a family--plenty of space, a full kitchen, perfect cleanliness, etc. But I won't be returning because of the beach and the beach chairs. In the end, I want a beach vacation to have an awesome beach.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks of bliss in the Mayan Magic”
Reviews.Author: Rick W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at El Taj Oceanfront #339 for two weeks, I wish it had been four. We had friends join us for periods throughout the trip and everyone enjoyed the beachfront location, the beach club and Indigo Restaurant, the views, the staff and the wonderful things to do, right at your front door. From this unit, noise was nominal, there was a nice breeze and we could see Cozumel on the eastern horizon. This was a three bedroom, three bath unit so, we had plenty of room for our guests and their privacy. The design of this hotel is awesome, really. Architecturally, the design seems to afford most rooms a view of the ocean and the Bali inspired design seems to fit right in with the Mayan coast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ryden333
Reviews.Content: Truely an incredible place to stay for the week. I went with my family for four days and I would definetly recommend it! The condos were kept really clean. The food on the beach was really tasty. The service was amazing, everyone is really nice. It's a small "boutique" hotel with the best location in Playa. I felt like I was staying in a village, everything was pleasant and intimate. It was a truly unique experience, I'm so happy with everything and I miss it so much already. Take me back to El Taj. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Senorasally
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Taj for 19 days in January and were both pleased and disappointed by some of the features of this condo/hotel resort. First of all, the staff is extremely accommodating, whether you are checking in, at the beach club, or needing something from maid service. The rooms (we were in a 1 bedroom ) are nicely appointed (Bosch appliances) and very comfortable. (way too many doors in the bathroom area - it got confusing as to which door closed what). We did feel like we were in a bit of a fishbowl since anyone walking by could see us if the curtains were even open a little. The pool is not that functional since it is does not have sun on it and there is very little space to sit around it. The 'hot tub' is not hot (is actually part of the pool so same temperature) and we noticed people only went in it once. You have to go to the beach through a little gate where you are greeted by the beach club (Indigo) staff, which is nice but it would have been nicer to just a straight path from the resort to the beach. Even though you are in a 'condo' you are not allowed any food or drink at the beach unless it is purchased at the beach club, which gets pricey and annoying when you have your own groceries and alcohol. The beach is amazing with a never-ending stream of people to watch. With the full service at Indigo, you didn't even have to spread out your own towel (thanks Juan Carlos!). The location of this resort is premium and just a few steps from 5th Ave. Check out the Dirty Martini Bar just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: cbw35691
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 311 and loved it! El Taj has two buildings: a beach front building and another building across the street (which is where our unit was). I would have preferred to be beach front, but we got our walking in going to and from the beach a few times each day. Also, the building we were in did not have an elevator and could be an issue for someone who does not get around well. There are tons of steps! The unit itself was well appointed and had everything we needed. The front desk staff did an exceptional job and spoke very good English. They were always willing to help and were very friendly. There is security present 24/7 and they too are very friendly! There are two pools. One with each building. However there is minimal seating at both pools (there is little room for seating) and neither of the pools gets good sunlight. If you love the beach and plan to spend your time there, this is a great location. If you were hoping to lay in the sun beside a pool, this wouldn't be the spot I would chose. We loved the hot tub at our building and spent a lot of time there after the sun went down. I had a 1 hour beach massage at an adjacent property for $25 that was ok. They used drug store quality products and it was very sandy--I felt like I was getting an exfoliating treatment. I later had a 1 hour beach massage through El Taj and it was WONDERFUL! They did an excellent job and used high quality aroma therapy products and were well trained! The El Taj massage was $35 and well worth the extra $10! This location is VERY close to the night life in Playa, which is great if your plans involve staying out until the sun comes up! If not, you'll hear everything happening at the clubs from your room (including very loud music). Keeping your windows closed does help keep the sound out, but you can still hear it. It took us a few nights to get used to that, but once we did it wasn't a bother. We loved this property and would definitely stay there again if we could afford to. It is quite a bit more expensive than other hotels we have stayed at in Mexico, but at the same time quite a bit more luxurious. The service was outstanding and the unit was beautiful! This was our first trip to Play del Carmen (our 5th to Mexico) and I think we might have a new favorite spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: patkat24
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a sprawling resort, keep looking. This is a very unique and wonderful boutique style hotel. We immediately felt comfortably at home. The man who developed the property (Mike if I can remember?) made his rounds on the beach club every day to chat with the guests.The staff are fantastic, the room was high end and the entire property was spotless. The pool at the oceanfront is small and gets very little sun, but we didn't care because the beach was literally 40 feet from the door of our room. We went as a couple but as far as we could tell it was very family friendly (without feeling like a family resort). Downtown Playa is 2 short blocks away and the Mega Mart grocery store is only a 15 min walk. Also about a 10 min walk along the beach to the ferry to Cozumel. One heads up, if you use any of the complimentary Beach Club amenities then you must purchase beverages and food from the bar/restaurant. Which is not a huge deal, beer is only $3.50 a bottle and the food is great, just don't do what we did and buy a bunch of beer from the grocery store thinking you could drink it on the beach. We were there during the Xmas holidays so it was pricey for our budget ($490 per night/one bedroom), but if you believe you get what you pay for then this it's worth the splurge. We would definitely recommend the El Taj and we are already planning on going back.

Reviews.Title: “beachfront paradise”
Reviews.Author: ND92
Reviews.Content: Awesome condo hotel, truly beachfront, with tons of space, beautiful tile bathrooms/showers, granite counters, well-appointed kitchen. Great pool and five-star service. Centrally located - just a couple blocks from all the night life, shops and great restaurants on 5th Ave (safe to walk around). 15 min to Xcaret, and in b/w Cancun and Xel-Ha/Tulum (40 min from each), with easy ferry access to Cozumel. Penthouse units on top floors each have additional private rooftop balcony with grille and jacuzzi. Housekeeping washes the dishes in addition to usual and were very meticulous. Boutique hotel experience, yet laid back and comfortable while easy access to everything. Full breakfast (very good) is included, eat seated on the beach barefoot or inside... there is only one restaurant (breakfast and lunch with limited evening menu), but tons of other great restaurants within short walking distance. Grocery delivery is available, and can even pay to have one of the chefs prepare a preselected meal in your condo (extra charge). Catholic Mass 3 blocks away @ Church of Our Lady of Mount Carmel corner of 12 St and 15th Ave - 8p Sat; 10am, noon and 8p Sun... check times (may vary). Other guests we met who had stayed elsewhere in Playa previously felt they had found a gem at El Taj. We would love to return there; our kids didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Meredith G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo at El Taj in November 2011 for a friend's wedding. The condo's living area was spacious, and the kitchen was well-equipped. The rooms were a decent size, and the bathrooms were nice. The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful! The people at the front desk were always helpful and knowledgeable when anyone in our large group had questions, and everyone we spoke to who worked there was very very friendly. As other reviewers have noted, El Taj is on the beach, and has a neat beachside restaurant. The food was waaayyyyy better than I expected, too! I would definitely stay here again, if we go back to Playa del Carmen. AWESOME SPOT.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beaches and a fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: Brady M
Reviews.Content: Recently traveled down for my cousin's wedding... the place was MAGNIFICENT. The beaches in Playa del Carmen are beautiful! I'm so sad I didn't stay longer. The hotel is beautiful and tropical. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. Really hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “I am coming back!”
Reviews.Author: rizjag
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location,beachclub,staff,everything! Be sure to order the breakfast buffet...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and rooms but..”
Reviews.Author: eastbaygirl75
Reviews.Content: don't get me wrong, the property is beautiful but i expect better service for what you are paying to stay here. The staff is friendly but don't goout of their way to be helpful, the maid service was mediocre at best. The suites are brand new but when we arrived in ours, the rugs looked like they hadn't been vacuumed in ages and the dryer and washer never cleaned out as it was filled with sand. you have to pay for internet access which is ridiculous. the while the location is prime as far as being on the beach and close to restaurants, you pay the price with the sound of the clubs at night til the wee hours...all and all, i'd go again if i got another "deal" but would never pay full price to stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Condo Hotel - Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Irwin N
Reviews.Content: My wife, my daughter and I stayed at El Taj in August 2011, we were worried about the climate and possibility of hurricanes at that time of year, however the weather was really great that time of year. Lots of sun and cool sea breezes. El Taj is really an impressive facility. It reminds me of the high end all-inclusive resorts I have stayed at in places like Goa and Mauritius. We stayed in Oceanfront Penthouse Unit #345. There was a rooftop hot tub, barbeque and covered dining area. The view from the front and the rooftop was really breathtaking. We found that the interior for the hotel was really high end and made it feel like our home away from home. We were cooking and barbecuing almost every night and it was very relaxing. It was very quiet in the evenings as the windows are doors are high quality glass. We were also very close to 5th Ave as well as popular night clubs which were walking distance away. Staff at El Taj was really friendly and helpful. We booked several excursions, drivers, and other activities through them. Overall a great experience, I would return here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Best NYE and Bday Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Casey L
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the El Taj with 20 friends over New Years Eve. I had arranged a 2, 3 and 4 bedroom villa early in the year to accomodate everyone who had travelled from Australia to join me for my 30th birthday which i hosted on the rooftop of Villa 330, on New Years Eve. Teresa, Eduardo and William were more than helpful through the booking process and ensured everything was just how it needed to be. On arrival we checked into Villas 330, 312 and 302. The Villas were amazing. The accomodation and ammenities were all brand new and everything we needed was supplied, nothing was left out. Villa 302 was especially breath taking. The 4 bedroom, 5 level villa housed 9 guests very comfortably. The rooftop views were amazing, especially to watch the sun set whilst bbqing or using the jacuzzi. My 30th birthday party at villa 330 went off very smoothly with the help of hotel staff who had supplied me with a contact for a chef and bar staff. We comfortably threw a party for 30 people which went well into the early hours. Other guests were also very friendly and joined us on many occasions. We also spent alot of time at the bech club where the staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. Every thing during our stay was perfect, many guests quoting that it was there most favorite, memorable trip ever. We also met the owner of Villa 302 and the developer of the condo's who was very friendly and welcoming. Thank you to all the staff for helping to make my birthday and our group holiday one we will always remember. We will all be returning guests for sure!! Casey.

Reviews.Title: “No better spot in playa”
Reviews.Author: stephenj577
Reviews.Content: Just spent Xmas week at el taj. Beautiful property! Right in the heart of the town on a great beach..why stay at an all inclusive when this is available? Walking distance to everything..rooftop was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST of PLAYA-El TAJ”
Reviews.Author: Jay B
Reviews.Content: I've been to Playa several times and stayed at various resorts each time. I will only stay at "El Taj Oceanfront" from now on!!! Great location! Great rooms and decor! Great service! Awesome Beach club!

Reviews.Title: “A Must”
Reviews.Author: bob b
Reviews.Content: I just spent Christmas with my family at the El Taj 2 teen age daughters and my mother inlaw \joined us, so we booked a 3 bedroom it turned out to be perfect, very comfortable clean and fully equipied.The best part of our stay was the 5 star service we recieved from all of the staff at El Taj, my mother inlaw required a certain beach chair each day after the first day this chair was set up each morning in our favorite spot on the beach, my daughters wanted there chairs set up in a certain direction every day this was done umbrelas where repostioned etc. All of the service staff at the beach would greet you by name and work on any food or drink request no matter how big or small (2 teen age daughters). Just a couple of names to mention Krispin Kiki, Juan, Juan Carlos , CAPTAIN JUAN , Miguel , Eddy and of course our maid Marinea . The location is perfect for anything you may want bars, restaruants,shopping or just a walk (great walking town). We have traveled to many locations in the world and I must say this turned out to be a ten out of ten,we plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property, but has noise and other issues”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestBrian
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the El Taj Oceafront (Unit 357) in December 2011 and generally we were pleased. This is a small condo/hotel property in the heart of PDC. The property is charming, right on the beach and our unit was exactly as depicted. The pool is small and there were very few pool chairs (somehow this was never was a problem for us, but it might be for others). Across the street at the Beachside, there is another small pool that is very pretty and tranquil. So far so good! Now for the downsides. The tap water is not filtered, which surprised me. I've been to Mexico several times and hotel water has always been filtered. This was the first place where I had to use bottled water to drink, cook, brush teeth, etc. (they do give you unlimited bottled water, but still). And the noise. PDC has tons of clubs, which, even when empty, pump out huge amounts of noise. This was a bigger issue on the weekend nights we were there and less so on the weekday nights and generally it was not a big problem for us (although we could definitely hear/feel the bass from the clubs); however, it was a MAJOR problem for other guests while we were there, so be careful. The restaurant attached to the place (Indigo) charges outrageous amounts for their very lousy drinks, so skip them and get drinks elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: robynbayne
Reviews.Content: That is the most amazing group of beautiful people I have ever seen. Georgous people, amazing food and slept like a baby in those amazing beds. There is no reason to go any further than Playa Del Carmen. You can sleep , dance or party at the beach- It all seems to work. Sushi or Thin crusted pizza with arugula and drizzled truffle oil ---or the best burgers and a corona with lime. The gym has the greatest vibe. Cannot wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday for Extended Family”
Reviews.Author: sallyHeartsRocko
Reviews.Content: Our grown kids, grandson, mother-in-law and we all enjoyed our stay here. Unbeatable setting for walking to dinner or shopping, hanging out at beach, or walking to clubs at night. We stayed in units 344 and 349 - oceanside - everything was fine. Like being in paradise for a week.

Reviews.Title: “The style of the Ritz Carlton arrives in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Fred D
Reviews.Content: The attentiveness of the staff was only exceeded by the amazing foos at Indigo restaurant in the beach club and the cleanliness and style of the 2 bedroom unit we stayed in for the week. My wife and I travel a great deal with our children and we are all very particular about where we stay and where we dine... We were all extremely happy with our week at El Taj and want to come back in March with friends. The architectural design and high end finishes in our condo unit were truly comparable to a Ritz Carlton designed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey B
Reviews.Content: Went for a week during the the Christmas holiday with my wife and our 1 year old daughter. This place is amazing! Built as condos, so the rooms are every large and they have full kitchens. Showers were amazing. Flat screen tv's in every room and central air! Everything was very clean! This place is amazing! Located right in the heart of town and on the beach. The location doesn't get any better. The grounds are amazing - koi ponds and a heated pool and a jacuzzi. The beach club has the most amazing food: breakfast was a huge buffet spread with everything you can imagine and lunch was even more amazing. Service was also very good. We are definitely coming back here next year and will recommend this place to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: monica e
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time reading reviews of condo type hotels in the downtown Playa area. El Taj received by far the best reviews so we decided on this venue. It was perfectly situated to downtown and the beach. Couldn't have been in a better location. Wanted a condo that had two separate bedrooms plus cooking facilities. This was perfect. Large rooms, fans in each, separate air-conditioning controls, beautiful bathrooms, lots of windows but creatively landscaped to allow privacy. Large, comfortable family room, kitchen and eating area. Beds were very comfortable. Kitchen had all amenities. You can choose the amount of housekeeping service you need for each day. Wash/dryer was a nice addition. Cleaned all the clothes before going to our next location which we didn't like nearly as much. El Taj had good HVAC system so it was perfect temperature and not at all humid in the rooms. Pool was smaller, but we expected that from the photos. Nice for a family because the kids could be in the pool area and adults on beach without getting lost like an all inclusive! Pool at the condo hotel across the street (part of the same organization) was bigger and could even get some laps in. Fun to be able to run across the street and use that pool too. (Hot tub there, but not at El Taj) Yes, loud at night with the Blue Parrot so close, but we left bathroom fans on for white noise and had no trouble falling asleep. Excellent, personalized service from the staff. Lots of people working the small lobby, grounds, towel service and beach service. Friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Large & Reasonable But need Earplugs at Night”
Reviews.Author: dmhdf
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at El Taj because I was specifically looking for updated, spacious, affordable accommodations for a family of 4. Our Son who is 15 & daughter 17 have outgrown sleeping in the same bed in a double room, however they don't mind sharing a room as long as they have their own beds. Our decision was to either get a suite or 2 hotel rooms at a large resort outside of town, or rent a condo in town. After comparing costs and location, we opted for El Taj because it seemed very reasonably priced for what you get and it is right in town within walking distance of the ferry and everything else. Upon our arrival, we realized that our unit (# 314) was in the beachside building, which means it is across the street from the beach. This isn't ideal, but it didn't really bother us because we were not in the room that much. The staff was very pleasant and check-in was quick and easy. When we arrived, the air in the master bedroom was not working, nor was the ceiling fan. They fixed the air within 10 minutes and replaced the fan within two days. The hot water heater temp was also set too low for the 4 of us (one shower every 30 minutes). They adjusted this for us on day 2. The staff was quick to react to any problems we had and we were given free wifi for our troubles. The staff worked very hard to make sure we were happy. We absolutely loved the close proximity of El Taj to Fifth avenue. There are many shops, restaurants, and bars along Fifth, and Starbucks is only about 4 blocks away. We also ran every morning along fifth. Our two favorite restaurants however were not on Fifth, they were across the street from the Mega food store. El Fogon was so awesome! We ate there twice. La Cieba (around the corner from El Fogon) is also a great place to eat breakfast. They have the best Chilaquiles I have ever had. We took a dive trip in Cozumel through Phantom Divers which is just a block from the hotel. Our dive masters were first rate (the 4 of us were assigned to one dive master). The diving in Cozumel was superb. El Taj guests receive a 10% discount at Phantom, so we did a 2 tank dive in Cozumel for $72 each. The ferry ride is about 45 minutes each way and about $100 round trip for 4 people. There are also dive and snorkel trips in Playa that leave directly from the beach in front of the hotel. Bear in mind...Although it may look like it (it is a beautiful facility) this is NOT a luxury resort run by a national hotel chain like the Four Seasons, Fairmont or Hilton. We are spoiled and are used to the service and hospitality given at fine non-inclusive, high end resorts. The amenities and service provided by the major hotel chains were missed. Not that these things were missing completely at El Taj, It is just a very different experience than what you get when the hotel staff is trained the same way across the globe. CONS: El Taj sits on a narrow strip of land that is very deep, which means that the square footage on the beach is very small, the beach density is a problem. The Beach Club is very much like something you would see in South Beach, a little like Nikki Beach, and it is not only open to El Taj guests. El Taj has a reciprocal membership with "The Gym" nearby, meaning El Taj guests can use "The Gym" and locals with gym memberships can use The Beach Club. Get a chair early if you want it, and don't leave your seat unoccupied for longer than an hour or so, or you will lose it. There are no drinks or snacks allowed on the beach unless bought through the restaurant. Breakfast lasts until 11:30 or 12:00 and they do not serve lunch until 12:30. At 11:30 while longing in my beach chair, I decided to pull out an apple to tide me over until I could order sushi at 12:30. That is not allowed! There is no place to swim in front of EL Taj because the dive, snorkel & fishing boats are all anchored onshore. The only place to swim is in the El Taj pool. Although the sheets were very comfortable and the mattresses very comfortable as well, BEWARE...the 2 largest night clubs in town, Coco Maya and The Blue Parrot are only one block away from El Taj. The music is VERY, VERY loud and rages on until 6:00 am every morning. The hotel should really hand out earplugs when people check in. Luckily, I had a whole bag of earplugs with me because my husband snores. I passed them out to everyone in the family. After the first night, the loud music was no longer an issue. I have tried many different brands of earplugs and the best ones are "Macks ultra safe sound foam earplugs". The drugstores don't carry them where we are, so I get them at Publix. I don't know how you deal with the loud music issue with young children. I don't see how you would be able to get a young child to wear earplugs? If you put them to bed by 7:00 or so before the music starts, maybe they would just sleep through it? Mine used to sleep through just about everything, including fire alarms. To summarize...Our stay was very pleasant. As long as everyone either stays out until 6:00 a.m. dancing, or wears earplugs, yours will be too!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to this fabulous place!”
Reviews.Author: Skye S
Reviews.Content: We visited Playa del Carmen and stayed at El Taj from November 30 to Dec 4 and it was such a great experience we can't wait to return! The condo itself was beautiful - even nicer than the pictures on the website depict. We had a two bdrm unit on the second floor with a partial ocean view, our own jacuzzi and washer/dryer and it was perfect. The staff there were so friendly and helpful and the manager Ricardo Perez really made an effort to help us feel welcome and comfortable throughout our stay. The Indigo Beach Club has great food and excellent service and the beach there has some of the nicest sand I have ever seen with gorgeous shells washing up on shore all around you. We traveled with our two children ages 4 and 6 and they loved being able to go so easily from the pool to the beach and the beautiful grounds. This hotel is also in a great location close to 5th Avenue shops and restaurants without being so close you have the noise or the street traffic. Great condo hotel overall! My only suggestion would be to request a unit on a higher floor as we did have some noise from the neighbors above us. I will say though that when we called the front desk at 2am to complain about it they sent someone up right away to ask the partiers to quiet down, and all was well again.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj was simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny G
Reviews.Content: El Taj has it all...it has beautiful and well equiped accommodations, it's very clean, great location (and so very close to 5th Ave), amazing service (certainly 110% better than ANY All-inclusive I have been to...and believe me, I've been to the best), fantastic food at the Indigo Beach Club, and a gym that rivals any top gym in the US! I traveled with my two daughters, ages 17 and 8 and my 19 year old nephew. We all loved El Taj and our 2 bedroom condo was great...we stayed in Unit 343. The view of the ocean and pool from our balcony was perfect! And at the end of the day, dips in our own private hot tub on the balcony was a must! And best of all, was El Taj at night time, when the lights go on, El Taj takes on whole different experience and can only be described as magical! Both the Concierge and this website did a great job recommending great restaurants and activities to do while we were there. I have to say, the VIP card El Taj gives you at your arrival was great and the restuarants that were on it gave us 10% off and were all delicious. Our favorite restaurant by far, was Da GiGi (the best italian and just walking distance from El Taj) we ate there once and they delivered a very hot meal to our condo too. Yes, the beach has fishing boats in front of El Taj, which in my opinion added to the ambience. But the boats are also spread out enough and no one I knew had any issues with swimming between them out in the ocean to the sand bars. This was a fishing town far longer than a resort town. I am a beach person!!! The lounges and beach beds were great and the sand was white, clean and soft. It seems like some people have to complain about something...even though this condo/hotel is literally perfect! I've been coming to Mexico since the 1970's and to Riviera Maya since the late 1990's and I've only stayed at the best All-inclusives and hotels. Not staying at an All-inclusive this trip and staying at El Taj and seeing what really good food, drinks and service at really fair prices could be...was far better than any All-inlcusive and most of the top hotels in this region. Yes, you should tip the staff here...but the great service makes it well deserved. The design of El Taj, with their imported architectural elements, tropical plants, furniture and art design from Bali sets this property apart from anything in Playa Del Carmen and my hats off to the developer, Jack Perlman, for doing such an amazing job and for literally not missing a beat! We will be back with more friends and family, and we have nothing but the highest regard for the entire staff. Thank you El Taj for making our vacation a solid 5 star and I look forward to coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “El Taj - 336 - can't wait for next year”
Reviews.Author: ctm_nj
Reviews.Content: Well, I waited on writing this review for a few weeks until the glow from the vacation had worn off and I could be a bit more objective about the hotel. But even now, about the only thing I would really change is to stay there longer. In short, we had an absolutely wonderful time. First off, we did our research – in addition to all the reviews here (thank you TA’ers) , we looked at other sites and really made sure that we were getting what we wanted. We had not been to PDC before, and wanted everything to go well. So first we looked everywhere, and when we settled on El Taj we booked through the company so that we knew what we were getting. We wanted the view, and that’s what made sure we were getting. (To respond to a previous reviewer, you got mislead by your travel company, not by the hotel. And to clarify about the “walk across the street” for those who have not been there, the street is a cobblestone street with barely room to fit two cars, with a traffic flow of maybe 15 cars an hour, and those traveling about 10mph. In addition there are doormen stationed on both sides. There is no safety issue. The entire trek to the beach is one small city block.) The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of PDC on the beach – a short couple of blocks we were on 5th Ave with all its choices for food and shopping. We booked unit 336, on the top level on the beach (as you are looking from the pool to the beach, it is the right hand wing). Yea, it’ll do. 3 bedroom, 3 bath, new construction, all the conveniences – full kitchen, plenty of cookware and utensils. Big bottled water cooler. The deck upstairs was also nicely done up – the built in sofa under a palapa, the lounge chairs, the Jacuzzi. Along of this was a nicely equipped outdoor kitchen with grill, sink, fridge, etc. The roof deck had reasonably good privacy and an AWESOME unobstructed view. Back to the main floor – everything is built very well, with a lot of attention paid to the finishing touches. It is tastefully decorated and maintained well. The master bedroom has an unobstructed view of the ocean, and is a good sized room with en-suite bathroom. All the rooms had TV and cable, and there were Homedock radios in the rooms. The other two bedrooms were done similarly, though the views were not as nice, but both with en-suite bathrooms and TVs and individual thermostats. (The third bedroom shares its bathroom with an entry from the hallway). All in all, the living areas had no real shortcomings – even the balcony had plenty of seating, whether for cocktails or breakfast in the morning. All, once again, with an unobstructed view of the beach and ocean. The service could not have been more friendly or helpful. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome. We checked in with Miriam and Ricardo and were given a detailed tour of the suite, in a friendly and informative way by Salvador. Almost every time we passed an employee of the hotel we were greeted with a smile and friendly “Hola”. The ladies who cleaned the suite – I remember Carmen - were always friendly, discreet and efficient. One nice aspect was the little wheel of choices on the door – we could opt from the simple just swap out the towels and make the bed to a full clean – and they would even do the windows!
