We availed ourselves of the spa services (Rosario and Beatriz), concierge (Teresa and William) for tours, Indigo for Dinner one night, and the beach club during the day. All were well run, the people were friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed it all. As for the perennial complaints of boats on the beach and noise from the clubs – the boats were there, but honestly I think they add to the charm. And for anyone to complain that they have to walk down the beach 100 yards to get into the water seems silly to us. The noise I can see being an issue for some, in honesty. We did hear the clubs some nights – our room was up high enough and along the outside wall so that the sound could reach it unobstructed. But between the central air fan, and my phone’s white noise app it didn’t bother us. But for those who are more sensitive, maybe a lower floor or the other wing would provide a little more shelter from the club music. We had a wonderful time in PDC in general, and a lot of that has to do with El Taj specifically. We are looking forward to returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at El Taj”
Reviews.Author: GB0u
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 weeks vacation at El Taj. We had stayed a few months ago in one of their sister properties called Porto Playa. We loved it so much that we decided to reserve at El Taj for our pre-christmas vacation. Our well equiped 2 bedroom penthouse with a spectacular rooftop terrace was the best part of all! Being 4 adultes in a 2 bedroom was just perfect, each couple having it's own private bathroom. The whole staff from maids to front desk are clearly there to make your stay pleasant and help you with anything you may need. My wife unfortunately got hurt in the first few days. The staff went out of it's way to help her in the stairs or getting to the beach. They even called a doctor who came to check her in the condo. Better service than doctors back home. I was a bit worried about the mentions about the noise but we realized that with the windows shut and the AC on you could not hear anything and we are both light sleepers. Overall we loved it and are already thinking of when will be our next vacations to El Taj!

Reviews.Title: “great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nicole f
Reviews.Content: I am a single mom traveling with 3 kids (16, 14 and 9). we had such a great week at el taj. the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. the beach club was beautiful and the staff was so nice! The food was great too! There was so much to do with my kids that we could have stayed another week! We went snorkeling with the turtles, zip lines, horseback riding, atv riding, jet skiing, swam in a few different cenotes. one day we rented a private boat from the guy on the beach out front of the hotel and he took us for 2 hours to the reef to snorkel. It was so much fun! El taj is also located so closet to 5th ave (the main strip) that every night we walked up and down the street. We saw reviews about noise but we did not have any issues with noise! we were in unit 323 and it was great!!! The grounds are beautiful. The yoga classes are REAL and not "resort" yoga classes for beginners. The gym was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: PlayaFamily
Reviews.Content: There are definite pros for this hotel. The grounds are beautiful and serene. The eastern accents give the feeling of being in the East. The apartments are modern and well appointed with all of the amenities you would expect from an upscale condominium. Certainly, if you are traveling with a large or extended family, this property provides you with an affordable means to stay in beautiful Playa del Carmen. Lord knows the resorts make it very difficult for families larger than four people. Now for the cons. Perhaps we have become spoiled, but for most of our visits to Playa, we have stayed at all-inclusive resorts. If you too have become accustomed to the resorts, you will likely be disappointed. The level service provided by the staff will not compare. You get the feeling that simple requests are an annoyance to the staff. Be prepared that the associated beach club has rules... Lot's of rules. Don't arrive too early. If you arrive before 8am, you will not get towels or chairs, even if the guy who gives them out at 8am is standing right there. Don't change your towels too frequently "Amigo" (apparently twice in one day was too much for them to handle). Don't leave your chairs for too long either, like when your breakfast unexpectedly takes too long. I don't generally like to be chastised on my vacations, but I guess that's what happens to you when you break the rules :). All of this rule enforcement just happened to be during a slow week when there was clearly no run on chairs or towels. I'm generally a fairly generous tipper, but I slowed them down mid-week. The biggest con however is the noise from the Disco's down the street. For three nights, until the wee hours of the morning we were subjected to thumping music that couldn't be drown out with the AC, the ceiling fan and a white-noise generator all going simultaneously. When I went to the office to complain (which isn't staffed after 11pm) I was told that I would have to wait until the next day when the supervisor is in, but was pretty much advised that there was nothing that could be done for us. All being said, read the reviews on this site carefully. Many people have had a very positive experience with this property, but there is enough discontent smattered through that you should at least be cautious and informed about your decision to stay here. If your are going to stay at El Taj, make sure that you get to select your specific room. Stay in the oceanfront building and on the north side to ensure that you are not exposed to the noise from the Disco. And don't expect the level of service that you get from many of the very fine all inclusives in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty But Noisy...overall disappointed. Choose the right building.”
Reviews.Author: C D
Reviews.Content: First, a word about how we booked this trip--foolishly through a "luxury discount" site--which means we got placed in the secondary building, away from the beach. We quickly realized our mistake, as there is a big difference between staying in the oceanfront and beachside buildings. We had a 2 bedroom condo in the Beachside building, which means a walk across a street with 3 kids and all their beach floats and toys. We could have dealt with that, disappointed though we were, but the NOISE is outrageous. Do not take a unit in the Beachside building unless you are prepared to be up all night with the sounds of club music in your bedroom. We have stayed in several places in Playa, both all inclusive and smaller boutique--this is by far our worst experience. During the middle of our trip, my young daughter got sick and couldn't make it to the bathroom, so we had to clean up the floor with used bath towels. We gathered them up and called the front desk to explain what happened and what did the person at the front desk say--that if the towels were stained we would have to pay for them! Not a word asking if our daughter was okay, just this notification about stained towels. We washed them ourselves. Meanwhile, we later tried to go out to eat and the people at the restaurant were more caring and concerned over our daughter than the person at the El Taj front desk. The hotel is lovely and kept clean and service people are generally lovely. But the beach situation is an issue. We've stayed at the Gran Porto Real and have, at times, had to walk to other areas to swim. But because the El Taj beach area is so small and we have kids, we couldn't ever have beach chairs nearby so the kids could swim. And with the pool behind the beach area and no view of the ocean, there isn't much for parents to enjoy while kids swim in the pool. The music beachfront is loud all day long (whatever happened to the joy in listening to the sound of waves?)--we actually went down the beach with our towels to a quiet place where the kids could swim and we didn't have to listen to booming music...but if one has to get away from the hotel area to enjoy the beach, what's the point of staying at that hotel? As a parent who comes to Playa at least once a year, I'd say your money is better spent elsewhere. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Brunch”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: We love El Taj, it's top drawer in every way, but we especially love the Sunday morning brunch.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj is First-Class”
Reviews.Author: Sandi W
Reviews.Content: El Taj is very upscale. The condos have granite counter tops, stainless steel Bosch appliances, marble floors & built-in cement sofas & box springs. This is the first time we had experienced this furniture & we liked it very much. The unit was exceptionally clean with everything a traveler needs for a comfortable stay. El Taj Oceanfront is located on the beach so is in the heart of all the action at Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at El Taj, part II”
Reviews.Author: Leon_le_professional
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at El Taj (Oceanfront), the first time being 7 months ago in May. Again, it did not disappoint. We stayed in unit #348 which was a 2 bedroom unit on the second floor on the north side of the U. This side is away from the clubs, and we never had any problems with noise. The unit is immaculate, as they all seem to be. Check-in and -out were very quick and easy, just as they were the first time. Everyone was super nice, especially Ricardo who checked us in and helped us deal with a couple of problems (not related to El Taj). The wall of sand is back and about 5 feet or so high. There are steps dug out in the wall every few meters, so you can easily get down to the water. The wall extends from just south of GPR (the all-inclusive to the north of El Taj) down to just north of the peer (the south peer), probably right around where BBBC is. So yes, it is also in front of El Faro if you are thinking about booking there. Supposedly the wall is a temporary thing and is slowly being leveled out by sand being brought back in by the change in current. At least that is what I was told. When we went in May earlier this year, there was no wall, so I assume it will level out between now and then. We used Indigo just about every day. Service and drink was always excellent. Be sure to try a Black Perl (a shot glass of Jagermeister suspended upside down in a glass of Red Bull). I had never had one before, but I saw another group of people having one and they looked so cool I had to try one. Anyway, the staff at Indigo work hard and we made sure to tip them well. El Taj does recommend a few restaurants and gives you a privilege card that offers 10% or more discount. We tried 2 of the recommended restauraints, Da Gi Gi and Casa Del Agua. Both were excellent. Da Gi Gi is on 5th ave but up around 34th, not 26th as advertised in El Taj's brochure. Also worth a mention is Alux - if you haven't been there, be sure to check it out. Even if you have a rental, grab a cab, it'll only be 2 or 3 $US to get there. The place was very cool, with little romatic alcoves that you could wander off into, sit down, be alone, and have a quiet drink. We originally just went for drinks, but enjoyed the ambience so much that we ate there too. The food was very good. Anyway, we fully enjoyed our second trip to El Taj!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Bahamamon
Reviews.Content: This place is special.I've stayed at th all-inclusives,and the small boutiques,luxury and budget. None compare or make sense after El Taj. Sure,a budget all-inc. will save a little money,but meals and drinks are barely tolerable.Boutiques are a little less but lack the ambiance, location and luxury of El Taj. A luxury all-inc. costs several times more and you will miss the amazing food served up everywhere in town. The bed is wonderful,unlimited filtered water,a full kitchen, stunning views and friendly staff means look no further,paradise found. mark.pursuingparadise@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “"Best Condo-Hotel in Playa"”
Reviews.Author: Diane L
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at El Taj Oceanfront. We loved it so much we booked for the same week next year!! I'm a retired Travel Agency Manager, so I tend to be very picky about the little things that many people miss..this place has all those little things. It's a beautiful, low-key property with hotel amenities. I think what sets it apart from similar properties is the service!!! Ricardo, Miriam, Erik, Salvatore..so many people that were beyond helpful. I'm sure I'm leaving out a few. The units are beautiful and well equipped. We stayed in a 2 bedroom Penthouse. It was beautiful, however we opted for a regular 2 bedroom for our next visit. The 2 bedroom Penthouses are towards the back, the views are not that great unless you are up on the desk. The smaller 2 bedrooms have the better views of the water....and if you have a family..make sure you splurge on the 3 bedroom oceanfronts....the views are amazing and worth the money. (we are only 2 people) They are a few things that are "down sides" to the property..if you can call them that. 1. Indigo restaurant is ok, but nothing amazing. The service is good. 2. The beach in front of the hotel is eroding, and many fishing boats are docked there. If you want to swim you have to walk a short distance. No big deal for us, but maybe if you have kids???? 3. The pool is a little small. Again, it wasn't an issue for us, but that may be for some. All in all, I would highly recommend this property!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in PDC!”
Reviews.Author: Tbouy
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful, striking property on the beach at PDC. Service from the front desk, housekeeping, security and Indigo Beach Club was very very good. The facility is very clean and the condo units had everything you might need and more. As breakfast was not included (I bet you can negotiate complimentary breakfast if you try) we bought some simple breakfast items at the Mega grocery, an easy walk of about 6 blocks. The beach is great for sunning but not much room for any beach sports, however, there is lots of room for that to the immediate north. The boats were not a problem but the slight "cliff" between the beach proper and the water line could be a problem if you did not see where some "steps" were created in the sand. Plenty of lounges and beds at the beach at all times of the day. Did not hear any noise from the local nightclubs at all. Stayed in a 1 bedroom unit (327) which was as close to the front as possible for a single bedroom unit, not really any better than units located further from the front so no need to pay any premium for this. Only 2 and 3 bedroom units are truely ocean front. There is a nice hot tub located across the street in the El Taj Beach side building we enjoyed every late afternoon. I would stay here again and may even spring for a larger unit than I need just to be ocean side.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay! Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: monydelgado
Reviews.Content: We're a family group between 21 and 30 years. We loved our stay at El Taj, we definetely wanna go back. Our condo was very clean and with a nice view. We hope to get back soon. The beach has a beautiful view to a pier and the ocean. It is also very near the 5th avenue where you can find good restaurants and night clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: sonriemini
Reviews.Content: Our group of four recently stayed at El Taj Oceanfront, like other reviews the rooms, facilities, pool areas are very clean and enjoyable. We purchased food at Mega and cooked in the condo a couple nights. Our favorite dinner spot was El Fogon on Constituyentes just accross from Mega grocery store. The beach directly in front of the hotel is occupied by the fishing boats it gave the beach character but it would have been nice to swim there too. In order to get in the water you either have to go a few minute walk to the north or south. The beach club which prodived breakfast everyday was good, the staff really works hard to make sure you are taken care of. One downside is you can't take your own liquor to the beach club even if you are a guest at the hotel, they want you to buy from the beach club, beer was about $35 pesos approx $2.60. We had a bottle of water and two cocktails for $14 dollars. Other than the liquor issue the place is nice and right in town close to the beach and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, extremely friendly and helpful staff and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Lori V
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Oceanfront side which was lovely. Very nice, very clean and well appointed room. The partial ocean view was not visible from our suite, but from our little patio area outside of our door. The staff was exceptional. We stayed on the first floor which was perfect, very close to the Indigo restaurant for our free breakfast and close to the pool and beach--which was beautiful. It is true, fishing boats are parked out front (but I found them not to be an intrusion). If you want to swim, you can walk a short bit to the right or left and you're fine. I didn't see a real problem with the beach side chairs, I'm a clean freak and they didn't bother me...besides they give you fresh towels for over them. The location across the street, "beachside" did have a lot of steps to be aware of. I think the oceanside, however, has an elevator. I felt completely safe walking to and from restaurants (which were great by the way) and shops on 5th Ave--a few spots not brightly lit, however, I never felt in any danger. As far as the noise, it was quiet for the most part but on the weekend the clubs can be a little loud. I just turned the fan on the air conditioner to "on" and it provided enough white noise for even a light sleeper like myself. I would stay again in a minute! It's a great value and exceeded all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, with a few small exceptions”
Reviews.Author: DarrellsGirl
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay was for a family reunion and we had a lovely time at the El Taj. Pros: Condo/Rooms, decor, services and staff, breakfast at Indigo Beach Club was included (part of a promotion). Full kitchen and washer/dryer very convenient. Cons: Loud, music (heavy bass) from 11 p.m. to 4 a.m. on Fri and Sat from nearby night clubs. Short walk from El Taj to 5th Ave was not well lit at night giving it a less-than-safe feeling. Beach club chairpads/beds were tired - they could use an update. A lot of stairs/steps if you travel with seniors, or have walking disabilities. Every day I saw babies with diapers or without (very young, not potty-trained) were in the main Oceanfront pool - I chose not to use it because of that. Cons, though outnumbering my Pros are not enough for me to be disappointed - I just include them for the review as others may find them helpful to know. Overall, it's a great place to enjoy the beautiful Riviera Maya weather, town of PDC and friendly, hard-working people of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - Stylish apartments and nice facility - but pick your rooms carefully”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter400
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable week at El Taj in March 2011. The weather was great, and although it was the spring break timeframe, the place was not overcrowded. In fact we had the small pool outside our "beachside" condo to ourselves most of the time. All the other earlier reviews on this place were exactly accurate as to the benefits and downsides of the two different buildings of this resort. We stayed in Apt 307 in the "Beachside" building, which is definitely not on the beach, but is just a quick walk away through the other "Oceanfront" building. We did not find that problematic in the least, but if you are hoping to see the ocean from your apartment or walk right from your apartment onto the beach, you do not want to be in the Beachside building. None of the upper level apartments in the Oceanfront building were available when we rented, so we rented instead Apt 307 in the Beachside building, and it was exactly what we expected - stylish, clean, two nice size bedrooms, very comfortable beds in each, two well appointed bathrooms, and a very useful kitchen and living area, as well a nice outdoor space overlooking the small pool for that building. We did have a problem with the air conditioning in the master bedroom for much of the stay, and I'm not sure they really fixed it by the time we left, but the other airconditioning units worked very well. Although the Beachside building pool is right next to the street, it is surrounded by jungle plantings, so you feel as if you are much more private setting than it actually is. This is not one of those oceanside full-service resorts with large beachfront property of its own. The beach outside the Oceanside building is actually just part of the long public beach that runs along an assortment of restaurants, bars and hotels in Playa del Carmen (although the El Taj does have a very small area with its own chiase lounges and a small beach restaurant). The one downside to the beach at El Taj is that the swimming area is essentially non-existent because the many fishing/tourist boats anchor right at the beach, taking up almost all the swimming area. We walked about 3 minutes down the beach to swim, which was not a big deal for us, but if you have young children and are looking for a beach area outside your resort where your kids could run in and out of the water easily while you watch them from you lounge chair - this is not the set-up for you. This is a small complex in downtown Playa del Carmen, very convenient to all the restaurants and shops. If you are looking for total beach seclusion, this isn't the place for you. But if you want to be centrally located, near the beach and have a modern, comfortable apartment with kitchen rather than a small hotel room, this place is perfect. If we went back, I would want to try to get one of the upper level apartments overlooking the ocean in the Oceanside building for a different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lovept
Reviews.Content: I really wish I could give El Taj a higher rating than a 5. It was amazing!!! We had so much anticipation for this property and it was everything I expected and beyond!! We had room 349 which looked just like it does if not better than in the pictures. Our hot tub was such a great treat to have, especially when the thunderstorm rolled in. We were at El Taj Oceanfront with a group of about 40 there for a wedding. Its such a wonderful place for family and friends who are in town for a wedding. So close to all the nightlife (never once heard the music in our condo), the beach is amazing, the beachclub top notch (from raking the sand, the drinks, umbrella service, etc.) and the pools at all the propertys are wonderful. From check-in to check-out everything was top notch!! Thank you El Taj, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hodgie0320
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 10 days at El Taj. Truly a remarkable condo. We stayed in room 341 (the best one bedroom). We had an ocean view from our living room and two great patios. The unit was very comfortable and extremely well maintained. The service at El Taj is excellent. The beach in front of El Taj is not the best though. There are several boats anchored there making the water 'oily'. A short walk down the beach and it is very nice for swimming. You are within walking distance to an amazing array of restaurants and shops. When we return to Playa del Carmen, we will definitely stay at El Taj again.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj= el excelente”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but good things to say about El Taj. Very nice facility, staff, really liked our condo, breakfast was very enjoyable. Enjoyed the pool(s). Location is convenient. The hotel itself is top notch. However, we were a little disappointed with Playa Del Carmen in general. Ocean smelled like sewage, and the shop owners pester you to come in their stores to name a few complaints. El Taj is too good for Playa Del Dumpo!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaPSG
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from Playa del Carmen and I have to say I couldn't have chosen a better place to stay! Ok, it was a little hard to get to the Condos to begin with (as no one there seems to know this place or its street name), but as soon as I got there, I know it was worth all the effort! The condos are amazing! Perfectly decorated, really modern and spacious... The kitchen had everything you could possibly think of, the bed was really comfortable and the jacuzzi in the balcony... That was just perfect! The beach club is also a great idea, as you can just relax there while being served with excellent food and drinks... Oh, and the location is ideal: you can walk to the main restaurants and night clubs there! I can't think of a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Group Vaca”
Reviews.Author: JaKaL02
Reviews.Content: Seven of us recently spent 4 nights at Playa del Carmen in the El Taj after we had spent the first 3 nights at Cancun's JW Marriot. The hotel is located right on the beach and had great views. We got a 3 bedroom, 2 bath penthouse (room 350). At check-in, everything was handled quickly, and we even got the all you can use internet and phone calls (international included VoP) for an additional $35. The rooms were spacious - but not as large as we'd imaged from the pictures - but definitely enough for all of us. After settling in, we went straight to the beach to check it out. In order to get a beach towel, each person had to hand in a "towel card" which you need to exchange for it back later. If this card is lost, there is a $25 per card fee. The beaches were nice, but had a stinch of seaweek smell. We had to walk down to right side of the beach to get to a better spot for swimming/snorkeling - not much of snorkeling since we weren't able to see anything really. We had a private chef come and cook for us one evening and they did a great job. Sangria was awesome, and they cleaned up everything as well. The location of El Taj is great, right by 5th avenue. Lots of shops, and restaurants and within a 10 min walk to the ferry to Cozumel or the bus station. We actually took the ADO bus to Tulum and XPlor which I felt saved us a bunch of money instead of going with a tour group. The bus was 58 pesos each way to Tulum and the admissions was 51 pesos (adds up to 167 pesos for Tulum which converted is around $13 USD). The buses were clean and comfortable - they even played movies, but in Spanish. For 2 nights, we went to Mega and bought food and cooked ourselves on the terrace. Loved the terrace, we cooked and just relaxed up there afterwards. Overall, the El Taj was great especially with it's condo style living. Loved that the 5th avenue was so close and can pretty much get everything within walking distance. Only thing that we would've wished for better was the beach - less boats, and clearer waters.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SergeyGrinev
Reviews.Content: Pros: - the rooms are beautiful and very well equipped - hotel located right on the beach and few minutes from 5th avenue (main tourist street in Playa del Carmen) - great pool and jacuzzi - free concierge service - great friendly personnel Cons: - beach is occupied by renting boats, a bit hard to find good place to swim - hotel restaurant and nearest food delivery are not very good

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartments!!! lacking in other areas”
Reviews.Author: evan0810
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and 21 month old son. We booked direct with the hotel and so had no problems and got the apartment that we were looking for. We booked a 2 bedroom so as our son would have his own room. However on arrival we were told that we would have to pay a further $10 dollars a night for a travel cot, a cost which is not advertised when booking the room. We called the reception and Hector resolved this issue immediately. Overall our holiday was very enjoyable as we visited the surrounding areas. Our biggest issue was with the beach club which I really think lets the hotel down. I know they are under different management but being associated with the club did taint our opinion of El Taj. The waiters are by no means the friendliest and the so called room service offered by the club is non exsistent unless you order before 5pm, after that all that is on offer is pizza or sushi, Management need to look at the menus available in the rooms and update them when necessary. The beach was not the paradise that I was expecting, maybe my expectations were too high??? the beach is fine if you just want to lounge and sip cocktails all day. And as for luxurious lounging, the beds are worn and ripped in places, the umbrellas are black with mold from being left closed when damp. Really all it needs is a bit of updating but not 5 star of even 4 star!! The water is not the most inviting and the smell from the boat engines can be over powering at times. Overall I think El Taj is not really the ideal location for families, even if they do advertise differently. The location is great for people who want to enjoy the nightlife and diving etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Wallen's are back in Playa”
Reviews.Author: kennie w
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at El Taj,and what can I say-Each one becomes better than the previous one!Our condo was great,although,smaller than the ones we have stayed in before,but I was the one who chose this particular number because of the sofa with a chaise on the end.The sofa was good,but the condo lacked a dishwasher,and the washer and dryer.We plan to go back to our favorite for the next trip-# 341. We were there for hurricane Rina,and I was so very impressed with the response of the staff.They were so efficient and organized with all the preparations We felt very safe,and cared for.It was an amazing experience.We really appreciated the option of moving farther inland,but chose to stay at El Taj. the staff is amazing-so warm and friendly-particularly-Flor diaz,frederick,and Daniel. I also had the priviledge of meeting and visiting with Jack and his lovely wife-such nice people.I was particularly impressed with jack's personal involvement during the hurricane preparations. The property,staff,and service is amazing and I can't imagine a better experience in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomodations in heart of Playa Del Carmen.”
Reviews.Author: Culturemom
Reviews.Content: One, two, and three condos literally in the center of Playa Del Carmen. The condo buildings are situated on the beach and directly across the street from the beach behind the beach condos. These condos are very nice with full living accomodations, such as a full kitchen. The only two things to be aware of are that you can't get a two bedroom condo directly facing the beach, they are behind the actual beachfront condos, but are in the "on-the-beach" building. You will have to strain to see the beach! Also, the beach is not for swimming, as it is full of boats and oil and grime directly in the front of El Taj.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL APARTMENT ON THE BEACH”
Reviews.Author: love2travel151
Reviews.Content: Had a great 2 bedroom apartment was big, clean and very modern. In a great location and was right on the beach. You get free access to the beachclub which has a restaurant and is located on a quieter spot on the beach. Walking distance to everything so location is perfect. Only negatives are that apartments back onto a street that is the party street of playa so it is very noisy to all hours of the morning and some nights was hard to sleep. Second thing was they charge a lot for internet access, I think was about $10 a day which is ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, space & service!”
Reviews.Author: MnWandy
Reviews.Content: El Taj is an incredible condo/hotel to stay while in Playa. It's location is impeccable, the space is remarkable, the service is efficient. The staff keeps the property perfect, they even rake the sand every morning. You have to walk a tiny ways to get passed the boats located directly on the beach but if you want to lay out they're outdoor retreat is everything you need for a magical vacation! They offer services for all needs! I'd stay over & over again when in Playa!

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pinkgerbergirl
Reviews.Content: My El Taj Oceanfront condo experience was the best by far of my 5 trips to Mexico. It was a very refreshing and wonderful change from the all inclusives! I enjoyed beginning my mornings with a cup of coffee and my iPad, sitting on the balcony keeping in touch with everyone at home and reading up on the daily news. It truly felt like home and I really loved the privacy of El Taj Oceanfront #345! The interior besides being beautifully decoratred is fully equipped with a washer/dryer, full kitchen, TV’s, DVD player and filtered water cooler. The rooftop has a private Jacuzzi, lounge chairs, a sofa, refrigerator and a BBQ. We loved that we could make our own meals, enjoy the breath taking view of the ocean during the day or gaze at the stars in the evening and fully relax in our own private space. If we had too much sun and wanted some shade while on the roof top terrace we just sat beneath our own private palapa. Such privacy in our own personal outdoor space was a big improvement compared to our previous vacations. The property has a beautiful pool as well as access to another pool at their sister resort across the street. There was always plenty of lounge chairs available around the pool as well as at the beach and they provided pool toys such as beach balls and inflatable chairs. The staff was very helpful, friendly and approachable. They would walk us down to the beach or pool area, lay out a towel and put up or open an umbrella and even offer to clean our sunglasses! One evening we were going on a tour early in the morning and needed dry, clean towels. The towel station had already been put away for the night when I requested new towels and told them of our plans. Without hesitation they got us fresh towels right out of the dryer! I love to walk alone on the beach in the early morning and evening and I always felt very safe on and around the property. The beach was beautiful and well kept. Every morning while enjoying my coffee I watched them sweep up seaweed that washed onshore. There are a few fishing boats tied down along the water’s edge, which did not bother us or detract from the view. The location was perfect for shopping or walking down 5th avenue for dinner or entertainment in the evening. Some reviews mentioned music from the clubs down the street but we always had a great sleep and never heard any outside noise. This was my favorite trip to Mexico and I look forward to staying here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property-Presidential level staff!!”
Reviews.Author: gailfunk
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at El Taj. The property is really beautiful! The new suites have wonderful top finishes and plenty of room. (The beds were extremely hard as a side note.) The hotel is right on a spectacular white, sandy beach along the breath-taking blue Carribbean Sea shoreline. The staff was fantastic! From the front desk, to the concierge, the management, the beach-front waitstaff, maintenence, and finally the staff at the Indigo Beach club were all superb! Truly, everyone was wonderfully welcoming and accommodating. The hotel is only a few blocks from 5th Ave and all the shops, restaurants, and nightlife that you'll want for a fun vacation. The Indigo club is a bit small and when everyone goes down for breakfast in the morning, there can be a wait. And the chairs on the beach fill up extremely fast, so be sure to plan for those events. The gym is being remodeled in Dec 2011 which will be nice as it's currently a bit small as well. The Riviera Maya is a dream away from home-we had a wonderful honeymoon full of great memories! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at El Taj”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: We were here for a wedding with about 50 people.....wonderful service, very clean, close to all and no problems whatsoever. Great front desk and concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a boutique resort”
Reviews.Author: MoFoAustin
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at El Taj several times. We've stayed at Beach side and Ocean front condos. Ocean front is nice because you are truly ocean front, but the Beach side condos are equally as nice; just have to walk 15 more steps to cross the street into the Ocean front units to get to the ocean. I believe both sides have the same unit designs... they are very similar and are appointed with the same design features. We usually choose a 2 bed/2 bath even if we are only heading down there as a couple. The extra room makes us more comfortable, but the one bedrooms are just fine for a couple. The ocean front pool is spectacular and the beach club that is just in front of that pool is wonderful. The food at this beach club is spectacular. We eat our breakfast there very morning, and really find little reason to go anywhere else for lunch. True this: The food here is spectacular. we choose to wander around more at night for other food options, but I really have to say the chef and mgmt at the beach club restaurant are top notch. We love hanging all day at the beach club on their beds and lounge chairs and getting the excellent service from their staff all day. The beach just in front of El Taj is white sand and beautiful, but the local "panga" fishing boats are lined up on the beach there, so you must walk 100 yards south to get a clear shot of a boat-less swimming area. The boats are beautiful though to look at... just not to swim amongst. If you stay here at El Taj, you are the type of person that wants to be close to the action. El Taj is close to the best restaurants and clubs in Playa but it is peaceful there. We've stayed in several units there and never have a problem sleeping. You can hear some of the pumping clubs a few streets away on Fridays and Saturdays if you are outside on your patios, and the clubs are open late, but I've never heard anything inside the units, so sleep isn't a problem. We like being so close to the action, but not staying on 5th avenue... the small street El Taj is on is very quiet, but 2-3 blocks from the best clubs in town. For a small fee, ($25 I think) we got unlimited telephone calls and unlimited web availability for the stays we were there for the last 2 times. The kitchen is extremely well appointed with all the appliances and pots and pans you need to cook at home. If you stay in one of the 2/2s with a roof top deck, please know that you must spend time up there in the hot tub and grill. Night time cigars and drinks overlooking the ocean on the roof top are magical. I wish I could give it a 4 1/2 stars because it deserves it. 5 stars if the beach right in front were not cluttered with the small panga boats. Leaving in a week to stay there for the 8th time.

Reviews.Title: “Oh You can't believe it until you've seen it and experienced it yourself!”
Reviews.Author: tntdmuf
Reviews.Content: All of CondoHotelsplayadelcarmen properties are beautiful, but their "anchor" El Taj Oceanfront is Superb. The service is 5 star. The staff is fabulous. The condos are spectacular and with the addition of Indigo Beach Club and Restaurant you will believe you are staying at a swanky Country Club. The amenities like The Gym, personal car service to and from the airport and 24 hour service all your needs are fulfilled and dreams come true. Check out their newest addition...a live beach webcam from Indigo Beach club. http://www.condohotelsplayadelcarmen.com/official-playa-del-carmen-live-web-cam.php No Better place in the world.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY! No serenity here, will not return”
Reviews.Author: HRaeP
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property, built with good intentions and nice finishes that give the appearance of zen. We stayed in El Taj Oceanside, penthouse unit 320, which is a 2 bed / 2 bath and shared the unit with my parents. The unit sizes are great for 2 couples. This unit also has a private roof deck with grill, table seating for 6, 2 lounge chairs and a roof top jacuzzi. This unit is located on the oceanfront development but the far side from the beach. The finishes were nice, bed comfortable, linens of high quality, adequate services and amenities, etc. But, it is really suited for club -goers and partying so if that is what is important for your holiday then this may be the place for you. Now, about the noise. As I mentioned, unit 320 is on the backside of the property closest to the street. There are about 20 night clubs that go until 5 and 6 AM located 100 yards from the property. And, guess what... you hear them until 5 or 6 AM in the MASTER SUITE. This property is FAR too expensive to spend my holiday searching for ear plugs and trying to drown out the noise with a sound machine. The beach club amenities are nice, but even in the off season I felt like I was packed into a sun bathing camp. There are both lounge chairs and beach beds, but there is little room between you and your neighbor. The service and the food at the beach club was good. But note, cannot bring your own drinks. We were there during the October storm. The staff did a great job of prepping the property and returning it to its zen-appearance after the storm. Overall, nice property for those that want to take a holiday and be in the middle of the party and the chaos.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: K W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Taj Oceanfront Penthouse Unit #345 for 10 days. The staff there were amazing - very friendly and they catered to your needs. This penthouse has 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, a kitchen, washer/dryer, and safes, which accommodated 5 adults nicely. This penthouse also has a private rooftop terrace, with a jacuzzi, BBQ, sofa, table, chairs, and loungers. The beach was just outside and we had an amazing view of the ocean. We also enjoyed the pools that this condo had to offer. Many hours were spent relaxing on the beach or at the pool. This condo is also within walking distance to 5th Ave, which is great for shopping and eating. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “We were there when Rina came to Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Charlie P
Reviews.Content: The staff was ready for the "tropical storm". The reports were that it was going to hit north of Playa del Carmen be a much worse storm. It ended up being just a lot of wind and rain! The staff however did a wonderful job of preparing us and the facility for the storm. We had a great time the night of the storm, our room was quiet even with the wind blowing hard out side! We were all impressed with how quickly the next morning every was cleaned and back to normal. This was truly an excellent location, service, facility and experience. I would love to go back sometime in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of paradise! A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ON21ET
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 11 days at El Taj. We were 3 adults and my 9 month year old baby. The condo was beyond beautiful, extremely clean. The staff was so much fun and always very helpful. We stayed in room 324 and would go back in a second. There is so much to do in the area as well. 5th avenue is fun to walk around at night. The staff at the pool are always ready to find you a comfortable spot on the beach while getting your glasses cleaned and try have sun run lotion available for you. We were there during what was suppose to be hurricane Rina and the staff really made us feel safe and at ease although we were very scared. We rented a car from Can in airport and if you are driving it's a little tricky to find El Taj. The location is amazing right on the ocean. Everything about this hotel is perfect. We loved having our Jacuzzi and would strongly recommend you get one because if the weather isn't good which is very rare you have your jacuzzi. We found shopping for groceries at Mega to be cleaner than Wal Mary although they were both good. Lots of action in the area at night! I would strongly recommend going to Tulum it's about 50 minutes driving from El Taj but something to see at least once in your life. I can't wait to go back I just arrived back home and I am thinking when to book next!!! Frederic the manager of all of tr hotels is always there and ready to welcome you and make you feel comfortable. When we had the storm after hurricane Rina they immediately moved us for the night to Porta playa which is one of yheir other condos, which isn't right in the ocean. It was nice for safety but nothing compared to El Taj.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj”
Reviews.Author: Gayle D
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! My husband and I just recently returned from Playa del Carmen. We splurged and got a great penthouse condo for multiple birthday celebrations with a couple of family members. I had never been to this part of Mexico before. We chose the El Taj because it was a condo and not a one room all inclusive hotel. We wanted to stretch out and make it home for our stay. What a treat. We got a really good deal due to the time of year and also got a discount by booking with Buigas Travel. Alex Buigas is very responsive and gave me great advice on when to book the condo and which unit had the best view. We were not disappointed. The staff at the El Taj is unbelievable, our tiny requests were handled within minutes. Gabriela sent me multiple emails prior to our trip with very helpful information. Hector greeted us when arrived and made us feel right at home. I highly recommend a penthouse unit with a good view. There was nothing like sitting in the hot tub overlooking the gorgeous blue sea or having dinner in our rooftop kitchen. I wish we were still there!

Reviews.Title: “5 star in between Hurricane Rina”
Reviews.Author: elena s
Reviews.Content: I never wrote a review before but before we booked this trip we checked trip advisor and saw all the glowing reviews for El Taj. When we arrived three days ago we learned from the manager that a major hurricane was formulating and Playa del Carmen was in the direct path of Hurricane Rina. We couldn't believe it because it was a picture perfect day and couldn't imagine a hurricane was looming. Our room was directly on the beach and we have never experienced a hurricane before and didn't know what to expect. We thought we should take many pictures of the hotel thinking it might get destroyed in the hurricane and we wanted a lasting memory of it since this is one of the most beautiful hotels. We have traveled all over the world and stayed in some of the most luxurious hotels and El Taj has one of the most unique atmosphere especially since the architecture of the building is so unique. The building is all curves and there is hardly straight wall. The pictures on their web site are very nice but the pictures do not capture the real beauty of the building. It's magnificent! The landscaping is so lush and tropical. We thought it would be a shame if the buildings got damaged and It suddenly dawned on us that we are staying in the building. Everyone at the front desk and most of the staff speaks english and this was very comforting (especially during a crisis) since we don't speak Spanish which is their native language. Normally it wouldn't make a difference, but in situations like this we were getting a little nervous and we heard the hurricane formulated into a category 3 and destruction was almost certain. We were determined to enjoy our vacation and we are having one of the best vacations ever. Actually I am writing this review while we are still in Playa. We read a few reviews that there are several boats anchored in front of the beach club. When we first arrived there were a few boats and we thought it added to the charm of the place. Especially since the boats were local fishing boats and painted in bright colors and reminded us of a little greek fishing village. You can walk about 100 feet to the right and the crystal clear turquoise water is magnificent for swimming. We couldn't believe that we read a few negative reviews about the boats when you can swim just a few feet away. There is also a very cute picturesque pier in front of El Taj. We understand the owners of El Taj built the pier for wedding ceremonies but the pier is quite popular just to hang out and you can capture great sunsets which we saw on the first day we arrived. The beach club is awesome and they offer a great buffet breakfast every morning. It seems they offer a promotion frequently that provides complimentary breakfast since most people had breakfast vouchers but it's a great deal for $145 pesos around $13 US dollars. We became friendly with a few guests and one person complained because they booked their vacation through a big travel discount.com and they didn't know which condo they would receive until they arrived and they seemed to be a bit disappointed. We booked directly through the hotel and choose the room we wanted. All the front units facing the beach are 3 bedroom units and there is only one two bedroom unit directly on the beach. El Taj has two swimming pools. It is actually two separate properties called Beachside and Oceanfront. The oceanfront property is directly on the beach facing the ocean and beachside property is across the street from the oceanfront property. The unit we stayed in was spectacular and it looked brand new. We are light sleepers and the mattress was heavenly. Their was hardly any noise and it was very quiet even though the clubs are down the block from El Taj. The rooms are very spacious and they have I-pod players and cable TV and all the amenities you expect of a well appointed home. The windows are double insulated glass that block almost any outside noise. They claim the windows are hurricane proof glass but we didn't want to witness if this was true even though we would have liked to hear the crashing of the waves which were quite big but no chance of that with the thick glass windows. The location of El Taj is awesome if you want to be in the middle of everything. The famous 5th Ave. is only two blocks away. There's no need for a car or taxi since everything is within walking distance. We celebrated our 25th anniversary with our two grown children and they went out to the local clubs and bars that are just down the block. No worries for us especially since walking back from the clubs is just one or two blocks away! The only concerns we had was the Hurricane. The next day the manager offered to move us to their other property at Maya Villa or Porto Playa since our room was directly on the beach. They also offered the same for other guests and I must say we felt extremely safe in our unit in El Taj. But we never experienced a hurricane before. Most of the guests stayed in El Taj to ride out the hurricane but we choose to move to Maya Villa. It is only one block from El Taj but not on the beach. We also looked at this property on trip advisor before booking El Taj and we were not quite sure if we should stay in Maya Villa since we like staying in beachfront properties especially with an ocean view. So when they offered to move us we thought it would be great to experience both of their properties. We were sad to leave El Taj and thought we would return after the hurricane. But once we walked over to Maya Villa we were equally blown away and couldn't believe how quint this hotel was. It captures a Mayan theme with exquisite detailing and I couldn't stop admiring the gecko shaped swimming pool. It is a much smaller pool than El Taj but it is very unique sort of like a river pool with spectacular jade colored mosaic tiling throughout. They provided us with a 3 bedroom duplex condo that is stunning. I will post a Maya Villa review but the best news is that Hurricane Rina had been downgraded to a major tropical storm. We do not recommend traveling to this region in October since it is the tail end of Hurricane season. But if your not worried about the weather then El Taj or Maya Villa is the best place in all of Playa. Their Fitness club is also fabulous and it is a professional gym not your typical hotel gym. We also got to know the concierge (Teresa). She is so helpful and she is eager to help with anything. She also knows every restaurant and she offers a library full of complimentary DVD's and games which we found very handy since we are in a tropical storm and currently writing this review. Since we are riding out the storm in our condo I will also write a review for Maya Vila condo hotel. I hope you find this review helpful. We definitely recommend El taj or Maya Villa and we are coming back in January!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: ankica
Reviews.Content: El Taj a stunning gem! An absolutely beautiful property that is in a great location! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at El Taj. We stayed in room 343, a 2 bedroom. The only thing is that the view from the bedrooms overlooked what looks like a run down piece of property next door, but I suppose El Taj has no control over that. The staff was great, the restaurant has thee most delicious huevos rancheros, and you have access to a great gym nearby. I took a yoga class for the first time in my life and thought the instructor was wonderful. We had twin beds (per our request) in the second bedroom. They weren't the most comfortable, kind of hard. We took advantage of the 40% off special when we booked, otherwise, I don't think we could afford to stay at El Taj. It is quite expensive, but beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were promised online nice but...............”
Reviews.Author: plumlake
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at El Taj we were impressed even though the pool was very small and the beach facilities limited. We had been promised a beach view....hot tub...and large quarters...but not so. The hotel gave us the last room in the back of the hotel..overlooking a vacant lot and garbage containers. When I asked for a different room we were told that the hotel was owned by individual owners and that different rooms could not be switched since the payment had already been made to the owner...Hmmmm lesson learned here. I asked for a quiet room ...the second night was dreadful as the unit next to us decided to host a huge after bar party starting at midnight ..ending at 5AM. The manager told me I should have complained to security as I should have....but did not think this would go on all night when it started. Breakfast was offered for $14.00 per person in the small restarant...the little one across the stree was much better and half the cost. At no time was breakfast offered which was also part of the deal I booked on line with. When I asked about that...the manager told us not to book online anymore..but to call direct. The positive side....the unit was VERY clean.....beds were very comfortable. The rooms that did have hot tubs ...were strange...the hot tubs were out in the entrance ways to the rooms..not private. Anyway...I learned a lot here.

Reviews.Title: “Trish”
Reviews.Author: trisha22
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa at least 8 times and this was our second time at El Taj. We stayed in a 3 bedroom penthouse with a private rooftop. Stunning!! Would go back in a heartbeat. Close to 5th Ave., on the beach, pool - I don't need any more that that. The worst part for us is that it rained our entire vacation. But, there were plenty of restaurants around to fill the time.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: optimus_megatron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Playa a few times but have always stayed at resorts. I can honestly say El Taj blows them all away! We stayed in unit #345 in the El Taj Oceanfront, a 3-bedroom penthouse with a private rooftop terrace and a great view of the ocean. On the rooftop is a private Jacuzzi, sofa, loungers and a bbq. The interior of the unit was designed nicer than any of the resorts we stayed at and comes with everything needed for a comfortable stay, including washer/dryer, full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and 4 TVs. Very cozy and feels just like home. Guests at El Taj were also able to use the pool at their sister resort right across the street and also allowed us access to their gym. I read some reviews where people were saying they could hear noise from the bars at night but we didn’t really notice them. Maybe it’s because our unit was the furthest from the bars, but the only time we’d hear them was when we were on the balcony at night; once inside the condo and the door shut, we couldn’t hear a thing. The staff there was all very friendly and outgoing; they really went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and welcomed. Every morning we went to the beach, they would walk with us to the loungers and would lay towels on them for us and set up the umbrellas when needed. Anytime we needed anything, they were on it within minutes. The beach was well kept and clean. Every morning they would come out and sweep up any seaweed that washed onshore. There were some boats tied down along the water’s edge, but that didn’t really bother us. We thought it was quaint, and when we went into the water, we’d just walk down the dock that took us out past the boats but was still relatively shallow. This was our best trip to Mexico yet and we’re already looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Best beachfront accomodations in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Russ R
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa numerous times, but were never happy with the locations of the properties where we had stayed. Too many resorts are all inclusive and many are not within walking distance of the main attractions of Playa. I am a picky traveler, and am typically hard to please, but this property is extremely nice and has the absolute best location in Playa Del Carmen. Beachfront and within walking distance of all the excitment of Playa, there could not be a better location. I love the fact that even though this is a condo, it is run like a hotel and has all the amenities needed for a great vacation. There is a restaurant on premise as well as access to a world class workout facility. The property is beautiful during the day, and spectacular at night. Much thought went into the design, including great landscaping and lighting. This is one place that I would gladly recommend to anyone traveling to Playa Del Carmen. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!!! Give up the long cab rides and stay at the #1 place in Playa, El Taj. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Unit, Great staff, Great Owner!”
Reviews.Author: Heith F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a trip to Playa del Carmen and we stayed in Unit 327, a large 1 bedroom condo on the ground floor, to celebrate our anniversary. To say that we enjoyed our stay would be an understatement. This is a beautiful property that is located in the most central location one could hope for if they wanted to be in the middle of all that Playa has to offer. We walked everywhere and loved it! The unit is a beautifully decorated 1-bedroom on the bottom floor with a great ocean view from the patio and the living room/kitchen. It is literally two steps from the entrance to the jacuzzi and a few more steps down a short staircase to the pool. You can see the water from the open patio out front as well. The resort staff was wonderful. The bellmen we dealt with and the people at the front office and concierge all spoke great english which helped us tremendously since our spanish was quite limited. Everyone was friendly, welcoming, and always diligently working to keep the entire resort as clean and well-maintained as could be. Additionally, the owner was great to deal with. If we were staying at El Taj again, I'd hope to deal with the owner again because he was so thorough and easy to contact. We had a small issue with a miscommunication upon arrival and with a quick email to the owner he had it straightened out in a matter of minutes. He also was really helpful in emails prior to our trip providing us with some local tips and tricks for getting to and from the airport and eating as well! It was a real pleasure. We hope to stay there again! If you're looking for an easy going stay at a place that isn't too big like all the cookie cutter resorts, give El Taj, and specifically Unit 327, a look. You'll be hard pressed to find a better all-around experience. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Blew us away and we have high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jeichmann21
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel 100% based on the reviews on here. Plus for a 7 day stay in October they give a 45% discount! We got a gorgeous 2 bedroom, 2 bath ocean front condo at El Taj for $1500 for 7 days. Our condo was gorgeous (unit 318 - which btw is the 2nd floor b/c the 100 level rooms are at ground level...a little confusing and deceiving). Anyway, the unit is very well thought out with everything you could ever want. Dishwasher, microwave, full stove, barware, blender, cookware, full fridge, breakfast bar, full table, family room, very nice and large bedrooms. Great bathrooms with vessel bowl sinks and lovely granite. Private hot tub outside our front door that we used every single day we were there. The pool is awesome and we probably spent 3 hours one day sitting in the upper pool whirlpool seats reading our books (see photos). The beach club is amazing. Never ever have I sat on more comfortable, plush beds on the sand. The attendants follow you to your seat and will set up umbrellas to give you the perfect amount of shade or sun and then will come around and move them for you later in the day when the sun moves! Food can be delivered to you on the beach and they bring out these little wicker mini tables that sit right on your beach bed so you can eat comfortabley. Drinks were reasonable for a hotel at about $7-$8 for a margarita. Food is very good, especially the pizzas! We went out to the near by Mega to stock up on food while our room was getting ready. We purchased water and ice only to learn that each unit has filtered water coolers and you can call the front desk at any point and they will bring you as many bags of free ice that you may need. The one and only negative was the very very loud music being played until 5am at the night club next door. We are from Chicago and deal with loud city noises all the time, but this was crazy. EVen with ear plugs in, the only time I'd fall asleep was when the air con kicked in. Then I'd wake up again when it kicked off. I think you'd be perfectly shielded from the noise if you stay in the units in the front of the hotel. Definitely check this place out. You will not regret it. It's simply gorgeous. I can't say enough good things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous ocean front view!!”
Reviews.Author: seaside116
Reviews.Content: As I am writing this review, I am sitting in an outside hot tub on third floor balcony, listening to the waves and watching the twinkling lights of Cozumel across the water. This is my second stay in this unit and it goes beyond the waterfront view! The El Taj Condo Hotel is an intimate and personal travel experience. A place to relax but close enough to the center of town for access to restaurants, clubs, and shopping. Fabulous food in the hotel Indigo restaurant (try the cerviche while on the beach under an umbrella!). Attentive beachside and hotel staff. Already thinking of rebooking.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vivone
Reviews.Content: El Taj Oceon is the premiere place to stay in Playa Del Carmen! My husband & I just returned home from a weeks vaca, & it was not enough! The place is gorgeous, everything is new & very clean, & can't rave enough about the staff & Theresa (concierge) & everyone's gracious hospitality ! The pool is spectacular with built in hydro seats. The location is fabulous right in the center of 5th ave with everything in walking distance. We stayed in #329 & truly enjoyed our condo & views & the Indian beach club! I would definitely recommend El Taj Ocean & will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomodation and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Jolanta027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this oceanfront unit at El Taj, and we were blown away. We had a large living room, modern equipped kitchen and beautiful master bedroom. We felt like we were literally on the white sand beach, because the unit is on the ground floor, surrounded by floor-to-ceiling windows that brought this stunning Caribbean beach right into our living room and bedroom. What a pleasure it is to spend a completely lazy vacation days, just walking right over to the Indigo Beach Club that serves great gourmet breakfast and offers free Balinese beach beds to guests. We were also right next to the Balinese-themed pool, and would spend our evenings sipping margaritas on lounge chairs on our private terrace. The service was also great and very pleasant. We used concierge services to take some tours in the jungle and to visit ancient Mayan ruins of Tulum – there’s a lot to do in the area when you crave some action. We will definitely be back! Next time we will try to book a penthouse with a private rooftop and bring some friends to show them this hidden piece of paradise in Playa del Carmen,.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the El Taj”
Reviews.Author: dpoehler
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us stayed in room 336 (penthouse, rooftop) a few weeks ago. The place is really as great as the reviews say it is. The place is amazing and the boats were not a bother to us, nor was the noise of the clubs. The location and views cannot be beat and the service at the Indigo club was superb. Each day one of the workers would dig a hole and place an umbrella over our bed on the beach. We would then have someone bringing us food and drinks all day. At night we would walk directly down the road to many restuarant choices or down the beach to Fusion (recommend for drinks on the beach). We also enjoyed going to Luna Blue to listen to some live music one night (very fun). Everything is within a short walk of the condo. The WIFI worked well and the large amount of filtered water in the condo was a nice touch. If you are wondering about the safety of Playa, I never felt unsafe. We walked around the streets and along the beach at night without incident. My only complaint regarding El Taj was the concierge who messed up our excursion reservation and cancelled our private chef at the last minute without even offering alternative dining options. From what I can tell, this is not the norm so maybe she was just having a bad week. I would confirm all reservations with the concierge prior to your trip to make sure. I highly recommend El Taj. I do not think you will be disappointed (unless you are one of those people who simply cannot be pleased).

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Accommodation Beautiful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Raffa-ella2510
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place to stay when visiting beautiful Mexico. The location is just perfect, right on the beach. The staff were amazing always so helpful & going out of their way for us. The receptionist even let me use her PC to add credit to my phone because I couldn’t manage it myself on my BlackBerry! The restaurant staff were just beautiful, always so helpful and willing to go that extra mile. At times we would even having them move our umbrellas with the sun (not because we asked because they noticed the sun in our eyes!) By the end of our stay we did not want to leave them let alone the beach! The condos we clean, modern & comfortable. We had a BBQ / sauna rooftop area which was perfect as well although we didn’t seem to use it as much as anticipated. Maybe because we didn’t want to get off the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Sept Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RACERXXX8049
Reviews.Content: What can i say that hasnt already been said before. Grounds are beautiful and well kept. Everyone was really nice and helpful. Juan went out of his way to help us get some supplies one evening. We really appreciated that. We stayed in the oceanside penthouse (room 340). The room and views from the private rooftop deck were amazing. We enjoyed it daily. Everything you need is close by. Took an excursion to Xplor and rented a car to see the ruins at Tulum one day without an issues. Teresa, as mentioned in other reviews, was very helpful. She told us the best way to get to Xplor and helped us get a car to rent. All in all, we had a great time and we will definitly be back!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jssr319
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect...Rooms are beautiful and they have everything you need.Pools are nice.Its spotless,,,the workers are the best,,,,especially Luis...and the maids.You are one block off 5th Ave so there is always something to do....

Reviews.Title: “Love!”
Reviews.Author: rmholub21
Reviews.Content: Love these condos! We have been to playa over 20 times and this time we had our 4 month old baby girl with us. The condo and property are very clean, the staff was always great! We always felt safe. Highly recommend if you are traveling alone, as a couple or a faimly. The beach is so nice and clean, the staff is always happy to make sure that you have a drink. The food was good as well! P.S. We loved it so much that we are headed back to a larger condo for the holiday's with more family!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Solwind
Reviews.Content: Luv, luv, luv this resort! We've stayed at El Taj twice and both times had an awesome time. The staff is unbelievably helpful and will do anything to make your stay comfortable. El Taj is in an excellent location only one block to 5th Avenue. Also near all the nightlife. The restaurant food was very good and the waiters friendly and helpful. We'll definitely stay at El Taj anytime we return to Playa del Carmen. I hope it's soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DGtravels8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Taj for a week on the third floor, oceanside. The room was really nice, clean and cool! We had a private balcony off our bedroom on the side of the building with views of the beach and water. Only thing with our room was that it was quite dark, not many windows, and I like to have sunshine. We loved the restaurant/cafe on the ground floor of the building, right on the beach! Food and service was good! The waiters would also help finding a sunbed or daybed, move our umbrella and were very efficient with drinks etc. El Taj was so close to everything without it being noisy. There were two nightclubs only doors down the road, but we never heard a thing. We found all staff very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We loved El Taj for the position, you walk past the pool straight onto the beach!

Reviews.Title: “here we come el taj !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1doree
Reviews.Content: ok my fellow trip advisors i will be visiting El Taj from sept 29 until oct 6th i must say the service i have already recieved from their staff is impressive and i am not even their yet. working in a resort as well i know excellent service, some of our guest rave about this resort as well i will keep you all updated on our experince here as well as post some pics for you thanks for all the reviews and suggestions from you guys planing some tours as well i will keep you posted!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mikeydog
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a four night stay at El Taj in Playa del Carmen. First, the property is centrally located in town and beachfront. Great for young couples and singles as it is only 100 yards or so to fun clubs/bars. You can walk anywhere in town. The resort is split into two parts, the lobby and beachside condos are apart from the backside condos split by a small cobblestone street. Both areas have their own pools. The rear condos still have water views on the upper floors and is actually preferred due to its more private, quiet location. Several small children awoke early we found and played loudly in the front pool. The condo itself was flawless. We stayed in a two bedroom, 304 I believe with granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, and private balconies overlooking the pool and gardens. Everything was clean and even had a water cooler with purified water. The only downside we found was the beach. While it is an expansive, white sand beach, the water is somewhat disappointing as local fishing and scuba boats line the water the entire length. You must enter between the boats and wade past them to enjoy the water. Their presence kind of takes away from the beauty of the beach/water. Also, there was no wine opener in the condo. We called the front desk and they brought up a broken opener. We tried to go to the restaurant/bar but it was closed on a Monday night. Ended up walking down to a bar to have them open our bottle. Other than that no complaints to speak of. Great service on the beach (Carlos) and great food at the restaurant. Playa del Carmen is a great town that everyone will enjoy. It is very European as foreigners definitely outnumbered Americans. So not Cancun! The younger crowd will enjoy the nightlife while older tourists will enjoy the walking promenade with shops and great restaurants, again so not Cancun! Definitely rent a car and drive from Cancun. The property provides free gated parking and you have the ability to explore surrounding areas like Tulum and other beaches. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “First class and great location”
Reviews.Author: SerialExpat
Reviews.Content: The condos are large and well equipped right next to the popular pedestrian shopping street of 5th ave. The beach club is attentive was disappointingly crowded. The chairs are all nearly touching so there is no privacy at all. the attached restaurant is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo with terrific staff, too close to clubs the noise is deafening.”
Reviews.Author: Danamala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at el taj for our honeymoon due in large part to the positive reviews on trip advisor. We rented one of the penthouses with an ocean view. The rooms, decor, views and service are all oustanding there is no question there. However the location of el taj is so close to the strip you are constantly hearing the surrounding club music until the early hours of the morning. All the noise ruined the outside spaces for us. The beach in front of el taj is littered with boats and jet skies so it's fairly polluted. If you are looking for a beautiful luxury villa minutes to the action and the beach this is the place for you. If you are looking for a quiet romantic getaway you should keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Condo!”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest condos we've ever stayed in. Nicely furnished and the daily cleaning was fantastic. Can't say enough about how clean the entire complex was. Beach however, was only fair, as the boats anchored there seemed to foul the air and water. They need to be moved. Condos are very convenient to shops and restaurants on 5th Avenue, just 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I have ever stayed at in Mexico!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie0428
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: I could not say enough good things about this hotel! I booked on hotels.com at a discount and received a fabulous one bedroom king condo. It was beautifully appointed with a huge full kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer and dryer, and patio(unit 347). The place was so ultra clean. I never saw a single ant or bug once! Also, I have never experienced such a nice, dry, cool room- a/c worked VERY well, and they had ceiling fans in each room of the unit. RESTAURANT: The restaurant was awesome- we didn't go there for breakfast, as we didn't want a buffet, but we ate there for lunch twice and I ordered the Indigo pizza both times because it was so good the first time. Shrimp, pesto, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes on it. YUMMMMM!!! The beach service was excellent- the attendants lay your towels out on a chair, adjust your umbrellas for the shade you want, then the waiter comes and serves you all day. Outside alcohol is not allowed at the beach club but we hung out there all day having beers, pina coladas, and pizzas and our bill for all day(for two people) was about 80USD each day. Not bad. BEACH: The beach was super nice. Yes, there are boats there in front. Pretty much any hotel in downtown Playa del Carmen is going to have boats in front, somewhere in your view. With boats comes fishing. With fishing comes a foul smell at times. If you want to get in the water with less boats, there is about a 50 yard walk down past the majority of the boats. I just got in and swam past the boats, where the water is clear blue and still shallow. The boats are not parked close together, so it is very easy to get in and enjoy the water. The bottom of the water is nice and sandy not rocky which is nice. The vibe sitting at the beach is super relaxed and pleasant, and the staff is friendly. LOCATION: The hotel is located right in the middle of everything!!! I am not a huge party person anymore, but the hotel is about a block from all of the clubs. Even though it was really close, it was so quiet. So if you want to be at the bars sometimes, and retreat to a quiet place, it was great. Also, and of the restaurants downtown are within walking distance to the hotel. If you don't feel like walking though, the cab rides downtown were 2-3 dollars each way. It was so easy to just go back to the hotel if we needed to, and just walk around in the evenings. We ate at some really great restaurants: El Fogon, La Cueva del Cahngo, Piola, Fusion- they were all great. The recommendations we got were all fantastic! CONCIERGE AND FRONT DESK- Everyone here was great, honest, etc. I was between booking a tour and going to Akumal for the day and the concierge, Teresa, helped us rent a car and recommended Akumal, even though the tour would have cost us a lot of money and I assume she would have gotten a nice commission on it. I was really impressed with her honesty. She told us about restaurants and information in Akumal, too. Also at the concierge they have books, magazines, movies, beach toys, noodles for the water, etc. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. The first night we got there the girl at the front desk took us to our room, showed us how to work the remotes for the TV, the coffee maker, the ceiling fans, told us how to walk to the Mega, etc. Everyone was so friendly- top notch!!! NEW NEGATIVE REVIEWS: Really I am shocked to read the negative reviews. I have been to Mexico and stayed at several hotels in Cozumel, one in Cancun, and several in Playa del Carmen area and I have NEVER stayed at such an awesome place. The only thing I can figure is because of all of the awesome reviews the negative reviewers had some kind of greatly unrealistic expectations. The staff here would obviously bend over backwards to make people happy. They are number one and they want to keep it that way. There is an obvious overly helpful attitude here. I can only imagine that some people just can't be made happy. SUMMARY: I can't wait to book another trip here!!! It was the best!
