Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: P K
Reviews.Content: Great condos, great service, great pool(s), 3-minute-walk to 5th Avenue but still quiet, free gym (real gym, not just two bikes and a couple of weights) --> great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: tbone91148
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple days at Porto Playa and moved over to El Taj for three days. If you love being on the beach, this is the place ! Both properties are wonderfully managed as condos with daily hotel services. We had a one bedroom apartment with a beautiful Gulf view from the living room and from a balcony off the bedroom. Nice to have a full size refrigerator, microwave, fully stocked kitchen. We were not staying for a long time but a washer/dryer stack in the unit was also available. It is a short walk to alot of nice restaurants. I can't say we had any noise problems that some have mentioned, however it might be advisable to ask if some units may be more quiet. Around the clock front desk service and security made our stay very peaceful and enjoyable. Can't wait to return and the only tough decision....here or Porto Playa ??

Reviews.Title: “Totally Impressed - El Taj is a very easy recommendation to make”
Reviews.Author: sifiso0305
Reviews.Content: This is my first comment on Trip Advisor, though I reference it quite often to help inform my decisions on accommodations, etc when putting together my trips. I shared Rm #32 w/ another couple (also totally impressed w/ El Taj). I stayed here Sept 2-5, 2011. I'd have to work really really hard to find anything critical to say of El Taj. The place is spectacular, the grounds are spectacular, and the staff is spectacular to boot. I arrived around 9PM into El Taj and was greeted at the entrance of the hotel, where the staff ushered us into reservations to square up on housekeeping, keys, etc. That was all of 10 minutes at which point I was given a parking pass for my stay. Parking is free, garage is clean, and you can enter grounds from the garage area itself. The first step into the place defined my whole experience: serene, easy-breezy, contemporary, relaxed, oasis. The unit itself is stellar, well appointed, comes w/ shot glasses, pints, a solid blender, cutting board, forks/knives/spoons, safes for your valuables. You'd hate to be a smidgen of dirt cause the place is super clean and you have the option of having it cleaned everyday, just got to let the cleaning people know. They arrive around 12pm daily. The pool is a winner, great temperature, great views from the pool, unique design, and just awesome. The Indigo Bar is good. I had breakfast every morning and it was fantastic, I had the buffet. I ordered a drink from the bar (Pina Colada) and if there is anything that needed any improvement, which is not easy to find at El Taj, it would be the drinks. I'd hit up Mega, right up the street, for my drinks, etc though, so getting yourself set up w/ drinks, etc is nothing more than a trip to the grocery market away. Mega is as modern and large as any large grocery market in the US, it's huge and has everything you'll need to usher in the good times. I walked along the beach as far as I possibly could before being cut off by a barrier and El Taj is bar far the most beautiful place along a 3/4 mile stretch of the beach. I researched like a dog for three weeks before pulling the trigger on El Taj and it was some of the best money I've spent in quite some time. If you are on the fences about this place, I can say w/o hesitation, you've done yourself a solid if you chosen this place. The pictures, the reviews...it all marries up the second you arrive and see it yourself. Absolutely loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectation, a home from home and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Win
Reviews.Content: We were very suspicious of all the good reviews, but have been pleasantly surprised at these fab condos just a block away from the hub of Playa Del Carmen. Having explored the rest of the town, this really is the best spot in town. A great swimming pool, fun jacuzzi, free chairs, towels and parasols. The conceriege is so helpful and even lends out books, games, DVDs and magazines for free. The only drawback that might upset some people are the noisy clubs which are only a few hundred metres away (particularly loud at the weekend). To be honest we were in room 319, which is probably the nearest to them and it didn't affect us. We just played some music using one of the two iPod docks provided in the Condo. The industrial size bottle of drinking water in the kitchen was really helpful! We look forward to coming back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: suebloo
Reviews.Content: As a lone femail traveler I felt very safe here and when walking from the hotel to the main street with it's shops and bars which is so close. Literally 2 minutes from my room to the beach where there are the most comfortable sunbeds and superb service. Will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but not the best beach for swimming due to the pollution.”
Reviews.Author: VIPbeachguest
Reviews.Content: There are not many water currents in front of the condos which is reason they park all the fishing boats there. This situation causes the pollution to accumulate and prevent any pleasent thoughts of swimming or building sand castles. You can go down the beach about a hundred yards or so where the water is cleaner to a point and where there were people swimming. The condo beachfront minus the water was one of the better ones around with a bar and restaurant. Partial ocean view only means your room is on the ocean side of the street that goes between the property. Only six condos could be considered ocean view. The partial ocean view would be be considered garden view at most other properties. This is probably one of the better places to stay in Playa del Carmen. The location is great for walking to anything, yet far enough away to get some peace and quiet. The rooms are by far better than what you could get at any hotel for the price. Plenty of beachside bars and restaurants within walking distance. Other than the water at the beach, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Tammy P
Reviews.Content: We chose El Taj for the great reviews on trip advisor and the Number one rating. I am not sure why they are rated number one! We travel a lot, and love the Mexican Riviera for good R and R, but El Taj and R and R should not be used together. This is our honeymoon, and we wanted the best. When we arrived, it was a nightmare! We were told that we had been UPGRADED to a two room condo- we only needed one bedroom, but we thought we would look at it, thinking it would be a better location. We nicknamed this unit the fish-bowl. It is directly above the check in desk, facing the street and the discos. So, it was very load. NO view of anything, expect the maids who congregated outside the window, and everyone who walked through the hotel, since it is the first room at the top of the stairs. We refused this room, and were told the only other room available was a one bedroom on the third floor. When we went to look at this, the room was ok- quieter, but REEKED of smoke! My husband is horribly allergic. The desk people refused to give us any other chose, since we HAD BOOKED THROUGH A TRAVEL AGENCY, not directly with them. ??????????????? We were mystified by this reasoning. We tried to call our travel agent, but could not get a line out since we were in Mexico, and the man at the desk refused to help us. We were stuck! We took the stinky room and opened all the windows and the maid lit incense. After three days, the smell went away, but my husband was horribly ill. The fish bowl would have been just as bad since it backed onto the alley and was directly above were the staff smoked on the street. Each day we asked to change, but were told they were sold out- although it looked that half the units were open each night! Service at the beach club was minimal, unless you were a cute girl that kissed the beach boys. Only once in 5 days did anyone offer to clean our glasses, or ask if we needed a drink. It was pretty much self serve at the over priced bar attached. Beds were hard as a rock!!! Pools have only a couple of chairs by each and do not entice you to lay by them. They are very cramped areas Good points/ The maids and grounds keepers are amazing. We did go fishing with the boats out front- my husband made arrangements with Jesus and his assistant Fabio- they are the red boats just to the right. We caught red snapper until our arms hurt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: zayizzyg
Reviews.Content: Our family spent two weeks in July 2011 (beautiful weather) at the El Taj. From the time we arrived till the time we left we recieved excellent service. Our 3 bedroom penthouse condo was top notch. Very clean, excellent appliances and very comfortable. The maid service was also superb. We really enjoyed the pool and sitting in the spa chairs over looking the pool and ocean. The Indigo beach club had the best wait staff and the food was very good. We relaxed daily under an umbrella on the comfortable beach furniture. The location of the El Taj is perfect for whatever you want to do. Directly on the beach and walking distance to dining, dancing, shopping and grocery. We preferred MEGA for groceries over Walmart. We did some fishing with the local fishing guys from the beach and really enjoyed it, we caught Baraccuda, and trigger fish. The most impressive part of staying at El Taj actually came from an unfortunate accident. My mother-in-law had tripped and fell and badly broke her upper arm minutes before we were departing the hotel for Cancun airport. The hotel staff acted promptly and within 5-10 min an ambulance and a higly qualified private orthopedic doctor were there to assist. The staff was genuinely concerned, on a scale of 1-10 I give the El Taj staff a 10 on how the handled the situation. They made sure our family was taken care of and assited with travel arrangements, doctor communication and proper documentation for leaving the country. Very impressive. You can feel safe at the El Taj, we are grateful to El Taj staff for all their assistance. You cannot go wrong with any aspect of this property!

Reviews.Title: “Just booked unit #336 for Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Dawson-J
Reviews.Content: BIG TIP OF THE DAY.......Book over phone for 2012 stays. Here is the deal I just got: they are having a promotion for advance booking for next year and even though I am going in peak season Feb. I still got an additional 10% discount. So 1st you get a 10% discount for any stay 7 days or more and then you get another 10% if you call on phone and ask for the promo. You also will get free breakfast passes for the # of guests your room sleeps. Hope this helps someone. Very excited to try out this new resort. Went to Playa about 15 years ago and had no interest in going back until I stumbled onto this place. Going to take my daughter 1st time scuba diving in Cozumel (which is on the top 10 world list for best reefs to dive). Cozumel is just a ferry ride from Playa and is a nice Island to explore on mopeds where you can go to the National ocean parks and snorkel or just check out the island. Montezuma's Revenge is in the water there and I got it last time by drinking a frozen Margarita (bad idea). It lasts about 1 week of strong diarrhea, mild nausea and no appetite. I never really got over it for several months. The symptoms got much less severe after the 1st week. So be careful about what you drink over there. I will write up a full report and post some great detailed pics of the master penthouse suite #336 that I am told is direct front beach on 4th floor and has the roof top outdoor kitchen/grill and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time! Highly recommend it (and we are picky!).”
Reviews.Author: Danielle C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned a few days ago from El Taj Oceanfront and really have nothing to complain about and would definitely go again. We are big travelers and have been lots of places and El Taj ranks among one of the top. This was our first time staying at a Condo/Hotel and we loved the experience and all it had to offer. It's like being at a boutique hotel, yet you have so much space to yourself! The staff was wonderful, very helpful and accommodating. We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit on the main level (unit 347) and were very impressed with how clean, modern, and comfortable it was. We loved having an evening cocktail on our patio surrounded by the lush landscaping and right near the koi pond & fountain. It was so relaxing and just what we needed. We weren't bothered by any noise from the clubs or street as some other reviews posted, but we could sometimes hear the family above us when they would move the chairs around inside their unit. We had breakfast at Indigo Beach Club included in our stay and we have to say that it was quite good. My husband tried a different egg dish each morning - he loved the variety while I loved that Roger remembered my special order without me even having to say anything. We also had lunch there a couple of times - we recommend the pizza. The beach is the only thing that isn't totally great because of the boats anchored right out front, but nothing is perfect in life. We still loved sitting on the comfy lounge chairs & beds and having yummy drinks served to us. If we wanted to go for a swim in the sea, we just walked a short distance to either side and the water was fine. The pool at El Taj is wonderful, perfect water temp and a beautiful, elegant design. We recommend renting a car through the concierge and going to the beach at Akumal one day - you can rent snorkel gear and see the sea turtles. The beach there is also very beautiful and you can pack a color and spend the day. There are restaurants and toilets there too in case you want some creature comforts. Only about 10 mins from Akumal is Yal ku lagoon where you can go for some great snorkeling. It is also an easy walk or cab ride to either Wal-Mart or Mega. We went to both and I have to say I was super impressed with the Wal-Mart. I despise Wal-Marts in the US and avoid them at all costs so I was reluctant to go to one in Mexico. Well, let me tell you that it was so clean, organized and the people were very helpful. They had a large selection of products and you could get pretty much anything you need from alcohol to food to floats for the sea. You should also go to Era Ora for dinner at least one night. Amazing home made pasta and delicious brick oven pizza. The staff is also great and the owners are wonderful. Hope you decide to visit and hope this review helped!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Toothdoc1228
Reviews.Content: I took our family on a trip to Playa del Carmen. We chose El Taj due to the outstanding reviews we read here on TripAdvisor. We could not have been more pleased. The facilities are amazing and the whole staff was wonderful. We were treated like royalty the entire week. I would definitely recommend El Taj to anyone traveling to Playa del Carmen. You are close to everything and the excursions to other areas are easily planned through Teresa (concierge). We took a trip to Xel Ha to allow the kids to snorkel, Teresa planned out everything for travel. Also, thank you to Hector at the front desk for helping us the entire week and scheduling our trips back and forth to the Cancun airport. Would also like to thank all of the staff at the Indigo Beach Club, especially Florentino (Chao), Carlos, and Mike. These guys do an amazing job of taking care of you out on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at El Taj”
Reviews.Author: sheknits
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at El Taj Condo Oceanfront. We had a lovely 3-bedroom/2 bath accommodations (unit 350). The rooms were nicely furnished & the kitchen fully equipped. Unit included washer & dryer, flat screen TVs in all rooms and small balconies, all with a beach/oceanview. The A/C worked very well. Our rental also included a rooftop patio with hot tub, gas BBQ grill, sink, refrigerator and plenty of seating/eating space that could serve a fairly large party. Pools were clean and appealing & the beach & ocean access were well maintained & beautiful. Lovely landscaping around pools & rooftop terraces. A great location in town within 2 blocks of 5th Ave for shopping & dining, but still felt very private, quiet & secure. We walked approx. 6 blocks to Mega for groceries and also walked back. But plenty of taxis in front of the store if your purchases are too heavy to carry. We received excellent assistance from concierge, Teresa, and from the front desk & housekeeping staff. Would recommend, but would suggest visiting at a different time of year. The heat in August was brutal & limited the time we spent enjoying all Playa has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot. Can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: Just had a long girls weekend to celebrate a birthday. The hotel provided the perfect place - great location, great rooms, great staff. Absolutely no complaints. Already thinking about the next excuse to visit El Taj!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and beautiful condo hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: mseldga
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in El Taj Oceanfront Unit 320 from July 30-August 6. First, I just have to echo all the previous comments about the beauty of the building, the pools, the common areas, etc. Our daughters adored the koi ponds and the very different feel of the pools at Oceanfront and Beachside. Despite the gorgeous beach view from the pool at Oceanfront, I preferred the quiet, peaceful feel - as well as the shady coolness - of the beachside pool. Neither pool was too crowded the week we were there and they were a nice break from the beach. The beach was very nice as well. I am one of those guests who enjoyed the boats being moored there on the beach. I thought they were picturesque and interesting - one day one of the boats brought in a huge snapper and the whole beach - including the employees of most of the hotels - gathered around to ogle the fish! One of my daughters caught the snorkeling bug this trip and she and my husband had a great time swimming out past the boats to snorkle - they saw a lot of fish and even an octopus trying to hide in a hole. My only complaint about the beach is just that it is a little loud and crowded for my taste, but I could have walked or taken a taxi a ways north or south and avoided the crowds and noise and it didn't bother me enough to do that. Just know that this is a people-watching, music-playing kind of beach experience rather than a peaceful, listen to the waves kind of experience. Indigo Beach Club at El Taj was wonderful. The staff was attentive and courteous - they'd even notice that the sun was moving and come move my umbrella without being asked! Being brought a drink and having the gorgeous view to stare at definitely helped to make up for the slightly crowded feel. I'd recommend getting to the beach early enough to get a chair or bed on the front row of the rows of chairs because that also helped a lot. All of our interactions with the staff - Hector and Theresa - were pleasant and our couple of requests were quickly met. Unit 320 was beautiful and very well appointed. We didn't notice noise from the clubs at night except in the master bathroom and that didn't bother us at all. It is really amazing how well insulated the rooms are when you realize just how loud the music from the nearby club is! We did notice loud singing, laughing, talking from fellow guests that lasted until 4 a.m. one night, but it was just the once and we drowned them out with a fan. We enjoyed the penthouse terrace that came with our room, but debated whether we really used it enough to make it worthwhile for us. I think it would be perfect for a large group or for someone who wanted to host other friends, etc., but it was just the four of us and we never did use the grill or the table up there other than to do a puzzle and play some games. We enjoyed the hot tub - especially at night when the view of Cozumel was breathtaking - but we might forego the terrace when we go back. We loved having the kitchen and shopping at Mega and Walmart and being able to fend for ourselves a little bit was part of the adventure for us. We loved being able to explore Playa and find our own favorite restaurants,etc. This location just can't be beat. I won't go into details about everything we did, but we loved Era Ora, Carboncitos, and El Fogon the most of the restaurants we found - we also loved La Buena Vida at Akumal for the ambience. Overall, we'd highly recommend El Taj!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Chen8israel
Reviews.Content: We stay in el taj hotel! It was one of the best vication I ever been.the service was perfect,they clean the room lick a new one.u must go ther...

Reviews.Title: “It was more than GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: RoamingOkie
Reviews.Content: My wife and two boys (ages 12 & 11) just returned from the El Taj in Playa del Carmen. The reviews for this particular property are very accurate but do not fully capture the beauty of the facility. The staff were incredibly helpful, Teresa in the concierge's office was the best at booking trips for us, giving us movies to watch and providing us advice for the area. We also enjoyed a chef preparing us a meal in the condo which literally made our mouths water. We stayed in Unit 333, a 3 bedroom on the second floor overlooking the ocean which had a great view and was in incredible condition physically and ascetically. The hot tub on the veranda looking over the ocean was so relaxing and was all ours! The room was also immaculately cleaned daily and the air conditioning was a treasure-we kept the unit at 74 degrees, and it was perfect. You can play as much or as little as you like and the facilities on the beach were the best in the entire region. They have huge bed-like lounges you can relax on with umbrellas that the staff works diligently to keep positioned correctly as the sun moves, and you can order food & drinks from the beach club if you like and they will bring you the drinks and food as you relax on your lounge. It really does not get any better than this! The pool they have is wonderful, and immediately above it, spilling over a glass wall, is another pool with three custom seats with massage jets in them-it is not heated, but is incredibly relaxing. The entire experience, from the Tulum Ruins to snorkeling to chilling on the beach was fantastic and an excellent environment for our family. It is one of the nicest beaches I have been to, and provided lots of people watching as well as ocean viewing. Seeing Cozumel off in the distance was also a treat. You can walk for miles up and down the beach in both directions, and we met some very friendly people there. The short 2 block walk to 5th Avenue was also fun as there is a wide variety of shops, restaurants and services offered for a mile in each direction. It was an easy walk to the Mega market which appears to be the Playa version of Wal-Mart (which is also in Playa) where we were able to get food for the week for lunch-it was sure nice having some snacks when we wanted them. It cost a whole $5.00 to get back to the condo with our groceries-quite a bargain as that included the tip!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Pretty Much Perfect”
Reviews.Author: axestone
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teenagers, and I, had a great, three-week stay at El Taj Oceanfront and look forward to a return visit! El Taj is a very stunning and spectacularly designed condo/hotel in an extremely convenient location in Playa del Carmen, right on the beach and very close – but not too close (!) – to 5th Avenue. We spent our first 9 days in unit 320, a two-bedroom penthouse suite located at the southwest corner of the building at the ‘back’. When I say ‘back’, I don’t mean this to be a negative. In fact, in my opinion this is a very positive feature as this particular unit is physically separated from any adjacent suites, i.e. no walls are shared with any neighbours and the suite is away from the action of the restaurant and beach club located at the ‘front’ of the building. Unit 320 is very well appointed and outfitted with all that one could possibly need. The kitchen has every sort of gadget and appliance anyone would ever require and the living area is very cozy with a great flat-screen tv and dvd player with a great sound system. The master bedroom is very well furnished with a great, double-sink ensuite bathroom. The other bedroom had two twin beds that our teenagers had to share before we would be moving to finish our stay in unit 325, an adjacent 3-bedroom penthouse unit. Due to relatively late booking, i.e. 3 months of so in advance of our stay, we were not able to secure the 3-bedroom unit for our entire stay. As it was, our two teenagers got along fine sharing the room… at least for most of the time! The suite has a stacking washer/dryer that was very convenient to have and was well used during our stay. The rooftop terrace is amazing with lush, tropical landscaping, a large thatched-roof shaded area, trellis, barbeque, counter, fridge, outdoor shower and hot tub Jacuzzi. We found the Jacuzzi to be a tad to warm at 105°F but very nice after we set it to 95°! The views from the rooftop terrace are amazing! Our move into the 3-bedroom penthouse unit 325 was very easy to accomplish since it is adjacent to, but separate, from unit 320. The front desk arranged a late check-out for us from 320 and an early check-in to 325, which meant that we simply had to move our belongings from one suite to another without having to pack everything up – a few quick trips and we were done! Unit 325 was very similar in design to 320, but it didn’t quite have the high level of coziness and intimacy that our first unit had – this would appear to have been from the willingness of the owner of unit 320 to leave out decorative bowls, paintings, additional furnishings, etc. and to provide a slightly higher quality and quantity of electronics in their suite for the use of guests then the owner of 325 was willing to do. Having said that, 325 was still very nice – of prime importance was the additional bedroom that allowed our kids to each have their own rooms, tv’s, temperature control, etc. Speaking of temperature control, both suites had air conditioning, which was very welcome, but the a/c units for 325 were considerably louder than those in 320 – but this is just quibbling as the sound level was relatively okay – it was simply quieter in 325. The roof terrace was very similar to that of our first unit, i.e. top marks all around. Some reviews mention noise from the nearby outdoor discos and we did notice the noise, but not to any level that caused us loss of sleep. Why the nearby clubs feel the need to try to out-decibel-level each other is beyond me… but then again my club-hopping days are long gone. Due to the length of our stay, we were provided with complimentary breakfast at the restaurant, complimentary beach club use, and complimentary use of the fitness centre. All of these features were top notch. The breakfast featured an extensive cold breakfast buffet with granola, yoghurt, fruit, toast, cakes, etc. and a selection of hot made-to-order entrees that included any style of eggs, bacon, and a few Mexican-style breakfast offerings. We ate at a table on the beach under palm trees and parasols every morning with an amazingly friendly and attentive staff. I can’t remember all of their names but they were all great to us! The beach club staff are fantastic and would assist us each day with setting us up with beach chairs, parasols, and towels. The guys would reposition the parasols throughout the day to ensure that everyone got the level of shade protection they desired while the restaurant staff would provide beachside drink and food service – it was amazing! The restaurant serves delicious food with a particularly fantastic pizza! The white sand beach is beautiful, the water is warm and inviting, and the fresh-water pools in the condo/hotel are refreshing. The gym is very well fitted out and we understand that it is going to be expanded. I would have liked to made use of a rowing machine, but this is simply a minor point. The famed 5th Avenue is very close by and yet sufficiently removed to not be a distraction. There are a multitude of restaurants on 5th Avenue or just a few blocks further afield. We particularly enjoyed Era Ora, El Fogon and Ah Cacao. In summary, El Taj is absolutely amazing and we miss it already… and it’s only been two days since we left! There is very little room left for improvement at El Taj – from what we saw and experienced during our stay, the management and staff are committed to making the place absolutely perfect! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Customer for life!”
Reviews.Author: travelP2P
Reviews.Content: Went in August 2010 (August 2010 was not listed on the scroll down tab), Stayed for a week in condo 345 Oceanfront. Everything was perfect, except for one thing. There was some sort of party in the beach resturant area, that played music loudly until 3am. We were not warned that the music would coutinue for that long. Could not sleep that whole night. VERY DISAPPOINTED that no note were given to residents. Other than that the service was excellent, and location was fabulous! And plus we got a great deal for our stay! My family and extended family couldn't have been happier!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: laynic
Reviews.Content: I went with my baby and i chose a room in the ground level and it was fantastic! The floor was excellent especially because she was crawlling. The crib was in good conditions and the decoration very pleased! In that period is very hot and you will not find restaurants with air conditioning so easy. Be aware of mosquitos for your baby. The condo is very well located and try the massage, it is fantastic! I recomend this hotel also for all service provided, since the rervation till the end.

Reviews.Title: “If only there were 6 star ratings!!! Simply Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: juliandrichard
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the best hotels in the world, Europe, Asia and South America etc. El Taj for service, location, staff, rooms, customer service is now at the top of our list! The rooms are modern, spacious and just gorgeous. The beach in front is beautiful. The breakfast in the Indigo Club was delicious, served right on the sand. Walking distance to incredible restaurants, amazing shopping and hip and happening clubs. A short ride to Akamal where you swim with the sea turtles for free.. we hired a guide to swim along with us though.. and that was worth every penny. We are already planning our next trip back to El Taj. Trip Advisors.. you really got it right.. This is DEFINITELY the number 1 hotel in playa del carmen!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Daughter's Wedding Was Exceptional Due To The Staff at El Taj”
Reviews.Author: bridesmom72311
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this condo hotel -- both as a group of family and friends staying together on this beautifully located beachfront property and guests at a lovely, sophisticated, and well-executed wedding. The condos are very well-maintained and provide all the amenities of home and the adjacent beach club/restaurant offers wonderful breakfasts and did an exceptional job catering several special parties, including the wedding itself. All the staff here are extremely helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip!”
Reviews.Author: knicholsrd
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa Del Carmen several times and chose El Taj Oceanfront so that we would have more space to spread out. It worked out perfectly. We stayed in a one bedroom suite (#355) which was more than enough space for my husband and me. We did quite a bit of research to figure out wich unit # was which because I definitely wanted a good size private balcony with ocean view, and an upstairs unit. The bedroom and living rooms had seperate a/c units which was nice. We also had a great balcony off the bedroom. The unit was very clean and fully stocked with more than we could ever need in the kitchen. The staff was wonderful and went above and beyond to be helpful. The location was great, right on the beach and close to everything but was still very quiet and relaxing at the hotel. I will say the gym was just ok, but I understand they are preparing to renovate it. Overall, it was a fabulous place to stay and we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryDoodles40
Reviews.Content: The El Taj is exactly the way it's shown on it's website. We had a wonderful penthouse condo which is perfect with kids as ours loved to sit in the hot tub and look at the ocean. This hotel is modern and has all the amenities that we required. It was so hot and humid when we were in Mexico and the air conditioning in the rooms were a very welcomed relief. There are boats moored out in front of the hotel but that does not hinder swimming right in front and actually it was great to talk to the fishermen that came in and see what the days catch was. Breakfast was wonderful at the hotel with a choice of cold or hot breakfast items and a choice of eating inside or right on the sand. We've been to this area seven times already and tried the all-inclusives but this beautiful little hotel is by far our favorite experience. We'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: clkbjk06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oceanfront #348 from July 9-16 and had a blast! El taj was simply fabulous!!! Location, atmosphere, decor, furnishings, amenities- Wow. We will definitely be returning. A few points to note: which Indigo Beach Club was very convenient- drinks were expensive, however, the pizza was very very good. We recommend going down the beach to Wicky's Beach Club (Monday at Wicky's is all you can drink from 12-6pm for 300 pesos, and order the Wicky Burger- awesome! I had it twice during the week). The included breakfast at Indigo was again convenient and very good for a few mornings, but I recommend talking a walk down 5th to 34th and stopping in Chez Celine for very very good French pastries and cappuccino to go- the walk in the morning is great exercise and the breakfast well worth it. Also- take a cab one morning down to 38th and have breakfast at the monkey cave- La Cueva del Chango. A+ for atmosphere and food! The pools at all the El Taj properties were really neat (oceanfront, beachside and porto playa- Maya villa was very small). We had a jacuzzi on our balcony but we never used it- it was too hot during the day and we were too tired every night. We also recommend the following restaurants: El Fogan, Carboncitos, Las Comales, La Pummerola and Ah Cacao.... Also Wet Wendy's in Cozumel for amazing and huge margaritas. Also Turtle Bay Bakery in Akumal for breakfast before snorkeling with the turtles and lunch at Lol Ha after snorkeling with the turtles. Take the Collectivos if you travel outside of Playa ($3US pp to get to Akumal). Take the ferry across to Cozumel one day to go to a beach club and snorkel. We spent one day at an AI hotel- Catalonia Royal Tulum, again we took the Collectivo to and from the resort in Xpuha for less than half the cost of a taxi round trip ($12US each way for 4 people). We have stayed at the CRT before and loved it but we wanted to do the non AI route thus time- glad we went back for one day it was a lot of fun to share the experience with our friends that we were traveling with on this trip. Shop on and off 5th, barter well and have fun. We did find that the pressure to buy from the shopkeepers was quite a bit more aggressive this trip, and it did get annoying, but keep a positive attitude and you will be fine. We loved El Taj and will return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just home from the best vacation”
Reviews.Author: mqgress
Reviews.Content: Just home from the best vacation !!! Tan and relaxed - couldn't ask for anything more. We had such a wonderful time-- condo is beyond amazing !! We enjoyed the hot tub, morning breakfasts on the patio, movie nights in the living room, and relaxing days on the beach, some great swims in the ocean--water is so calm and clear and the sand bar goes out so far--was able to swim and float more than i have ever been able to before-- LOVED IT!!!! Also enjoyed the small fishing boats coming and going from in front of the condo- one of the fishermen had me eye to eye with the baracuda he just caught. We did make it easily to WalMart and also up to 5th Street a couple nights, really enjoyed the atmosphere, along with our favorite on the beach lunch spot The Pirate and an incredible on the beach dinner at Fusion. The El Taj staff was so nice and polite-- everything was just perfect. Chairs and umbrellas and service on the beach - awesome!! Great perk for $50 -- we had outgoing phone service and internet in the room which was nice. One of the fun parts each day was to watch so many people stop along the beach to take photos of El Taj -- clearly the most beautiful spot on the beach -- we would just smile at each other knowing they were taking pics of where we were staying!!! Everything was just PERFECT!!!

Reviews.Title: “El Taj - If 10 Stars was avaialbel - That is what I would rank it.”
Reviews.Author: whoknows999
Reviews.Content: Jack Perlman runs 1 of the finest resort accomodations ANYWHERE ! Our family has traveled extensively, Mexico, Europe, South America and the Islands. We are always looking for the best. We found what has to be the very best of Mexico at El Taj. Forget the Ritz Carlton and the so called 5 star resorts. The entire process of booking was excellent, frinedly and they got all the details correct the 1st time. Upon ariival at the airport we were greeted by our driver who we set up thru Theresa at El Taj - Theresa can get anything and everything accomplished for you. Our arrival and check in at ELTaj was easy and fast. Then we entered # 334 and we absolutley loved the accomodations for all 6 of us. Service is beyond any expectations. The restaurant on the beach is 1 st class and the chef will make you feel at home and prepare anything you like. The pizza is the best we have ever had. Theresa will make sure the 5th Ave. restaurants give you superb service and special seating. She guided us each evening to 1st class meals. Don` t miss El Taj is just what a perfect stay should be and you will be treated better than virtually any place you have ever been. JL - Texas

Reviews.Title: “It's Everything They Say It Is. Will Definitely Return"”
Reviews.Author: DCSteveTraveler
Reviews.Content: All of the positive things you've read online about El Taj are very accurate. We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath penthouse condo in the "Beachside" building, which is literally 15 feet across a quiet street from the main building known as "Oceanfront." Same look and feel. You have access to all of the amenities of the "Oceanfront" building and don't feel like you're separated or sectored off. It rained every day, so didn't get much penthouse rooftop patio use, but the inside of condo was so nice, didn't mind staying in and relaxing. Only negatives, and they are somewhat minor: an odor (sewer gas? dead mouse?) in the guest bedroom and occasional water dripping from the master bath (which we think might have been AC condensation.) Also, had a minor screw up w/airport pickup but the front desk staff was ON IT and remedied quickly. Everything else was FANTASTIC! Also, check out the nearby properties (Maya Villa etc) for a lower price, same access to amenities (you can use El Taj pool, beach club restaurant, beach, etc. and 5th Ave is VERY close, convenient. This was our first time to PDC and thanks to El Taj, we loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the weather but excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DrJoCardiff
Reviews.Content: Number 1 Hotel in Playa del Carmen, so we expecting something really good. Indeed it was good but the tropical storm for the first three days of our holiday took the shine of the experience especially when the electricy and the water went off for 4 hours. Maybe June was not the time to go. The rooms were very well appointed. However we were disappointed that although we were down for a sea view, it was actually very difficult to see the sea. The little restaurent did excellent breakfasts. The beach is lovely and Playa is a lively resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed ambient hotel, aesthetically beautiful with a lot of thought gone into the environment that the guest is in”
Reviews.Author: rachaelp90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel seeking relaxation after a busy week with family in Florida and wanted sometime to unwind and relax. On arrival we were pleased with our choice and after a brief lowdown with reception about the hotel we were shown to our condo. We were delighted with our apartment it was clean, modern and offered all the conveiences of home which included washer dryer dishwasher, and fully equipped kitchen with modern appliances all in pristine condition. Room service was excellent and were through on every visit. The hotel had a restaurant but because we were so close to 5th avenue the main street We were spoiled for choice and felt it was a waste to spend too much time within the hotel so cannot tell you about that! There was a gorgeous beach with better than average loungers which were very comfy but the waiter service stopped after a certain time as they then prepared opening the sushi restaurant a little annoying when the sun is still up and you want to enjoy it with a few more drinks! The hotel has an infinity pool which is neat and a small but clean and luxurious looking swimming pool. With it's Buddhas, statues and cream and brown decor a lot of thought has gone into the whole experience of staying here and would reccommend highly this hotel would definitely come back here in a heartbeat!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Pammy2Pammy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long vacation in Playa del Carmen. We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo at El Taj Oceanfront. All I can say is WOW! This was the perfect place...perfectly outfitted condo which was beautifully decorated, excellent restaurant, and staff ALWAYS attentive going above and beyond to help you and make certain you were taken care of! The condo was exceptionally clean with everything that our family needed. We loved the fact that there was a washer/dryer and that even the detergent was provided. The rooms were very roomy and comfortable. Even the bathrooms were special--the showers were really nice. I loved the decorating style of the entire resort! Very "Bali" like. Flat screen tv's in every room (although watching tv wasn't important, it was nice to have it late at night). We stayed in unit 330 and truly enjoyed the spacious Palapa upstairs. There was plenty of privacy for the hot tub. We cooked in the condo several times and having a nice grill to prepare dinner with was great! One of my favorite things about this exceptional resort was having daily maid service. It was wonderful to stay in accommodations so comfortable and come back to clean rooms each day with beds made, bathrooms clean, and fresh towels. The location was perfectly situated on the beach in the heart of downtown. You could walk to the shops and restaurants and didn't need to have a rental car. We enjoyed having the services of the concierge. They arranged several excursions for us and loved having the DVSs and games available for the times when it rained. The food and service at the restaurant was fabulous! Servers were always friendly and attentive. The food was top notch! The food and beverage service was wonderful on the beach as well. The resort offered comfortable beds and chairs with umbrellas on the beach. I can't say enough about this resort! There really wasn't anything that we didn't like. We will definitely be back! Thank you El Taj :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Hildent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El taj ocean front, in a penthouse. The condo was really nice, so was the rooftop with jacuzzi, a spectacular view and a spacious dining/relaxing aera, bbq grill etc.The photos on their website are very accurate. I would recommend renting a Penthouse, especially if you travel with kids, its a nice "hang out" place with privacy. The beach is really nice, and the beach club is ok. The gym is very nice and only a 3 minute walk. So is the 5th avenue. The service was very good, daily maid service etc. The restaurant/ room service is my only complaint. They often didnt answer the phone, and other times when we wanted to order from the menu that was in our condo, they told us they served only pizza and sushi at the moment. This happend several times.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: reybeast
Reviews.Content: This place is great, we stayed in rm 323, which is just above the pool that overlooks the beach. Highly recommend getting the breakfast option when booking room, makes it so convenient to just go downstairs. For the fruit, coffee,aguas, hot chocolate! Word of advice, be generous with your tips, these people make 6$ a DAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location & Tips for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: SissyinCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Traveled with hubby and two boys (22 & 18) to El Taj last week. We stayed in room 320 which was on the 4th floor and had the roof top penthouse. Only negative was the room was in the back of the hotel; so it was very private, but I did really miss seeing the beach out my window. The beds were super comfy; they felt like memory foam (if you know what that is) and I had no trouble sleeping even on the first day. I usually wear earplugs (even at home), but I didn't need them here it was so quite (keep in mind that ALL the clubs are right down the street, but I didn't hear a thing). The 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds, my kids had no trouble fitting into them (they're big boys), although they sometimes fell asleep on the huge couch watching T.V. A few tips: go to Wall Mart ($5 taxi ride 1 way from the hotel) to stock up on food (don't forget the bug spray), use Trip Advisor for restaurant look ups or else you'll probably end up on 5th street paying too much for an average meal and the best things we did was visit The Jungle Place (monkey sanctuary) and the Mayan Ruins (without the shuttle bus or tour, just walk and enjoy at your own pace), then jump into the blue beautiful water at the end. My best advise is to take it slow while visiting; a week wasn't really enough time so we'll be back again one day! Email me if you want more information on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: SandmanCoppell_TX
Reviews.Content: We just completed a week at El Taj in Playa Del Carmen. Things we loved: - Easy access to 5th Avenue restaurants and shops - Friendly and helpful staff at El Taj and the Indigo Beach Club - Great pool at the Beachside location - Oceanside is nice too but Beachside pool is much nicer - Dining at Sur, Era Ora, Agave Azul and Wicky's Things we were not so crazy about: - The fishing boats parked all along the beach - The extremely loud music coming out of Coca Maya until 5:00 a.m. - A/C issues in Unit 302 that never got resolved while we were there - Limited family gathering space inside the unit (as compared to the private homes we typically rent on beach vacations is Destin, Florida). We stayed in the Beachside section of El Taj (which is really across the street from the beach but really nice and a very short stroll to the beach). We were in Unit 302 which is the largest in the property. There were nine of us so we needed all the space we could get. The only real lodging issues we had were the A/C was only working in portions of the unit so several of the bathrooms were hot (not much fun to take a shower in bathroom where there is no air moving). We reported the problem on Day 1 upon arrival and followed up several times but the problem only got partially resolved. Another thing to consider is the location of your unit (really the location of your bedroom windows) relative to the clubs down the street (Coco Maya and the Blue Parrott). Each night my wife and I would swear that the D.J. and his speakers were on our balcony...even though our unit was a far away as you can get on the Beachside from the clubs. The sound penetrated the master bedroom windows so much that you would swear they were open. Now are friends who were staying in the junior master on the same floor heard no music when they closed their door and went to bed each night. So...if you plan to stay in the master bedroom in Unit 302 bring some ear plugs. After night 3 I began to use my ear buds from my iPod and that helped tremendously. We are fun people and enjoy a good time but you have to understand that they party until 5:00 a.m. so it can be a long night. I don't think the music would be as much of an issue Oceanside vs. Beachside but it is something to be prepared for. Another piece of information we wish we would have known is that you are not allowed to bring coolers (even small ones like the one we had) into the beach area. The Indigo Beach club staff approached us almost immediately upon our arrival on the beach to inform us that our cooler was not allowed. The hotel should let you know this up front so you can be aware. They were forceful but not rude. Our plan was to bring some soft drinks and water to the beach each day and purchase our adult beverages from the beach club staff. Not a huge deal but again...it would have been nice to know this in advance. We used our cooler to store the cameras in the rest of the week so bringing it along wasn't a lost cause. The location of El Taj was super. Easy walk to 5th Avenue and all the great restaurants and shops. Easy walk to Mega Mart and Wal-Mart (definitely go to Mega and not Wal-Mart...much cleaner and much better selection). We would walk there to get groceries for lunch, etc and then take a taxi ($5USD) back. Very convenient. We had a great time at Xplore with zip lines and swimming in the cenotes. It is a lot of walking and stair climbing but a great time. Teresa the concierge got us passes for Xplore that were about $30 off the retail price per person. Also, take a cab to and from Xplore. It is well worth the small additional cost vs. riding on a bus with a bunch of folks and then having to stop at other resorts...especially along the way home when you are whipped and ready to chill in the hot tub. Restaurants we recommend are: Sur (there is also a homeade ice cream shop that you can see from the south side of Sur that is outstanding) Wicky's (great value for dinner) We also did lunch on the beach here one day and it was excellent (great burger and fries if you are missing the comfort food) Era Ora - very friendly staff and excellent Italian food and brick oven pizza - only one block from the hotel Agave Azul - they are just getting things organized and opened up but we had a blast dining outside. The wait staff was fun and we all ended up dancing to the music provided by the strolling guitarist who had a very interesting rendition of Jail House Rock. Mi Pueblo - excellent food and two for one drinks. Overall a super time at El Taj and unless you are determined to boogie board at the beach directly in front of your chairs, I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for all ages”
Reviews.Author: Ndubner
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth return visit in two years. We stayed in all the condo hotel properties (they have 4 properties) and we think El Taj is the best one if you want to stay directly on the beach. We spent 5 days with 4 different families as a graduation gift for our kids. We rented several units el taj oceanfront and in beachside (across the street) and one of the units was  directly on the beach (unit 332 is directly on the beach, step out to the sand). The folks at the hotel asked us to share our experience on trip advisor and we honestly thought about keeping it a secret. But after learning that El Taj is ranked so high on trip advisor we thought it's time to let the secret out. This place rocks and it's the best of Playa! El Taj in the heart of Playa and everything at your fingertips. Our teenage kids used the GYM ( designed & operated by the founders of the famous Equinox Gyms) and said it was one of the best Gyms. The condos provide luxury appointments and amenities found only at the best hotels. Every detail was carefully planned out. The bedding and comfort was great. As repeat customers they surprised us with a luxury van and took us all to their private beach club called Al Cielo. Simply amazing beach and we are world travelers and never saw a beach quite like this. Make sure you ask the front desk about this beach club even though the beach in front of El taj (called Indigo) is awesome and amazing food. Oh by the way you can use both pools  at Beachside and Oceanfront and the one at beachside is a black pool and very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “From the moment we left the airport to our reluctant departure this hotel was just fabulous”
Reviews.Author: diamond5_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Taj Oceanfront with my 2 sisters for our birthday celebrations for 7 nights in May. We had organised an airport pick-up with the hotel and we were out of the airport and on the road swiftly with a cold drink and in an air-conditioned Escalade within minutes of walking out the airport doors. On arrival to the hotel the door staff were polite and very helpful in getting our bags from the car to the reception area. Check-in was friendly and swift and the porter who brought our bags to our room (Daniel) was pleasant and friendly and showed us how everything worked before leaving. We booked our condo directly with the owner and it was as beautiful as it looked in the photos. It was finished to a really high standard and had everything we needed even some good coffee to start our holiday. The kitchen was well equipped even for those who want to cook for themselves. The air-conditioning had separate controls for the livingroom and the bedroom which was great as the bedroom got a lot of sun and heated up a lot during the day. Our condo had a balcony with a beautiful ocean view and was the perfect place to have breakfast as it got the morning sun. We picked up groceries in the Mega supermarket so that we could make breakfast or brunch in the condo every morning and this worked out really well for us. We also cooked a couple of dinners in the condo, when we were too tired to leave the condo after being out on excursions, and they were fabulous too. The bedroom was beautiful and bright and the bed was very big and very comfortable. We had an additional bed made up in the living room and this was also very comfortable. There was plenty of closet space for three girls for a week. The bathroom was finished in a very luxurious style and had a very large shower area. We did have a leak at the sink on the second day which we reported to reception and they had a guy up and the leak repaired almost as soon as we had put down the phone. The pools at both El Taj Oceanfront and El Taj Beachside (just across the street) are fabulous. I especially loved the tranquil setting at Beachside and finished every day with a swim in that pool, a nice cool-down after a day on the beach. The beach itself is glorious and the there were always lots of sun beds and parasols at the beach club. Massages are available at the beach club but I didn't avail of this service so I can't comment but it's nice to have the option. We had breakfast at the beach club on our first morning and it was really nice, lots of fruit, cereals, meats, cheeses, pastries and cooked-to-order egg dishes and good coffee. We also had some snacks at beach which were good too, especially the pizza. I would also recommend the lemonade especially if you have built up a real thirst in the sun. Food and drink service at the beach club, we found, was efficient and polite. There is a sunglasses cleaning service at the towel bar at the beach club which I think is a great idea especially if, like me, you use loads and loads of sunscreen and your shades get all greasy. The beach itself is beautiful, the colours are just amazing and the sand is so soft and so white. It is by far the most beautiful town beach I've been on. I know some people complained about the boats in front of the hotel but I thought they added character to the view. As many other reviewers have said if you walk a short distance there are no boats to block access to the sea but what we found was if you walked out beyond the boats you got great space to have a peaceful swim as there weren't many other swimmers there and the boats don't move in and out enough to disturb you. The water is quite shallow for some distance out. We booked some excursions through Teresa at the Conceirge desk which is located at Maya Villa. She is just fabulous, very friendly, very knowledgeable and made good recommendations. We visited Tulum and Coba and also took a tip to Cozumel. If you're not sure exactly what you want to do Teresa will be able to help you make the right decision. The tours themselves were brilliant with fabulous transport (we were only 4 for the trips to the ruins so had an air-conditioned car with our own private guide). Our guide was very knowledgeable and had brilliant English (great as we all have really bad Spanish) so were able to get the most from the information he was giving. We had booked a snorkelling trip also but it was late in the week and the sea got too rough to do it. We would really have loved to have done it but maybe next time. The hotel is ideally located, right on the beach and just a short walk to Avienda 5 where all the shops and restaurants are. In the condo the hotel has provided a preferred guest card and a list of recommended restaurants (and other stuff too) whereby guests at El Taj get discounts. We availed of this on a few nights and had some really good meals, especially at Como Como and Yaxche. There is a lovely atmosphere in Playa Del Carmen, it's relaxed and colourful yet very chic and cosmopolitan. I would say there is something for everyone. All in all I really couldn't recommend this hotel high enough. It is perfectly located, it has lovely facilities, the gardens and setting are beautiful, and the staff are friendly, polite, efficient and understated (I especially like this as I really don't like hotel staff that are constantly in my face feigning interest with fake smiles). The condos are very spacious and are finished to such a high standard and it is just brilliant to have the freedom and autonomy of having your own place in the sun with all the service and amenities of a luxury hotel. Would love to go back there again and hopefully I will really soon

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: RembeckiG
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I were planning a trip to Playa Del Carmen, we chose the #1 rated El Taj Oceanfront Condo Hotel and we absolutely made the right choice. On arrival we were met by a friendly staff who checked us in and escorted us to our penthouse suite #345, a beautiful 3 bedroom (beds were so comfortable), 2 baths, with a full kitchen, living room and flat panel televisions in every room. We also had our very own private roof-top terrace with gas grill, hot tub, shower, table & chairs and sectional sofa surrounded by plants and flowers with a great view of the Caribbean. I am confined to a wheelchair but had no problems getting around the property because of the wide walkways, elevators and the very helpful staff. We enjoyed the food at the beach club, Indigo, especially the breakfast buffets and appreciated the attentiveness of the waiters.We sat out on the balcony every night and enjoyed the quiet and the lights of Cozumel. We also went over everyday to Fifth Ave to enjoy the many restaurants and shops. Favorites included La Parrilla, Hot Baking Co. and Babes.. Thanks to the management and Staff of El Taj Oceanfront for a wonderful vacation. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really don't want to tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: aso1960
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at El Taj from the 9th-17th June 2011. We also had another family with us. 8 people total. We booked the ocean front penthouse unit, and I cannot begin to say how awesome it was! The entire staff (including Hector, Jorge, and Theresa) were the most helpful and friendly people we've ever encountered. We are world travelers, and I don't think we have ever had better service, even at the Ritz! The location, condo, restaurant, pool, facilities were top notch! We had kids ages 17-21 with us, and felt completely safe with them on their own at night. I read a review about the beach club employees being rude. NOT TRUE!!! Though the cruise ships come in a couple of days a week, The staff saved our beach lounges and made sure we were special the entire time. Though the night clubs are nearby, no noise at all. Walking distance to everything. Rooftop deck probably the best place in all of Mexico. We never wanted to leave and actually cried when we checked out. The best place to stay in Carmen no question. We have booked our next stay, and are actually looking forward to seeing our Playa family again. Hands down, best vacation ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Talk about great service and stunning location.....”
Reviews.Author: ValReina
Reviews.Content: I had business in Riviera Maya area for a few days and like to stay at different hotels when I'm there so I can get to know what each resort has to offer and I can recommend to my friends, familyco-workers and clients! I would highly recommend El Taj! I got there (very late on a Wed evening) the front desk night manager was super nice and got me to my room very quickly. The condo rooms are spacious and trendy, and are great since they offer a living room, full kitchen with all amenities, nice bathroom and a very comfortable bed! I didn't spend much time there, because I was working but also because the location is right in downtown Playa del Carmen, and you can walk to EVERYTHING, not to mention being right on the beach. I would especialy recommend this to friends looking for a romantic spot to spend some time or get married. Who knows...maybe I can talk the hubby into renewing our vows there!

Reviews.Title: “Certain issues need to be addressed, pretty good overall!!”
Reviews.Author: nghianguyen825
Reviews.Content: The positives: El Taj is a great looking condo hotel that is very well-kept. Great location, I practically walked everywhere. Shops, restaurants, clubs... everything is around. One would be curious about the noise level. We did not have any trouble falling asleep, nor were we awaken by the noise at anytime. The beach was nice, there were plenty of boats there, but once you go past them. White sand and clear water, definitely was not an issue there. Overall, I'm pretty much on the same page as most of the previous reviewers about what's good with El Taj. The negatives: the staff just was not the friendliest bunch. Hector at the front desk, and Theresa with excursions service, were awesome. They were the only people that went out of their way to make sure that we were enjoying our time at El Taj. Everyone else wouldn't even smile, we just didn't feel very welcomed there at all. The service at Indigo Beach Club was even worse. The first day I was there, they offered to put our beach towels on our lounge chairs for us. The rest of the time, they just gave us the towels. I did tip them the first time. They were extremely attentive to some of the guests, while totally ignored others. Unfortunately for us, we were not part of those lucky ones. One waiter, Carlos, was a total creep. He had a tendency to hang around female guests for long periods of time. At one point, he even laid down on one of the bed with the guest. Last, this has nothing to do with El Taj, but you may find this handy if it's your first time visiting Playa del Carmen. Be ready to be harassed non-stop for everything from food, massage, tours.... Everywhere you walk, you will have people in your face trying to get you to buy something from them. If you say no, do prepare for some of them to make some lame jokes about you.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj Was First Class!”
Reviews.Author: FredWestHartford_CT
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Playa Del Carmen and the El Taj Beachfront in May 2011 w/ my spouse and two "kids", ages 23 adn 19. Let me simply say this was a first class vacation for our entire family. We all said we'd do it again in a heartbeat! Before booking, we read some the the negative comments about "boats blocking beach access/views" and "noise from the club at night", but frankly, these things just didn't bother us. Everything about El Taj was outstanding...from the airport transport, to the staff (especially Hector & Daniel), to the condo itself (#324), to the onsite Indigo Beach Club, to the concierge services, the housecleaning services, etc. I'm sure I'm forgetting things as there were so many to rave about. In any case, for us, it was a superior option to an all-inclusive. And Playa was awesome too...great restaurants (Era Ora, El Fogon, Yaxche, Babes, John Grey's, La Cuevo Del Chango to name justa few), shops, clubs, etc. I could go on and on. Suffice it to say...we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: waytogo400
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom and it was impeccable and well appointed with a nice view of the ocean. The staff was great and tried to assist with everything and anything. Definitely 5 star service! Their fitness center is a professional set up and they have wonderful yoga classes on the beach. One day their Indigo beach club was full with a wedding group so we headed over to their other beach club only 1 block away. They provide complimentary lounge chairs to El Taj guests and we recommend it highly because the other beach club has no boats parked in front. The food is also much more reasonably priced and thought the prices at Indigo were inflated. If you want authentic Mexican food (inexpensive ) check out the restaurant next to Indigo on the side street. The towel guys at El Taj beach provide complimentary sun lotions and always offered to clean our sun glasses with a professional cleaning machine every day. Nice touch! They also provide children beach toys and water floats which are great. Our kids loved it and the swimming pool at El taj is amazing. Definitely check out Wicks beach club and restaurant especially if you love to swim in the ocean clear of any boats. We throughly enjoyed their rustic & romantic pier in front of El Taj and watch the sunset overnight with a cocktail or two. Simply the best location to everything in Playa and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury condos, amazing location and service!”
Reviews.Author: Anyacalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great condos with lots of options to meet any family needs. It is very convenient to have kitchen even though we would still end up having breakfast at the Beach Club nearby. The location is amazing, literally 1 minute away from the busy touristy area of 5th avenue. The location could not be more perfect. We loved the service and we loved the interiors of the condos. Creative architecture, lots of plants and flowers around and little ponds to look at. What we loved: 1) location 2) trendy architecture, interiors and layout of condos 2) closeness of the condos to the beach 3) nice beach club 4) friendly service 5) availability of tours and sightseeing nearby 6) grocery shopping nearby 7) great restaurant recommendations by the Condos and privilege card. All the recommendations were top notch, delicious food! What we didn't like as much: 1) the beach and water have boats so you have to walk along the beach to find a better spot 2) one pool that gets crowded with people 3) clubs nearby that create lots of noise on weekends 4) condo had a wedding one night and the dancing later on kept us at night for way too long. It was so loud it would shake our walls Overall, I still feel that I would definitely return to stay at El Taj again, yet I'll be more careful selecting the unit I want.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Absolutely Loved El Taj!”
Reviews.Author: MRKSanClemente
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent Memorial weekend at the El Taj Hotel. It was our first visit to the El Taj and we will absolutely stay here again! Everything about this hotel is perfect! Great views, great beach, fun atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Condo”
Reviews.Author: DeniseO2011
Reviews.Content: The penthouse condo with the rooftop terrace was superbly beautiful. Our group of six was very pleased with the friendly staff; clean, modern, spacious, quiet room; delicious breakfast; beach service and activities; convenient location (within walking distance to shops, restaurants, night life, etc.). The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were better than home (I'm very pillow picky). The rooftop terrace was a highlight of the room with its' spectacular view and comfortably large seating area. A less desirable comment -- during our stay the elevator was out of service, and the hot tub heater stopped working on the last day. However, the staff compensated with free breakfasts. We loved our El Taj getaway and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “not the view I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: marielaguirre
Reviews.Content: Very nice condos, very pretty,,but when I booked the room it appear like an ocean view and we had the worst view to a celing of another building, you cannot enjoy the beach becacuse is more like a port for small boats,,the breakfast was included but there where very few options,,location was ok,,you can walk to 5th avenue..it is a very luxury and expensive place to stay it is ok if you wanto to stay in the room and you dont care about being at the beach,,,they say it has a beach club,but there are only a few beach lounge beds with view to the boats,,,

Reviews.Title: “Great location--lots of small children”
Reviews.Author: formerflygirl
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat--both for the beach and all of the town amenities. But, only the three bedroom units on the ends of the buildings have a of view of the ocean. Units towards the street are dark and have no view. The pool is small and had so many babies and toddlers using it, that we stayed out. The units vary quite a bit. We had a better one bedroom. It wasn't large, but very well equiped. Great housekeeping and beach. The taco place behind the hotel (where the staff eats) is great and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Playa”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Playa Del Carmen since 1983 and have seen it change immensely over the years. We have tried many of the hotels in Playa from 5 star, to all inclusives, to real simple and I must say this place is a wonderful find! We usually come to Playa and Cancun 3 times a year and each time we try different locations as so many wonderful new hotels keep popping up. We definitely have our favorite in Cancun but we have not found our favorite in Playa. Some times we like being right in the town and other times we like being a tad bit away like the Mayakoba or Maroma area. When we saw El Taj last year we knew we wanted to try it and we are so glad we did. It is so far the best spot we have found IN town. We stayed in unit 336 3 BR 3 BA penthouse with roof deck front facing ocean. I think this is by far the best unit along with unit 345. Both get the front views. There are only 2 units that have this complete view that also have the upstairs rooftop. From the deck, this unit by far, had the best view. Unobstructed ocean and beach views were amazing. As everyone has mentioned earlier, the condos are lovely and well appointed. Perfect location in town, 14th and the beach...can't get any better than that if you want to be in the heart of it. One or 2 nights we did hear a faint thump thump from the music at clubs down the street. It does get quiet at 2 however and this is very reasonable for an area with this much action. The front desk staff was great but several times were hard to reach throughout the day for questions. One of our few minor complaints of this place was room service availability. They stated they had it until 7 pm but several days (3 to be exact) no one answered the phones mid day(we tried for a long time) so we could not order food delivered up. We wanted drinks, snacks and lunch served up on the private deck and did not feel like cooking or going down to any of the restaurants...the private roof patio was so lovely it was hard not to want to use it. One day the room service did answer and we ordered and it was fabulous just hanging in the hot tub and looking down at the great view in private and enjoying great food and no clean up.... Chill. The one restaurant that is there is good and our room came with free breakfast which was enjoyed by all of us. The drinks and food were relatively expensive...more expensive than the Ritz, Rosewood or Banyon Tree, I was kind of surprised at this. There is only one restaurant on this property but many near by within walking distance. You could not sign to your room so you had to carry cash when you ate or drank. Knowing this was a condo unit we were not disappointed but had hoped for a little more condo/hotel amenities. I really do not want to complain because it was a lovely place. Another area that people speak about is the lack of beach in front of this property...yes, this is true. There are a few dozen fishing boats out front and we heard they are trying to change this. But for now you have to walk a few minutes to the right or left to go in the water with out knocking into the ropes from the boats...not really a big deal, the view is still stunning. It actually keeps the area much quieter. One other small complaint...It would be nice to not have to turn in a card every time you got a towel, (and you only get one towel)....It is too bad people take towels so they have to have these policies. This is one area the five star hotels shine in comparison. The housekeeping at this property was outstanding and truly amazing. They keep the rooms and grounds spotless at all times...really nice crew too. 10 stars to them! They stocked our kitchen with things I pre-ordered so we wouldn't have to go shopping upon arrival and this was a nice touch...really fair prices and only 25.00 extra bucks to have this done. We could just start relaxing right away. We stocked the unit with extra ice, liquor, coffee, fruit and makings for guac. Everything else is here. We never cooked meals as there are so many great restaurants in Playa to visit but it is really nice having a kitchen. The roof top deck is amazing and is huge. Lots of shade and sun and a hot tub that is great. There is a sink and refrigerator and a great grill. The pool at the property is not huge but plenty big...not a lap pool. It is great for small kids and lounging. The bathrooms are nice and we loved the hard bed. All rooms came with climate control and remote control fans. The washer and dryer is great to have while traveling. The flat screen TV's were great. The GYM was a block away and was free with stay. It had a lot of equipment and classes.....Like everyone has said...this place is GREAT! We will come back to El Taj for sure. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bashar911
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to EL TAJ. I am usually dexcribed as too picky when it come to hotels. Hotels arethe most important part of my trip. I love this place. Its location is perfect. The walk to anything you want such as Walmart to load up on groceries, restaurants, the beach in front, the pool, the spa. You dont need a vehicle and i love that. (unless you want one of course to go touring around). I've been to many "5 star hotels" in Mexico. THIS is truly a 5 star!!!!. Its good for solo travelers, families, couples, basically it takes care of anyone and their needs. A must try!! Bashar Kamel Calgary, Alberta

Reviews.Title: “El Taj is the best upscale, condo beachfront hotel in the heart of Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: LindaL_sf
Reviews.Content: We got married in November 2010 and stayed at El Taj Condo Hotel (www.eltaj.com) with a number of our wedding guests. We had the best stay and had such an amazing experience at El Taj! El Taj Condo Hotel is a quaint, upscale beachfront hotel located in the center of Playa del Carmen and right on the beach. You are less than a five-minute walk to all the best restaurants, bars and clubs. The hotel offers complimentary parking on site, and free access to the largest, upscale gym in Playa del Carmen (2 minute walk away). The hotel rooms are condos owned by private owners, but maintained by one company, so you get all the benefits of a full condo with all the services of an upscale hotel. The hotel was built in 2010, so everything is brand new with modern kitchens, spacious bedrooms, nice bathrooms, and each unit has a large balcony. The décor is very similar amongst all the units. The best units are the penthouses along the beachfront, which have amazing rooftop decks with full BBQ equipment, jazuzzi and lounge furniture. Fantastic views and a great beach right there!! Since it was our wedding we stayed in one of the penthouses and it was worth every penny. What a luxurious experience! Lourdes Diaz, the hotel manager, provided the best service! She took care of all of our guest reservations and booked transportation from the airport for some of our guests. The hotel offered generous discounts if we booked a certain number of rooms for our wedding. Our guests loved their stay there and still rave about it today! The staff was so friendly and helpful with all the things I needed for my wedding. I couldn’t believe it. We dropped off our wedding dress and groom’s suit at the front desk at the last minute and they got it steamed for us and delivered it to our room within 2-3 hours on the day of our wedding. The dress and suit looked great! They went above and beyond the call of duty. I really feel like they are family to me. The best thing about this hotel is that you are in the heart of the action of Playa del Carmen, but can also get a very quiet, private experience while staying at the hotel. There are two large, popular beach clubs two doors down from the hotel (one of them is the Blue Parrot with the famous fire show on the beach) and when you are in the rooms, you don’t hear a thing. I was so surprised how quiet it is in the rooms. Since you are 1 block from the main street (5th Avenue), you don’t get all the loud walking traffic late at night. Most people walk on 5th Avenue at night. The street in front of the hotel is very quiet. El Taj also has a beach club and restaurant called Indigo with a great continental breakfast and where you can get a nice lunch on the beach on one of their beach beds.
