Basically, you get all the benefits of an expensive all-inclusive resort, because it is on the beach, has numerous restaurants within a 10 minute walk, entertainment all around you, but at a fraction of the price of a fancy all-inclusive resort. The great thing about the condo is that many of the best units have 2-3 bedrooms, so you can travel with other couples or families and when you split the cost of the hotel it ends up being a great deal. Also, by having a full kitchen, you can save quite a bit of money on breakfast and lunch and not have to dine out all the time. There are a number of grocery stores close by. Plus, you save on cab rides because you are in the heart of the city. Everything is walking distance. Check out the website to see the amazing photos of the hotel --- www.eltaj.com. I highly recommend this hotel for a nice, relaxing stay in the heart of Playa del Carmen. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: general0621
Reviews.Content: What a find. El Taj was a great surprise. My wife and I usually go the “all inclusive” route but I’m so glad we came here. Our condo was beautiful and we had such a great experience. We were only 2 blocks from 5th Avenue where all the great restaurants and shopping spots are. I would have never found these places if we were holed up at a typical hotel all week. I loved the pool areas but my wife likes the beach—the sand is like powder under your fee. Whoever built this place is a real designer. Every detail is perfect from the landscaping to the sculptures from Indonesia or wherever, it felt like you were on a private island. For restaurants, you have to try Casa Mediterraneo and the Monkey Cave—the food and service was 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOLIDAYS”
Reviews.Author: rosalba1421
Reviews.Content: we have spent 10 fantastic days in this condo hotel on the extraordinary beach of playa del carmen. the apartment is great, very comfortable beds, excellent service, excellent food in the restaurant on the beach. very good place for kids and teens and the complete family,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: teamspeciale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El Taj Oceanfront for 5 nights during Spring break. We are a family of 5 with 3 girls ages 14, 12, & 9. The rooms were gorgeous and the food was excellent. The only negative was the fact that the diving boats were anchored in front of the hotel preventing swimming there. In order to swim in the ocean, we had to walk a few hundred yards down the beach. It really wasn't terrible but it would have been nice to swim in front of our hotel. Besides that everything was wonderful. It was in a great location, walking distance to town with fun shops and restaurants. The service was very good and we all had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AnnaInacio
Reviews.Content: It took me about 4 months to find the perfect place for my boyfriend and friends. We have stayed at many 5 star places the last one was The Royal Playa Del Carmen which was a big disappointment. When I finally found El Taj and had spent our vacation there for New Years it was excellent and fulfilling. We had the penthouse and enjoyed every day of it. We will definitely be back and hope that the rating will stay at number 1 as it should. Hope everyone will enjoy as much as we did:)

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaExpert
Reviews.Content: Now we now what all the hype is all about and why this amazing condo hotels is rated #1 on TripAdvisor! Its location couldn't be better - it's right on the beach, and a block away from 5th Avenue. But as my personal discovery, I have to say that when you stay at El Taj, you realize how superior condo-style hotels are vs traditional hotels. I am now a firm believer in condo hotels! Why pay the same price for a small hotel room, when you can get your own luxury apartment that comes with a living room, private bathrooms, personal Jacuzzi and our own terrace. My experience at El Taj was one of the best vacation discoveries for me - otherwise, I do not write these reviews so often. We had plentiful space and privacy, very courteous service, our unit had a daily maid service, we were cooking in our own kitchen, and one time even called a private chef, who cooked a delicious dinner for 6 people at out unit for under $100. Combine that with the most amazing white sand beach right in front our windows, and 5 th Avenue by our side, and yes... we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “El Taj Review”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveller12345
Reviews.Content: 2 couples with college age children stayed there in March for Spring Break sharing a 3 Br/ 3BA oceanfront condo suite. The condo was new and spectacular with gorgeous views of the beach. Front desk service was excellent. The hotel is very well maintained and reasonably priced. The beachside restaurant was excellent. It is a pleasant 5 min walk to the bars, clubs and restaurants of a very attractive and friendly downtown. On the negative side, the pool is small, shaded and was chilly (it needs a heater in March). Ocean access is totally blocked by a lineup of fishing boats along the beach. You have to walk about 5 minutes to the South for ocean swimming. To the immediate north was a beach marred by extensive seaweed and sand-filled bags to control erosion. If ocean swimming is critical, you might be happier in a line of hotels about a 10-20 minute walk to the north; the beach itself at El Taj was very nice. Four out of 6 of us did experience Montezuma's revenge; bring Cipro, Imodium and Zofran. ( We didn't drink the water but we did eat freely in the restaurants...the unfortunate side of Mexico.) Playa is beautiful; I would go again. If you would like two side excursion, see Tulum...very interesting and go snorkeling off Cozumel. You don't need a rental car; there are taxies everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic luxury condos on the beach in the heart of playa”
Reviews.Author: beachsiders
Reviews.Content: stayed at le taj for 9 nights in april, this is the best chioce in playa if like us you hate all inclusive resorts, condos are really well appointed, very spacious and relaxing they have a gym and spa,, no noise from clubs close by, or neighbours. reception really helpful with excellent suggestions of restaurants- luna maya, cenacoli, very good, its impossible to go hungry in playa it has great coffee shops, icecreams, and restaurants- beach club indigo beach is excellent with comfy sunbeds and good size towels , food here -breakfast and lunch is also really good

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nathalieroberts
Reviews.Content: We have been to Playa del Carmen many times, this was our first time at the Taj. My husband and sons stayed for one week and enjoyed it very much. We made use of both pools, the jacuzzi, Indigo Beach, the concierge, etc. All staff were very helpful and friendly. My boys loved the pools and we enjoyed having the extra bedroom for them, as well as a washer/dryer on site. The location is great, between the beach and 5th Avenida. We were given a list of recommended restaurants, which gave us some new ideas. We will definitely stay at the Taj again!

Reviews.Title: “Service and accommodations equal to 5 start hotels in the US.”
Reviews.Author: Regs911
Reviews.Content: We travel to Playa regularly, if fact 4 trips last year and we have spent the past 8 spring breaks in Playa. Spring Break trips are always loaded with extra kids, this year we had 6 kids, actually young adults, ages 17 -25. We usually stay at one of the wonderful houses in Playacar Phase I to accommodate our crew. This year we stayed at El Taj Beachside 302 and all of our spring breaks have been great this was one "over the top". I cannot think of anything that would have made this trip more perfect. LOCATION. Whereas Playacar Phase I is about 3/4 mile south of "Playa Central". El Taj is Playa Central and beachfront. Great gourmet dining for the "old folks", that would be me and my wife is a short walk. The hottest bars are less than a block away which reassures these old folks our kids can make it home safely at 5 AM. I do not know how else to put it unless you are familiar with Playa, but the location alone makes this an ideal place to stay. SERVICE. Unparalleled. Each person I encountered, especially Frederick, truly wants to make your trip perfect. The service I received was very similar to the service at the Ritz or Four Seasons without the arrogance. There is a warmth and sincerity with the impeccable service. SAFETY. 24 hour attendant at the only entrance to this property. We never locked our door. Though I admit my own stupidity, I left my billfold on the nightstand when the maid was cleaning the unit and no one was "home". I never missed a penny. There are safes in the room, I just trusted our maid Elizabeth. ACCOMMODATIONS. These condos stand WAY apart from any other condos in Playa. The quality and maintenance is NOT available anywhere else in Playa. I'm sure Myakoba is equal in many ways but Myakoba is not in Playa and we love love to stay in Playa. BEACHSIDE VS BEACHFRONT. El Taj has 2 condo units and they share the same beach. We stayed beachside and the 50-75 yard walk was never a bother and I think the beachside units are actually larger. BEACH CLUB. This is actually sublet and not directly managed by El Taj. At least that is the impression I got. The food is great. At times, chairs and beach beds were a little tight; however, I always had a place to bask in the the sun. Although my kids are older, I saw many younger family who seemed to be experiencing the same pleasure. HIDDEN SECRET. A local restaurant Las Quesadillas just across a side street from El Taj has great, safe food for cheap. Chicken Quesadilla for 1.50 USD. Huge serving of guacamole made right before your eyes for 3.50 USD. THE GYM. We used it everyday. Nice gym. Spinning Classes with great spinners. Free. INTERNET/PHONE. Great deal. Some rooms it cost extra but if you purchase this package, the phone is international and allows you to call the states at no charge. This was great since we have elderly parents. As mentioned above, we have stayed in many wonderful places in Playa del Carmen but El Taj is in a category of its own. It has everything including a huge desire to please. NEGATIVE. The only negative is night time noise. Because it is in Playa Central, next to the hottest bars, the music is loud when these old folks are trying to sleep. Next time, I am taking a sound machine and ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “I will be going back to El Taj for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Superdupa80081355
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I vacationed at El Taj for 4 nights out of our 5 night vacation in Playa. We originally booked in to stay at a 5 sar all inclusive and then realized upon arrival our that our hotel looked nothing like the pictures had promised. The facilities were dirty and the food was not fresh. It was so comforting to find El Taj Condo Hotel. We had an amazing stay!!! The staff are very friendly the beach restaurant was a great place to chill out durring the day complete with hip music and a very contemporary ambiance. As a guest of the hotel you get complimentary access to the Euro beach beds and umbrellas which was a very nice surprise. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and equipped with everything that you need to make yourself feel at home like laundry facilities & dish washer . El Taj came to our rescue and helped to make our vacation very memorable. SJKR

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, service and facilities- great for teenagers too!”
Reviews.Author: Beaumonts04
Reviews.Content: What an amazing holiday! From the moment we were met at the airport, with our own personalized message board, to the cold towels, and water ready in the car for us, I could not believe the service. The concierge Teresa could not have been more helpful, as were all of the staff at the El Taj. With two teenage boys , we have a strict criteria of what works for us on holiday, we need local activities to keep them engaged, good food and lots of it:) without long drives out in the evening, and bedrooms with enough space for them to hang out- their own TVs and , of course, internet access! The El Taj provided all of this and more- from the moment you step in to the hotel, you realise that it has a quiet understated elegance. The condos are incredible- we stayed in #340, top floor penthouse and roof terrace with three beds, three baths- pure luxury! The beds were incredibly comfortable- despite earlier comments- I had some of the best night's sleep. The great deal on the privilege card- which we used every night to get a discount off the local restaurants. The boys did the ATV trip through the jungle- Teresa booked everything for us, and they really enjoyed it. We also did a private tour of Chichen Itza- where Teresa booked us a very comfortable car to take us there, and we had our own guide when we got there- much easier with teenage boys, who are not good at getting up at 7:40 am to get on the coach trip! We also tried out the hobie cat- which you can rent at the hotel next door. Our special treat was the private boat trip out snorkeling to Akumal- what an incredible place- and we felt spoiled having our own boat, lunch organised at a beachside bar- especially when we saw a pod of dolphins on our way home. I have been to many hotels over the years, traveled through Europe extensively and North America and this hotel has to be one of the best I have ever stayed at! We eat breakfast a couple of mornings down at the Beach Club- where the service again, was impeccable- they remembered which tea I liked and with milk- and were just so helpful. Best restaurants for us were: Yaxche, (ask for the cafe maya), Coccina 38- sticky toffee pudding:), La Casa del Aqua for the seafood platter( but watch the price there- it is expensive). Also liked 100 % Natural cafe on Ave 5- wonderful smoothies, and sandwiches freshly made, and very healthy. All the restaurants are steps away from the hotel- and such fun walking along Ave 5 at night, just to see the shops in full "barter" mode as you walk passed. Boys loved to practice their bargaining skills-. Can;t wait to go back. If you book this hotel, you will not be disappointed- get in early before it becomes too busy:)

Reviews.Title: “El Taj Rocks”
Reviews.Author: KarlWeissDenver
Reviews.Content: The El Taj is a beautiful report and the place to stay in Playa, especially if you are into the late night/early morning rave scene. The unit we stayed in (#312) sports several clubs as neighbors, and even if you choose not to go, the pounding beats of the techno music until 5 AM easily makes its way through the walls to you. So your best bet is to stay up all night and sleep during the day, or bring a comfortable set of earplugs for everyone. A beautiful resort, but our recommendation would be to only book a beach-side room away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: nbaytraveller53
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Playa and El Taj made it the best yet. When we arrived, we were met by helpful and attentive staff who immediately made us feel welcome and secure. Throughout our stay they continued to exceed our expectations. The location of El Taj could not be better. The ocean views are stunning and the beach immediately adjacent to the building. Fifth Avenue, with all if its tremendous shopping and fine cuisine is only a block away. We walked the beach for miles each morning, enjoying the beautiful weather and endless sand. We swam in the ocean and in the pool which was often surprisingly quiet. Our unit (#345) was extremely well appointed with quality throughout. It included three bedrooms, three balconies, a fully functional kitchen, and a huge rooftop terrace. The terrace included a jacuzzi, bbq, sofa, and palapa. The views were amazing. We were travelling with one other couple, but with the three bedrooms, balconies, large kitchen and living room area, and spacious rooftop terrace, this unit could accommodate three couples with ease. Although El Taj is close to some of Playa's night life, we found it very quiet and our sleep was never interuped. We cannot think of a single thing that could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: FormerCityGirl
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend El Taj! I've traveled extensively and stayed in a wide variety of accomodations (ranging from camping to the Four Seasons), and I would say that El Taj is an incredible value. My family (me, husband and two young boys, ages 6 and 8) stayed in a 2 bedroom unit on the beachside. The condo was stunning-- furnished impeccably, amenities galore, extremely clean. The location of the property is amazing, as you can walk everywhere but still maintain a sense of seclusion. We adored our breakfast each day at Indigo-- delicious buffet, fresh fruit, pastries, eggs made to order, steaming coffee. Yum. Plus feet in the sand. Can't be beat. The staff was lovely and helpful. We also used The Gym, which is a short walk away. Excellent facility, run by owners of Equinox. I took a yoga class on the beach one morning, which was great. To swim in the ocean, you do need to walk about 25 yards to the right, as there are fishing boats docked in front of the property. However, we didn't mind the stroll. Not a big deal, considering all the other perks. Also, on Friday/Saturday nights, the discos down the street can get loud. If you are not a sound sleeper, ask for a room as far as possible from the discos. My kids and I had no issues sleeping, but my husband did wake up once or twice during the night. I would also recommend La Sirena for ceviche. Our best meal of the trip. The owner was super cool, bought us a few shots (!) and cranked up the salsa. Totally fun.

Reviews.Title: “El Taj is Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Livefortravels
Reviews.Content: It was my third time visiting Playa and this was by far our best stay. Our stay in El Taj 314 completed the Playa experience. The magnificent condo with its unique decor and feel was just to our liking - exquisite, comfortable, spacious, clean, and perfectly located and equipped. The unit and its private patio give a secluded feel. The unit also overlooks a magnificent mosaique pool, adding to the superb ambiance. The beach club and gym are the best in Playa. Yoga and other classes are offered on the beach. Statf were extremely considerate. Fantastic location - all the best of Playa is within walking distance. The ambiance and flare of El Taj are truly the perfect complement to the Playa experience. Absolutely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: LindaAnn31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the EL Taj in Jan 2011 with a group of friends for our bachelor and bachelorette party. First off the condo place is beautiful and brand new. The décor is very Bali inspired and different than any hotel we have been too. Walking distance to all the beach clubs and 5th ave and resturants. When we just wanted to relax at the beach club at the condo place we had such a laid-back awesome time. the drinks were yummy and the food was delicious. The cheeseburger was one of the best I ever tasted on a vacation. The beach was clean and the water was beautiful. The pool was really nice but the sun didnt hit it during the day, it was mostly in the shade and it was about 85 degrees all week so we didn’t need to be in the shade. There was 10 of us total and some of our group had rented out the 3 bedroom oceanfront penthouse, 2 bathrooms. big livingroom and the kitchen was so nice. If i was going to cook i would of been very happy cooking in that kitchen. all stainless steal appliances and granite table tops. A large wrap around balcony and a big roof top level with a Jacuzzi and outdoor grill/ lounge area. Its def. wow and worth every penny!!! The other group had a room on the first floor which was also nice. The only thing that could of been better was the mattress. They are more on the firm side. One night i fell asleep on our balcony on the lounge chair and it was more comfortable. All in all it was one of the best vacations we have been on and January was the perfect time to get away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: lckane61
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful - there are 2 pools, one oceanside, one beachside. We stayed in a smaller unit which was nice, but I'd love to have stayed in one of the top floor units. The beach is nice, good service from the Indigo beach restaurant. And the location is perfect - steps to the beach, close to Avenida 5 with all the shops, restaurants and clubs. They provide a privilege card that can be used at a number of locations for a 10-15% discount, which we used quite a bit. Get up early if you want a lounge chair in the front row on the beach :) They have lots of beach umbrellas too which I greatly appreciated. The guacamole and shrimp tacos at Indigo Beach were very good - we generally ate lunch while lounging on the beach. Just a couple of minor complaints - our unit (303) had no shades, just white drapes which really let in the sun in the morning pretty early. Also there is no service at the beachside pool. It would be nice to be able to get a drink up there while hanging out in the hot tub :) We also faintly heard the music from the Blue Parrot, but it didn't keep us awake.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh...the perfect getaway.”
Reviews.Author: TRobinson220
Reviews.Content: I was celebrating a big birthday milestone with girlfriends and El Taj was the perfect setting. We choose a 3-bedroom, oceanfront penthouse with rooftop jacuzzi and it was ideal. The finishes and furnishings were top rate. Even the coffeepot was better than the one I have at home. We ate breakfast on our patio each morning, spent each day on the beach and our evenings on the rooftop overlooking the ocean. The staff was very accommodating even stocking the condo with groceries from a list we sent the week before. Teresa, our concierge, recommended a great snorkeling tour and shopping locations. Keiki and Carlos at the Indigo Beachclub were so attentive we felt like they were our own personal staff. Location was also perfect. Avenida 5 was only two blocks away - we never needed a taxi and never felt uncomfortable walking. Food at Indigo was very good - we ate lunch there almost every day. We also found a little eatery that caters to locals across the alley from El Taj called Las Quesadillas serving baja style tacos and quesadillas only 150pesos. Delicious and cheap. EraOra just up the street serves great Italian food. Beds are a bit hard for my taste, but I still slept well. I could hear the music from Blue Parrot at night but it wasn't enough to keep me awake and I'm a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A SPECTACULAR Stay in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Candice923
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Taj for two nights in the beginning of February, and it just wasn't long enough. The grounds are AMAZING. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The breakfast buffet at Indigo was the best breakfast I've ever had in Mexico. The room I stayed in with my assistant, a two bedroom condo, was absolutely magnificent. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “El Taj #345 was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: tpmurman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Penthouse unit #345 over the X-mas break and had the trip of a lifetime. El Taj had it all for us a great pool, the beach club and close proximity to shopping and excellent dining. El Taj is in the perfect location, and although on the same strip as numerous night clubs we all slept soundly as we couldn't hear a single thump of bass inside the well built 3 bed condo. After spending time at the beach, and pool we would retire to the rooftop terrace to enjoy the hot tub and spectacular views of the Caribbean while BBQ'ing in the outdoor kitchen. El Taj is truly 5 stars with excellent service and attentive staff, comfortable beds and furnishings, flat screens in each room; nothing has been left out. We can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing , Quiet , stunning views”
Reviews.Author: BILLYBOBJOE154913
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the El Taj ocean front Penthouse unit # 345 Not only was the room very well appointed in providing all that is needed for a comfortable stay , but you notice the qualtiy of workmanship in the entire condo is rarely seen in these parts, what you would expect in a high end establishment. The secluded roof top patio made evenings relaxing and peaceful in a private retreat . Barbeque , hot tub , with a spacious area allowing generous room for a complete full course dinner or just a night cap gazing up at the moon and stars. The area was situated down a quiet side street , away from the hussle and bussle of 5 ave. yet close enough if you wanted or needed anything . We never got tired of the gorgeous caribbean views out of every window. The friendly staff was more than helpful , english friendly , always eager to help if they could . We will have no problem coming here again , it's by far the nicest place we have ever stayed, not just for Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation...Need to see it for yourself”
Reviews.Author: Rosie155032
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Taj Oceanfront the week of February 7th, 2011, El Taj Oceanfront Unit #347 was incredible! The view of the Caribbean was amazing! The condo was in immaculate condition and pleasantly decorated. The service and staff was flawless. And the location was ideal, we tried different restaurant everynight. One I really recommend is the italian restaurant ERA ORA located near the condo, amazing food and friendly staff, I rate this Condo 5 out of 5! WOW! I would definately go back, miss it already....

Reviews.Title: “Good....not great”
Reviews.Author: gda141
Reviews.Content: Prior to our arrival I spoke with a reservations manager by phone and email, who was very prompt and helpful. I had reserved a one bedroom unit, but two weeks before our arrival I requested a specific one bedroom unit if it was available during our stay. I was told that they could not guarantee a unit assignment in advance, which I could understand and had no problem with. When we arrived and were checking in at the oceanfront building, there were two employees at the desk, One was helpful, and the other was not. When I asked which unit I would be in, I was told that it was not the unit that I had requested. Again, not a problem, I completely understood. Here is what bothered me a bit..........When I asked if the unit that I had inquired about was available, the one guy blew me off and was basically ignoring me. The second guy actually looked, and told me that the unit I had requested was available. I didn't pursue the matter any more, I just figured what the hell.....I was just happy to be on vacation. Our room was nicely appointed, and overall I liked it. What I didn't like was that the bed was very hard and uncomfortable, just as some previous reviews had stated. In general I liked the look and feel of the property. We didn't go to Indigo beach club which is on the property, since the reviews I read were not great, and there were many more options in the area. I would have to say that the best thing about this property is the location. It is very close to 5th ave. Another nice perk is that when you check in they give you a preferred club discount card, which gives you either a 10% or 15% discount at several bars and restaurants in Playa. We used the pool at both the oceanfront and beachfront buildings. Both were nice, but were small, and because of their location, did not provide much sun. Most people prefer the beach when in PDC, but for those that would rather lounge at the pool, this is not the place for you. If you stay here I highly recommend that you go to Era Ora italian restaurant which is right around the corner and is located on 1st Ave. between calle 12 and 14. Great food, great amosphere, and great service! Would I stay at this property again?..........possibly...but probably not. While it was nice, it wasn't great......but everyone has different taste. A few changes would make this place great. I would recommend this place beacuse of its location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: kh8110
Reviews.Content: My son told me about this property and believed in it so much that he organized for myself and a group of friends to stay here on a recent visit to Mexico. El Taj Oceanfront #345 was a spectacular property that my peers and myself enjoyed immensly. This 3-bedroom penthouse condo had a wonderful Caribbean view and a private rooftop terrace. The rooftop terrace provided privacy and yet allowed views over the city and ocean. There was a Jacuzzi, professional quality BBQ and dining area – the perfect place for an evening meal and relaxation for two or ten. The interior of the unit was spacious and comfortable with lots of space for storage and superior quality appliances and fixtures. The unit had balconies for every room and was quiet. The beds were delightful and if you just wanted to stay in and catch any sports there were televisions in every room. There was something for everyone in our group, There was a beautiful pool and the greenery was fantastic. The beach was just steps away and often we sat and watched many cruise ships sail to and from this port. Another great reason to stay at this wonderful place is its ideal location and its closeness to 5th Avenue which offers wonderful shopping, great entertainment and fantastic dining experiences. Would absolutely stay here again and would recommend this property to any adult group. Beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Gorgeous beaches, Beautiful condo complex!”
Reviews.Author: Ames16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the El Taj Oceanfront Penthouse. The unit in which we stayed included 3 bedroom with private rooftop terrace (jacuzzi, palapa, sofa, loungers, BBQ ).From the condo complex you could enjoy the breath taking scenery. Everything in the unit was elegant and clean. The location was perfect. Various shopping stores and restuarants within a block. The service at the El Taj was excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel complex”
Reviews.Author: Mark1234PittsburghPA
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the El Taj the week of 2/5. My wife and I with 3 young children stayed beachside in unit 307 with 2 bedrooms. My brother and his family stayed in unit 325 ocean front 3 bedroom penthouse. The location was excellent. For the money savings I actually preferred the beachside unit. Also,The 2 and 3 bedroom units are almost identical in layout and size. The difference is they made the bedrooms smaller in the 3 bedroom unit as well as the bathrooms. Our 2 bedroom units master bedroom was huge and the bathroom was very large with 2 sinks where as both the 2 bathrooms in the 3 bedroom unit were small. The beachside units walls had stone tile which was an added touch. They had white drywall in the ocean front units. The beachside pool was nicer than the ocean front pool. It was very quiet and private and made you feel like you were in a jungle setting with the many tropical plants and grass surrounding the pool. The dark blue tile in the beachside pool was amazing. Also, you only had to walk through a cross street, and walk through the ocean front condos lobby to get to the beach. The beach was great with the kids. The only downside is that the children cannot swim right in front of the hotel as there are fishing boats anchored there so you are not able to sit and watch your kids swim in the ocean from your beach chairs. We had to walk down the beach a bit to swim which we did not mind. The owner built a pier for the boats to be docked but the boat owners do not want to dock them there in fear they will become damaged hitting the docks by the waves. The boats are grandfathered to that location on the beach. The town and 5th avenue were just incredible. We took the kids out each night for shopping and ice cream. It is very safe. We recommend you get the chef service the concierge has available. Carlos, a private chef, will come to your condo and cook a authentic meal for you. He brings all his own ingredients and cooks in your kitchen. He will clean everything up as well. The food was some of the best we have ever had. The first night we had him cook we had tostados and tacos. It was an incredible meal and we were stuffed. The concierge had set up a pinatta for our childs birthday and filled it with candy for us. The service is hands on. For $35 we had them stock our condo with food,drinks and condiments. Just send them a list of what you want and they will stock your place for you. Lastly, the attention to detail and artifacts in both buildings was unbelievable. The wooden doors to the beach front entrance are 650 years old. The owner flew to polynesia/indonesia and picked out many items for his condos by hand. HOPE THIS HELPS. THE HONDRUS

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable!!”
Reviews.Author: BWH040
Reviews.Content: El Taj Oceanfront Penthouse Unit #345 was incredible! The view of the carribean was amazing! The condo was in immaculate condition and had a private roof-top patio. The service and staff was flawless. And the location was ideal. I rate this Condo 5 out of 5! WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but be careful how you book and what you pay”
Reviews.Author: SomeKindOfWonderful
Reviews.Content: I booked Taj Condo Hotel Beachside as part of a package with Expedia. First, note the confusing names of two adjascent properties: 'Beachside' is not beside the beach, but across a small road from the main hotel (supposedly its penthouses have ocean views, presumably looking over the top of other buildings). 'Oceanside', in contrast, is actually on the beach, and most of its units have water views (although the quality would vary, as some are set far back towards the road). The front desk service was friendly and efficient. I had two different maintenance problems with my unit, one serious (water pouring in the ceiling from the unit above) but maintenance staff responded quickly. My big disappointment was the unit itself - 303. It was clearly one of the least desirable units in the whole complex - ground floor, dark, at the very back corner of the complex, overlooking parked cars. The interior, while clean and organized, looked like a mid-range suburban American 'suite hotel' rather than what was on the website. The week I was here, there were many other empty rooms, including a far more attractive one-bed on Oceanside, but the desk would not let me change because I booked through Expedia and was assigned to one specific room. So buyer beware, especially on Expedia. The larger units, on higher floors, especially near the water, look spectacular. But for $300 a night or so, I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone and it's fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: suzieq
Reviews.Content: So, I went with 6 friends to celebrate my birthday (let's just say it was a big one). It was fantastic! We split up in two 2 bedroom condos, each with their own rooftops. The service from before we even got there was outstanding. Alejandra and Enrique were amazing, answering questions and offering their help with anything and everything. They arranged airport transportation for us, helped with the chef we had come cook for us 2 nights (Epicurean Chef...will go into this later) and were just generally very helpful. The entire place is just gorgeous. Lush, tropical, clean....just such a relaxing, zen vibe to it. The condo itself was beautiful, well appointed and clean! They have everything you would need, soaps, dishwashing detergent/sponge, laundry detergent even! The daily maid service was great too. The location was fantastic, as having 7 girls together, if a couple wanted to shop, they could walk to the shops around the corner. If you want to hang at the beach, you can, or go to the beautiful gym down the street (included). The Beach Club was great, really nice service, good food and your toes in the sand. The lounge chairs were actually super comfortable and the live DJ on the weekends were great. The place just has a mixed feel of Mexican/ European/Bali feel to it. Great mix of people from all over the world. The restaurants and clubs are very close by, we did go down the street one night and went dancing. That was really fun! There was a bit of the club music we heard in our unit at night. I am a light sleeper and it did bother me a bit, my friend is a heavy sleeper and she was fine. Our friends stayed on the other side of the condo and they didn't hear a thing. We were on the same side as the clubs. I was worried about it being a "family friendly place" seeing as we are all moms trying to get away! There were families and several kids, but never had the feeling that it was too much. In fact, several of us are planning on coming back with our families. Would be the perfect place to come with several families with kids the same ages. It is also the perfect place for a friends get away! The chef we got to cook for us was amazing. Carlos is Epicurean Chef Services did a fantastic job, and could not have been more accommodating. His wife Tani was fantastic as well. He made us the best margaritas ever, amazing guacamole...grilled shrimp and fish and homemade mole! Yummmm. My husband even had Carlos and Tani arrange for a Mariachi band and they had their friend make an amazing 4 leches cake with dulce de leche as a surprise for me! It was the best birthday ever! We were all really sad to leave, I am in a Mexicoma! I can't wait to go back!!! If you are going to go, use my vip code for friends and family and save yourself 10%. The code is vip327 and is good until the end of December 2011. All in all, an amazing trip to an amazing place with amazing people. I love the small "boutique" feel of it, as even the security guards were asking how I liked the mariachis the next day! So cute that everyone was so in tune with the "goings on" there. We also all felt very safe the entire trip. Can't wait to come back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Caribbean View Beachfront Penthouse”
Reviews.Author: icefield_123
Reviews.Content: We experienced nine wonderful days in Unit #345 El Taj Oceanfront - the best place we have ever stayed. This 3-bedroom penthouse condo had spectacular Caribbean views and a private rooftop terrace. The lush vegetation around the rooftop terrace provided privacy and yet allowed views over the city and ocean. Further, the rooftop terrace had a Jacuzzi, professional quality BBQ and dining area under the palapa – the perfect venue for an evening meal and relaxation. The interior of the unit was well appointed, spacious and comfortable with lots of space for storage and superior quality appliances and fixtures. The unit had balconies for every room and was quiet and private due to a clever floor plan. The boutique-style hotel was architecturally stunning with flowing curves, koi ponds and exotic detailing from around the world. Daniel and Theresa were notable members of the spectacular staff who made our stay easy and well attended to. All the staff were fantastic and friendly with our children. The concierge, Enrique, smoothly handled the logistics of our visit and guided us well in booking enjoyable, kid-appropriate excursions. Our children loved playing in the pool, which is nestled between the two wings of the hotel and the associated beach club. The El Taj Oceanfront is in an ideal location – on the beach and steps away from the best part of 5th Avenue. If I could give it 6 stars, I would.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: sonic02
Reviews.Content: The views are phenomenal, the service and staff are exceptional, the location is ideal and the architecture and details are absolutely gorgeous! Everything about El Taj Oceanfront makes it a true 5 star experience. We're definitely going again. We stayed in a beautiful 3 bedroom penthouse suite (unit #345) that had it's own private rooftop terrace. Even though we dined out most evenings, when we were trying to decide which restaurant we enjoyed the most, we concluded that the evening we barbecued under the stars on our rooftop terrace with the lights of Cozumel and cruise ships twinkling in the distance was by far our most memorable. It was wonderful to relax in the Jacuzzi and enjoy a glass of wine to end the evening. The unit was spacious and very nicely decorated and there were all of the amenities that we needed. All of the appliances were stainless steel and we particularly liked the convenience of having our own washer and dryer. There was even laundry detergent, fabric softener and dishwasher soap in the unit. Both of the pools were very nice on a hot sunny day but we enjoyed them even more in the evening when the soft lighting on the gentle curves of the building created a soothing backdrop. We didn't use the free gym until later in our stay and we were very impressed with the quality of the facility so we plan to use it more and take part in some of the free classes on our next visit. The beach club was one of the best that we have ever seen and the service was first class. The location is great, right on the beach and only a short walk to 5th Avenue. We walked everywhere and only once had to take a taxi to return with groceries from Walmart. Although the location was right in the heart of the tourist zone, we could never hear any of the club noise in our unit and it always felt like we were returning to a quiet oasis after a late dinner at one of the many nearby lively restaurants. As we were leaving we thanked the concierge for all of his help and advice and told him that he will see us again next winter.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: spalady50
Reviews.Content: If you're the type that likes to get to the beach in no time, enjoy newer facilities and great hospitality, likes to walk and experience culture this hotel is for you. We're staying in the El Taj oceanfront. It is so close to all the activities and yet feels far. Our room has a side view from the front terrace # 342 of the beautiful turquoise ocean. The hotel is Balinese inspired with many beautiful touches and mostly curved walls ( good feng shui) We enjoy swimming in the pool at the El Taj Oceaside,( a few feet away) since it's bigger and it has a heated jacuzzi, the entire week, we were the only ones there. When we arrived we went to Walmart ( a longer walk or very short cab ride) to stock up on snacks, beer and sandwich supplies. We were given the choice of including a breakfast (@ $12 a day) I would have rather not since we will not use two days. One we went on a tour to Chechen Itza and left early and it was not open yet and the last day we will also leave too early. The breakfast eggs are VERY good, try huevos rancheros and chilaquiles. The portions are enough to satisfy and nourish, not the size that we Americans are used to, which could feed 4! About Massages- I had a very nice massage at the the spa for $55 by Flor and a also a nice massage by Tere at Teres massage ( half a block away) toward Blue Parrot for $35, she runs her one woman show from her rented spot, it's a small place and shes been there 8 years. I'm a spa owner, and both are professional to American training standards. At the spa ( nicer decor) make sure you pay with dollars or pesos, if you want to use a credit card, you pay 11% more to cover credit fees. I was talking to an American at the pool and we said we would write a nice review but we're afraid when we want to book, there won't be availabilities ;-) You won't regret being here. hurry up a reserve! I am writing while feeling the tropical breeze. OH, forgot WIFI is $50 a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great beachfront hotel in playa”
Reviews.Author: iggyPrinceton_nj
Reviews.Content: We just spent a little under a week at el taj and overall were very happy with our stay. The place is beautiful and very clean. We stayed in an oceanfront room and had a great view of the ocean and were just steps away from the beach. Super comfortable chairs were a plus. Pool/jacuzzi too cold to really spend anytime in. Would be nice if these were heated. Didn't really care for the food at the indigo restaurant. For the price way better places to eat on 5th. Drinks were good although not strong but this seems to be the case with most places we went. Did make use of a discount card they give for certain restaurants. Both my husband and I really enjoyed our meal at yaxche. We loved being able to walk right to the restaurants/shops. Yes being bombarded while walking down the restaurant to come into a restaurant or being asked if we wanted a massage or if we wanted cuban cigars was annoying but we just said no or just kept walking. Overall we really enjoyed playa and will def be returning and would def stay again at el taj.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: kcOblues
Reviews.Content: El Taj Oceanside is one of the best kept secrets in Playa del Carmen! The service was impecable - Carlos, you're the man! - the beaches were kept groomed - Indigo Restaurant is 5 star, the massages on the beach - top notch and the location - right on the Carribean - and 2 blocks from shopping and food. Thank you for an AWESOME relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Couln't have been more PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: mdtraveler110
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Taj for 3 nights in January and it wasn't long enough! My husband and I were looking for a place to have our wedding in Mexico and stumbled across El Taj here on Trip Advisor. After searching for months, we picked El Taj and are so glad that we did. We had 15 guests traveling from the US and 14 local guests that came to the wedding which we held at Indigo Beach, the restaurant at El Taj. The condos were a great way for our guests to enjoy a larger space and really feel at home. We had two condos next to each other that had shared access to our penthouses. We even cooked dinner for our entire wedding group the night before on our rooftop. This place is a tropical paradise. The best location in Playa! We could walk 5th avenue during the day for shopping and drinks but still be secluded at the hotel. You could hear the nightclubs nearby on your balcony but as soon as you shut the door to your unit the sound was gone. Our entire family cannot wait to go back to El Taj. My husband and I moved to an all inclusive for our honeymoon and we truly regretted it. The entire honeymoon we talked about how much we missed being at El Taj. It is absolutely the best place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Diny_Flo
Reviews.Content: First time to Playa Del Carmen and I want to come back to the El Taj. The El Taj provided everything my friends and I needed and it was all perfect: the service, friendliness, ocean view, ocean sounds, beach, hot tub and the Indigo food and drinks. I loved the pools and had a great massage on the beach. I never slept better, loved the beds. El Taj is located so conveniently to all the entertainment and shops and yet when at the El Taj one feels taken to another world of relaxation and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: rmasil
Reviews.Content: El Taj was great. Check in was seamless and the service, when needed, was excellent. The location was perfect; near everything. First time in Mexico that we did not have a car, but did not need it. We had lots of trips planned, but the kids were entertained (in the hot tub, on the beach or in the pool) the entire time, so ventures away were not needed. The only issue we had, which had nothing to do with El Taj, was the late night/early morning disco music from the Blue Parrot and their adjacent neighbor, which took away from ambiance of the beach...none the less, it was always a party on the beach leading up to New Years, which was entertaining. We cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience!”
Reviews.Author: arogal1
Reviews.Content: Have been to Playa del Carmen 3 of the last 4 years, but always at a resort outside of town. Deciding to stay in the town itself and choosing the right place took careful consideration. Following the advice of friends (and checking reviews on Trip Advisor), we booked El Taj and can enthusiastically state what a terrific decision we made. From the amazingly helpful Eduardo on the 800 res line to the Front Office staff, everyone was concerned that we were happy and no request was disregarded. We liked our rooms (especially the terrace), it came with a private hot tub; the Indigo Restaurant at the beach had wonderful food and service. Don't miss breakfast and be sure and try the guacamole/chips and the wood oven pizzas. Everyone is cheerful and helpful. A few tips. Bartenders in Mexico pour to an ounce measure, so we learned quickly to order doubles (or a side shot to pour in) especially when ordering tropical type or margarita drinks, otherwise they were too weak. We did this in clubs, restaurants, everywhere. There is a lot of excellent food, but certain restaurants stand out. For example, Cocina 38 is a restaurant not to be missed whether with a group or as a couple. The hotel has a Privilege Card that gives a discount at a group of restaurants, USE THEIR LIST, you won't regret it. Same with their in house spa services including beach massages- and the gym nearby is free and totally modern. This is the place to be and we won't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fun trip with luxury accomodations right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: rickywarman
Reviews.Content: The Taj is the perfect place to stay with my wife and teenage or adult kids. It is located right on the beach and on the heart of Playa del Carmen where the day and nightlife take place.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jim1027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Taj for two weeks over Christmas and New Years. We loved all of our time at El Taj in every respect. The location is the best in Playa del Carmen. The facility is the best in every way. .. clean, professional staff, etc. We had full use of the Indigo Beach Club and The Gym, also the best in Playa. We used the concierge service to enhance our days. Overall this was our best time in the Mayan Riviera and it started with El Taj. Gracias.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: ExpatinChile
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 10 day stay at El Taj and my husband said while we were there; normally, when he is at a hotel, he is admiring all the other accommodation options and wishing we were staying there, but this time, we were at the place everyone wanted to stay. It really was the best place to stay in Playa. We stayed in room 307 at the beachside which suited us fine. The weather wasn't the best while we were there, so we loved that the pool at beachside was enclosed so you couldn't feel the wind and it was slightly heated and the jacuzzi was very warm. We tried swimming at the oceanfront pool a few times, but the wind coming off the ocean made it cold. You can use both pools though, when staying at either El taj place, which is great, as both are nice. We were travelling with a 16month old and a 4 year old, so the two bedroom accommodation suited us great. It isn't a holiday if I have to stay in a hotel room with my kids in the room with me! All the furniture and appliances are new and great quality. And there is a washing machine and dryer in room 307, which is handy with kids. We stayed over christmas and new years eve, so we heard the worst there was of the loud music from the nightclub strip. Neither el Taj places are adjoining any nightclubs. Both adjoin other hotels, but they are very close to the nightclub strip. Maybe 50meters away. However in our room, we couldn't hear the noise at all. At beachside, all the main bedrooms face in towards the pool, so it blocks a lot of sound. The kids room faced over the empty block behind, which got a lot more noise, but nothing that you couldn't sleep through. It never affected the kids. It really wasn't loud enough. The location of El Taj is also perfect. I was actually surprised how close beachside was to the beach. I had thought it would be further away, but seriously, it took all of about 30 seconds to get to the beach. Across the small road (more like a laneway) and you walk straight through El Taj oceanfront. And it is fantastic being so close to 5th Ave. We didnt' want to stay at an all inclusive resort, as being able to walk down 5th Ave every night and discover new restaurants is so much a part of the fun. Or if you wanted to stay in one night, there are plenty of home delivery options. We could walk to 5th Ave in about 2 minutes. It really is perfectly located between the beach and the activity of 5th Av. The Indigo beach club was also great. It is breakfast buffet only and drinks up until 1pm though, but then lunches were great (albeit small), service good and great location. So that is about it I think to sum up. There is obviously no kids club, which some people want, but we wouldn' t have used it anyway. We also got the concierge to organize babysitting a few nights which was easy. It is US$20 and hour, which hurts when you live in South America and babysitting costs 1/4 of that, but both girls we had were professional (from some agency, not directly employed by the hotel). I would easily say for people that have kids and hate pokey hotel rooms, this is by far the best place to stay. Oh yeah the internet wifi was also good. It costs US$50 for the week and includes free international phone calls. And we hired a car for 3 days and parking underneath is also free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and top notch quality”
Reviews.Author: Moss333
Reviews.Content: Convenient location in the heart of Playa del Carmen and only one block from the beach. Exceptional quality in the unit and grounds outside. Penthouse units include a large private rooftop with sunning area, hot tub, and barbecue. Some units have better views than others. Only negative is the loud music heard from the Blue Parriott and other clubs a block away but the unit soundproofing blocks out 90% of the late night noise and it was a minor issue overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: localit
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at El Taj to celebrate a big b-day for my wife and could not have been more pleased with our choice. The complex is in a perfect location in paradise and the condo itself was amazing with post card views. We have stayed at some of the nicer ai's, boutique hotels and condos in Playa and El Taj topped them all. We will be back for sure! Some standout places to eat La Cueva del Chango is a must for breakfast Carboncitas for their Al pastor tacos among other things Wicky's - pricey for dinner ( but amazing) and reasonable for lunch El Fogon - Authentic mexican (off the strip)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way - location, rooms, beach, service, food!”
Reviews.Author: martini1946
Reviews.Content: We've been to Playa del Carmen three times and to other resorts on the Mayan Riviera three times and without question, El Taj is the most amazing place we have stayed. From the moment the car meets you at the airport (wonderful Fernando with the cool facecloths and bottles of water) to the greeting at check in (lovely and helpful Teresa) arriving at El Taj was a breeze. Check In was handled quickly and professionally, with all of our keys and support material ready to go when we arrived. Our bags were whisked to our room, a two-bedroom; two-bathroom suite (#308) overlooking the black pool. The suite was stunning - every room more lovely than the one before. The balcony felt very private because of the design and decor. There wasn’t anything lacking in the suite, as far as amenities go. There was a water cooler which came in very handy for both cold and hot water. There is wonderful Mexican coffee provided and Splenda. Unfortunately no real sugar so we picked some up at the market just up the street. The bathrooms were both very large and beautifully appointed. Housekeeping did a great job keeping our suite clean, although we did not request our room to be serviced every day. We spent each day at the El Taj beach - most comfortable lounge chairs on the Mayan Riviera! Great service from the Indigo Beach Club and although we only ate one breakfast there and one lunch, the food was excellent both times. Don't miss the calamari and the fish ceviche. El Taj's location is absolutely perfect - two blocks from the main pedestrian street and right on the beach. The hotel is serviced by a gym about 1/2 a block away and it's a really great facility with all of the machines and weights you'd want. We didn't try the spa but it looked lovely. There are two pools although we only used the one near the beach - it's breathtaking. Really, there are too many wonderful things about El Taj to describe them all. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy1983
Reviews.Content: El Taj is, in my opinion, now the best place to stay in Playa. The location is perfect, right on the beach between 12-14, the rooms are spacious, gorgeous, and very well appointed, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the beautiful beach is just steps away. Rooms: Simply put, I've never stayed in a better room. Our unit (#356) was a one-bedroom condo with a stove, fridge, cooking/eating utensils, HUGE couch, two flat screens with digital cable, floor to ceiling window in bedroom, big lovely bathroom, shower, big King Bed. The decor is a fusion of contemporary and tropical Balinese that blends really well. *nicks: bed is REALLY firm and pillows are huge a clunky. This didn't bother me but my girlfriend had to use a couch pillow. * notes: I would recommend asking for square footage when requesting available rooms. We learned that there was a 300 sq ft difference between equally priced one-bedroom units that you can't really discern from the pictures. So naturally we choose the largest one (#356 - 860 sq foot). Beach (Indigo Beach Club): The beach is beautiful, the day beds are heavenly and the food/drinks are overall good. *nicks: There are boats directly in front the resort so you need to stroll down the beach a bit or swim in between them. The chicken satay from Indigo was tiny. Not enough food for a single person appetizer. Pool/Jacuzzi: Well they look beautiful. But they are not heated and get no sunshine after noon, so we never stepped foot in. But we are beach people anyway. Service/Staff: Excellent. Everyone is so friendly! We had a few issues with our door lock and phone, and the staff fixed both in a timely manner. Security was very prevalent and premises were secure 24 hours. The only drawbacks: cool pools, no ice machine, fishing boats on beach, no room service or food for dinner. The positives: EVERYTHING ELSE. Love this place! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TequliaSunrise
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel the Caribbean extensively and with out hesitation can say that the El Taj is the best we have stayed at. The rooms are actually condos and are appointed with details you would find in any luxury designer home...high end stainless appliances, fine linens and Henckles cutlery are nice touches. The house keeping staff was beyond belief....how anyone can clean a complete 2 bedroom 2 bath condo to like new condition each day is beyond me. The front desk staff Daniel and Hector would complement any Four Seasons Hotel. The bell captain Daniel was also top shelf, as was Carlos at the Indigo beach club...which was a Zen like experience. We stayed in unit 329. The views from our oversized balcony of the pool, Jacuzzi, beach club and ocean were breath taking. The location of the hotel to the all of the restaurants, shopping and night clubs was perfect...never had to rent a car or even take a cab. We could walk to anywhere we wanted to go easily. A side note; to those apprehensive to travel to Mexico.....Playa Del Carmen is as safe as any ivy league college town in the U.S.... my wife and i eat late and on many occasions we returned well after 1:00 am and walked just about ever side street and was never met with anything but a hello. It was a little surreal. There was always someone to meet you at the front door and security guards were highly visible and friendly 24/7. I would never think about staying anywhere else but the El Taj and cant wait to return to visit my new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: DTinRI
Reviews.Content: We were staying at "another" hotel in Playa, one with good reviews and nice pictures on their web site. But the first day walking on the beach we came across El Taj and immediately knew we needed to stay here for the remainder of our trip ! We asked the front desk if we could see what the rooms looked like and they were very happy to do so .... SIMPLY INCREDIBLE !!! Not only is it a fantastic place in a fantastic location ... the staff is the best I have ever seen ... Especially Teresa at the reception desk and Daniel who helped us up to the room. The worst part about our stay here was the day we had to leave and go back home ! When looking for a place to stay in Playa ... this is THE Place !

Reviews.Title: “AmAZZZZZZing”
Reviews.Author: lauralie15
Reviews.Content: I was at the El Taj in early November for a friends birthday and it was one of the best experiences I've ever had. The rooms were GORGEOUS and SPACIOUS., the SERVICE was top notch. I, unfortunately cant remember the name of the person that took care of us on the beach, but he was stellar, he was attentive and always had a smile on his face. If there was a problem it was dealt with immediately. I really can't say enough good things about this place. I think my friends are going back in February and I can't wait. YIPEEEE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best beach condo in Playa!!”
Reviews.Author: nicoleanne
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the most amazing holiday at El Taj. The condos are in the best location in Playa, right on the beach with beautiful white crystal sand and all the beach activities you could wish for next door. We had the best restaurants, bars and shopping along 5th Ave at our doorstep! The beautifully designed rooms are very modern and stylish with a lovely ambiance and the king size bed was so comfortable we didn't want to leave! Thanks to all the friendly and extremely helpful staff who made our holiday so enjoyable. We haven't stopped talking about El Taj and cannot wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique condo with architectural significance and service in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: malmodova
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Playa del Carmen. We saw these condos from the beach on our second trip and kept thinking "WE GOTTA STAY THERE!" Well, we did and LOVED it! The building is very modern and new, the rooms are immaculately cleaned every day and the staff was super helpful and friendly. Also, "the gym" is a serious gym with LOTS of equipment, athletic classes and a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful penthouse on the beach with rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: Frank155004
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El Taj Oceanfront, Unit 354, a spectacular condo with a beautiful view of the ocean. Located in the heart of Playa del Carmen, I highly recommend this building and its great ambiance, outstanding service and fantastic restaurant. The atmosphere is quiet and sophisticated, the condo was immaculate - very comfortable with a georgeous setting. The El Taj has it all!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!! - gorgeous, beautifully appointed, fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: daveninc
Reviews.Content: Felt like I was on an exotic island ... decor from Bali, beautiful appointments, wonderful amenities, spacious and comfortable rooms, beautiful beach, very good restaurant on premises, beautiful gym, suburb service. All in all, a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the El Taj, BEST views, location and attentive staff…”
Reviews.Author: CINYC
Reviews.Content: LOVE the El Taj, BEST views, location and attentive staff… El Taj is PARIDISE and I highly recommend anyone to stay here! It's beautiful, small, and the staff is very friendly getting to know you on a first name basis. Having never been to Playa and traveling with a group of 9 friends for a girls birthday trip sex in the city style, it can be a bit difficult to meet everyone’s needs. We booked two condos 340 Oceanfront 3BR Penthouse and 333 Oceanfront 3BR 1st floor. These condos were EXACTLY how they appeared on the website with many added extras. The sound of the ocean breaking, the Thai Chic beautiful décor and objects around, manicured grounds and a staff eager to please! This hotel is RIGHT ON THE BEACH. Unobstructed OCEAN VIEWS that can’t be beat. The beds were hard but comfortable. Luxurious bedding. Plasma TVs with satellite in every room, AC pumped, wrap around terraces with many seating areas. This place is phenomenal! The location could not be beat. In the center of all the action. We didn’t have to take a taxi at all. I emailed the concierge staff in advance with many varied requests. Emails back were responded to quickly with very detailed information. Some of the requests included grocery service. I sent a list of 30+ items and everything was in my condo upon arrival. We used the hotel recommend transportation. Drivers were waiting with my name in large bold easy to find. Vehicles were clean and drivers very professional. Check in quick. Other requests included Chef Services. We used Carlos and Tania from Epicurean Chef. What a nice couple and phenomenal meal. Sangria, Margaritas, appetizers, grilled freshly caught fish on our rooftop terrace. Is this for real?? I mean it just kept getting better. The Concierge staff here went above and beyond any 5 star properties. Whatever you need they were eager to please. Special thanks to DANIEL who spent an entire day finding a type of wine then going to pick it up on his own personal time. Oh and birthday cake needed.. Not a problem. Daniel will go to the bakery to get it. Dinner reservations with prime table space at Fusion hotel - DONE. Anything we wanted we received. Also special thanks to ERIC S. Eager to answer any of the 101 questions we had. Make dinner recommendations, nightlife suggestions. ANYTHING! Also thanks to Hector, Frederick and Flor. I mean I feel like the El TAJ staff is part of my family! The location also couldn’t be beat. One block from 5th avenue and all the shops and restaurants. Though close to all the 12th street clubs and action, I never heard a sound at night. Except from the Ocean! Oh and no bugs!! Not one mosquito, fly or anything. We also used the Maya Spa at one of the sister properties. Incredible massage and body wrap at a reasonable price. The gym is comparable to Equinox in NYC where we live. Indigo restaurant and the staff especially Juan, also fantastic. Our condo included daily breakfast. Delicious coffee, incredible omelets and fresh bread. The lunch food was also delicious, best Guacamole, Fried Calamari, Tuna Sashimi and Thin crust pizza. Loved the Buddha bar type music playing and the comfortable beds. The only negative was some construction going on at the Pier in front. Nothing the El Taj could do. The Gran Portal Real was nearby to the left and I see the rave reviews but it looked like the hotel was close to falling into the ocean. Many sandbags holding the beach dunes. The chairs there all close together with a lot of “pink” looking people. I mean this is Mexico, how about some sunblock! The beach in Playa is magnificent. Some friends took the 8:30am Yoga on the beach class. Wonderful! I’m still in shocked that in my world travels I have not been to playa sooner. The local people here are the nicest I have ever met!! The only rude person was some Canadian guy trying to sell us Coco Bongo tickets on the beach. Safety... not a concern at any point of the day or night and we were on the beach for an early am run and walking home from the bars in the wee hours. The El Taj also had security at night on the beach and the perimeter was roped off. Other notable restaurants during our stay: LA PARILLA - very touristy but GREAT drinks and decent food. FUSION – good meal, great entertainment and how nice to sit with your feet in the sand (similar to the Office in Cabo), so so service but the management could not be more apologetic. SEASON - BEST MEAL. Juan and his staff were very accommodating. NYC style restaurant and atmosphere. Lobster, steak, wine, beautifully presented and Delicious! COMO COMO – Italian, homemade pasta small place very crowded. Also highly recommend. For Drinks, frequently the DESEO.. bartender’s also knew us on first name basis. Great drinks and atmosphere. Went to Coco Bongo. MUCH better than expected. Moulin Rouge experience. Had bottle table service which made difference. A representative came to the El Taj and I pre picked and paid for my liquor selections. Also LA SANTERNA.. great outdoor space and dancing after Coco Bongo. REINA ROYAL – Funky place like you walked into an Old Navy Commercial and the Blue Parrot of course. Shopping – great ceramic shop on the corner. Close by the Tequila factory and bazar for souvenirs. Lots of bargaining to be had if you are in the mood. Playa itself had a very international feel. Many times we felt we were in a seaside village in Spain like Sitges or Porto Banus. We met tourists from around the world. In summary, I highly recommend the El Taj for all of the reasons above. This is absolutely the best place to stay in playa!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting, stellar service”
Reviews.Author: fdrnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 9 other friends for a birthday over a long weekend. El Taj is in a great location, near Coco Bongo (look it up) and wonderful restaurants. We had 340-the 3 bed 3 bath beachfront duplex penthouse and 333-a 3 bed 3 bath first floor beachfront. The atmosphere is quiet, sophisticated and exclusive--not like one of the huge hotels nearby. The condos are furnished with high-quality, tasteful furniture with very comfortable beds. We had 2 private terraces that overlooked the beach and the hotel stocked our fridge upon request with drinks, fruit, yogurt, etc. Eric and Daniel at the front desk arranged everything from a suprise birthday cake to a chef-prepared meal at our condo. The beachfront restaurant, Indigo, was staffed by hard-working, always smiling gentlemen. They were quick to deliver a drink, put up an umbrella or offer a menu. There is only one thing that I would change: there are boats docked on the beach right in front of the hotel so you don't have the unobstructed view of the water and one has to walk down a ways to get into the water. I really wouldn't change anything else.

Reviews.Title: “great ambience, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: stephenj577
Reviews.Content: My room was right next to the beach..walking distance to everything..enjoyed the restaurant in the building for breakfast, they brought my lunch out to the beach..used their gym around 5 pm then walked to dinner..rocking night life a block away but as soon as you enter the grounds of the condo you can't hear a thing..very relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect place in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Austin502
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple booked Unit 308 at El Taj after hearing about it from friends. It was perfect...king sized beds in each bedroom, beautifully done with all the comforts of home, and the most gorgeous setting imaginable. From coffee on the terrace in the morning overlooking the pool and gardens, to the beach club right in front of us in the afternoon, to dinner on 5th Avenue (2 blocks away) in the evening, there was nothing more we could have asked for. By the way, it was also immaculate with great maid service. Perfect, perfect place in Playa! We will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo in the heart of Playa !”
Reviews.Author: voycontodo
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at El Taj with 5 of my friends for a birthday celebration. It is a fantastic alternative to the resort setting. The location is just amazing-right in the heart of playa and on the beach. They make everything so easy for you. When you book, you can see pictures of the indiviual units (and the pictures are true respresentations.) We had a penthouse unit which is a fantastic option because you get your own large patio (with BBQ if you like to cook on vacation - we prefer to have someone do it for us and being right in playa gives you unlimited restaurant options.) It rained most of one of the days and we hung out under our rooftop palapa and had a ball. By our request, they did some groceries for us so that we didn't have to worry about it when we got there. Beach chairs and Bali beds were always available. Service and food at Indigo Beach Club was incredible. The gym is the nicest I've seen in any of my travels. I would definitely recommend El Taj !

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: ceeryweery
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend, couldn't have asked for better. Stayed in Unit 355, beautiful 1 bedroom with fantastic private balcony on 3rd floor with beautiful views of the ocean. Very quiet at night even though it is right beside all the nightlife. Gardens are beautiful and the location is right on the beach which is just gorgeous. The pools are fabulous with the spa/jacuzzi seats in the upper pool which overlooks the pool and ocean, Incredible. The staff are very accommodating with lovely beachside restaurant with good food and good prices. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Playachica22
Reviews.Content: El Taj has it all. I'll begin with their excellent location ~ directly on the beach and in the heart of playa del carmen close to great restaurants, activities, shops and bar/clubs. Once you walk inside the grounds of El Taj you feel like you are in a different world with materials brought in from Bali , an amazing infiniti pool and plants lining the terraces. The service is outstanding. Beach club includes a variety of lounge chairs (the most comfortable style i must add), sitting areas and palapas. Beach service is provided by Indigo Blue (their beach club/restaurant). Try their amazing pineapple cured tuna ceviche with homeade beet chips. The construction is amazing ~ once you are in your residence it is completely silent ~ i slept so well. I also felt very safe as they have security 24/7. It was simply perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, service so-so”
Reviews.Author: zjpuk
Reviews.Content: The good: Beautiful condo complex with well-appointed modern and stylish decor Marble bathrooms, comfortable beds Stylish and functional kitchen Phenomenal food at Indigo Restaurant Conveniently located two blocks from 5th avenue and beach is at your door step Beautiful and well-kept pool Gorgeous patio and lovely views Few of the staff were very warm and helpful Daily maid service thorough The bad: Loud music from clubs can be heard in room until 3 am Booked the luxury car service for airport transfer ($195) and was assured by telephone that the vehicle was high end, which it was at pick up (Escalade) however drop off was a junky old van Musty smell in living room Requested linens, however was told by front desk that he would "look into it". Never received a follow up, and the linens either Service at beach club incredibly slow (30 minutes and 3 requests unheeded until front desk staff intervened) One of the waiters at the restaurant incredibly rude One of the front desk ladies incredibly rude Beach right in front of hotel is docked by boats so you have to walk down a bit to actually swim Although there are always glitches in every establishment, we feel for such a luxury condo/hotel, over-looking some of the above mentioned details are unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: tsanchez34
Reviews.Content: This Condo Hotel is magically situated in the center of the city action in playa del Carmen. Amenities are great beautiful pool beautiful views of the beach and great adjacency to 5th street full of shopping and wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: Lkpax
Reviews.Content: Very nice location with beautiful views. The building, maintenance, and security are some of the best I've seen in Playa. Stayed in unit 339 and the views are magnificent. The restaurant downstairs Indigo is wonderful and Roger is the best. Breakfast $13.00 for an incredible buffet. I would love to see the condos able to order and bill the restaurant to their room. Service great, views great, accommodations the best I've seen in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: camalabbla
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children and I recently stayed at the El Taj Ocean condos (August 2010). The condo (357) was exactly as depicted in its photos--nicely decorated, clean, neat and accomodating. The layout was very amenable to a family staying there as the 2 bedrooms were separated by the living area and kitchen. The private balcony between the two bedrooms was helpful as it allowed the children to go "outside" but not wander. Having a washer and dryer on site as well as the refrigerator with basic kitchen items was helpful with the children as we were able to pack lighter and do some laundry while there and buy some groceries to have milk, juice and other children friendly snacks on hand. The condo had daily maid service which helped tremendously with the beach sand that we inevitably tracked in despite our efforts. The condo also had 3 thermostats--1 in each bedroom and 1 in the common area--very helpful! The only change I would make to the condo interior would be to change the shower head in the master bath as it sprays all over the place and cannot be adjusted. The private rooftop deck and jacuzzi are very nice. We shared access to the roof with another unit (via a stairway), but once on the roof, there were two separate areas with some privacy. We did have difficulty getting the jets on the jacuzzi to work, unfortunately. As for the El Taj facility, it is still new and in very good shape. The pool is beautiful and the perfect size for the the number of units and guests. It was never very crowded. The beach club outside El Taj Ocean was more crowded, presumably because it allowed access to those staying at other El Taj properties. Obtaining beach towels was usually an ordeal as the attendant never seemed to be at the station, and on one occasion, ran out of towels. The proximity of this property to the beach can't get any better--take three steps out the pool and you're in white sand. We did find the elevator (we were on the 4th floor) to be rather slow and very hot. (Apparently, it is not air conditioned.) There is a restaurant on site at El Taj Ocean where we had breakfast. I wouldn't recommend it for a family with small children. It's a buffet style from 8 a.m.-12 p.m. The "cold" breakfast items sit on the bar during this time which means bees fly to the muffins with honey and the milk (powdered milk made liquid) is room temperature. The breakfast was about $10 a person, but since our kids just ate the little boxes of cereal and/or toast, it wasn't really worth it.
